original: tvamagne dyubhistvamāśuśukṣaṇistvamadbhyastvamaśmanas pari
analyzed: tvam agne dyubhiḥ tvam āśuśukṣaṇiḥ tvam adbhyaḥ tvam aśmanaḥ pari
translated: Thou, O Agni, with thy flames, thou with thy flashes, thou from the waters, thou from the stone,

original: tvaṃ vanebhyastvamoṣadhībhyastvaṃ nṛṇāṃ nṛpate jāyase śuciḥ
analyzed: tvam vanebhyaḥ tvam oṣadhībhyaḥ tvam nṛṇām nṛpate jāyase śuciḥ
translated: Thou from the woods, from the plants, thou, O lord of men, art born pure.

original: tavāgne hotraṃ tava potraṃ ṛtviyaṃ tava neṣṭraṃ tvamagnid ṛtāyataḥ
analyzed: tava agne hotram tava potram ṛtviyam tava neṣṭram tvam agnidh ṛta āyataḥ
translated: Thine, O Agni, is the Hotar-ship, thine the office of the Potr, thine the office of the Neṣṭr, thou art the Agnīd, thou of the Ṛtas,

original: tava praśāstraṃ tvamadhvarīyasi brahmā cāsi gṛhapatiśca no dame
analyzed: tava praśāstram tvam adhvarīyasi brahmā ca asi gṛhapatiḥ ca naḥ dame
translated: Thine the office of the Praśāstr, thou officiatest as Adhvaryu, and thou art our Brahman and lord of the house in our house.

original: tvamagna indro vṛṣabhaḥ satāmasi tvaṃ viṣṇururugāyo namasyaḥ
analyzed: tvam agne indraḥ vṛṣabhaḥ satām asi tvam viṣṇuḥ uru gāyaḥ namasyaḥ
translated: Thou, O Agni, art the king, the bull of the good, thou art Viṣṇu, the far-striding, to be worshipped,

original: tvaṃ brahmā rayivid brahmaṇas pate tvaṃ vidhartaḥsacase purandhyā
analyzed: tvam brahmā rayi vid brahmaṇas pate tvam vidhartar sacase purandhyā
translated: Thou art Brahman, O lord of prayer, the finder of wealth, thou, the disposer, art associated with prayer.

original: tvamagne rājā varuṇo dhṛtavratastvaṃ mitro bhavasi dasma īḍyaḥ
analyzed: tvam agne rājā varuṇaḥ dhṛta vrataḥ tvam mitraḥ bhavasi dasmaḥ īḍyaḥ
translated: Thou, O Agni, art king Varuṇa, of firm vow, thou art the wondrous Mitra, to be invoked,

original: tvamaryamā satpatiryasya sambhujaṃ tvamaṃśo vidathe deva bhājayuḥ
analyzed: tvam aryamā sat patiḥ yasya sambhujam tvam aṃśaḥ vidathe deva bhājayuḥ
translated: Thou art Aryaman, lord of the good, whose portion is to be enjoyed, thou art Aṃśa, O god, to be shared in the assembly.

original: tvamagne tvaṣṭā vidhate suvīryaṃ tava gnāvo mitramahaḥ sajātyam
analyzed: tvam agne tvaṣṭā vidhate su vīryam tava gnāvaḥ mitra mahas sajātyam
translated: Thou, O Agni, art Tvaṣṭar, bestowing good strength on the worshipper, in thy flames is the greatness of Mitra, the companionship of kinsmen.

original: tvamāśuhemā rariṣe svaśvyaṃ tvaṃ narāṃ śardho asi purūvasuḥ
analyzed: tvam āśu hemā rariṣe su aśvyam tvam narām śardhaḥ asi purūvasuḥ
translated: Thou, O swift-moving one, givest the swiftness of the horse, thou art the host of men, rich in many treasures.

original: tvamagne rudro asuro maho divastvaṃ śardho mārutaṃ pṛkṣa īśiṣe
analyzed: tvam agne rudraḥ asuraḥ mahaḥ divaḥ tvam śardhaḥ mārutam pṛkṣaḥ īśiṣe
translated: Thou, O Agni, art Rudra, the Asura, the great one in the sky, thou rulest over the host, the food of the Maruts.

original: tvaṃ vātairaruṇairyāsi śaṃgayastvaṃ pūṣā vidhataḥ pāsi nu tmanā🔽tvamagne draviṇodā araṃkṛte tvaṃ devaḥ savitā ratnadhāasi🔽tvaṃ bhago nṛpate vasva īśiṣe tvaṃ pāyurdame yaste'vidhat
analyzed: tvam vātaiḥ aruṇaiḥ yāsi śaṃgayaḥ tvam pūṣā vidhataḥ pāsi nu tmanā  tvam agne draviṇaḥ dāḥ araṃkṛte tvam devaḥ savitā ratna dhāḥ asi  tvam bhagaḥ nṛpate vasvaḥ īśiṣe tvam pāyuḥ dame yaḥ tevidhat
translated: With the red winds thou goest, O Saṅkṛti; thou, Pūṣan, as a disposer, guardest thyself.🔽Thou, O Agni, art the giver of wealth to the poor; thou, O god Savitar, art the bestower of treasure.🔽Thou, O Bhaga, art the lord of treasures as a king; thou art the protector in the house of him who hath served thee.

original: tvamagne dama ā viśpatiṃ viśastvāṃ rājānaṃ suvidatraṃ ṛñjate
analyzed: tvam agne dame ā viśpatim viśaḥ tvām rājānam suvidatram ṛñjate
translated: Thee, O Agni, as a lord of the people in the house, they honour, thee as a king, O bountiful one.

original: tvaṃ viśvāni svanīka patyase tvaṃ sahasrāṇi śatā daśa prati
analyzed: tvam viśvāni su anīka patyase tvam sahasrāṇi śatā daśa prati
translated: Thou, O Agni, art the lord of all things, O thou of fair countenance; thou of the hundred powers, of the thousand, of the ten.

original: tvāmagne pitaramiṣṭibhirnarastvāṃ bhrātrāya śamyā tanūrucam
analyzed: tvām agne pitaram iṣṭibhiḥ naraḥ tvām bhrātrāya śamyā tanūrucam
translated: Thee, O Agni, men serve with oblations as a father; thee, O god, as a brother, with the Samyā hymn.

original: tvaṃ putro bhavasi yaste 'vidhat tvaṃ sakhā suśevaḥ pāsyādhṛṣaḥ
analyzed: tvam putraḥ bhavasi yaḥ te vidhat tvam sakhā su śevaḥ pāsi ādhṛṣaḥ
translated: Thou art a son to him who hath served thee; thou art a friend, O good one, a protector, not to be overcome.

original: tvamagna ṛbhurāke namasyastvaṃ vājasya kṣumato rāya īśiṣe
analyzed: tvam agne ṛbhurāke namasyaḥ tvam vājasya kṣumataḥ rāyaḥ īśiṣe
translated: Thou, O Agni, art a R̥ibhu, a son, to be worshipped; thou art the lord of strength, of food, of wealth.

original: tvaṃ vi bhāsyanu dakṣi dāvane tvaṃ viśikṣurasiyajñamātaniḥ🔽tvamagne aditirdeva dāśuṣe tvaṃ hotrā bhāratī vardhasegirā
analyzed: tvam vi bhāsi anu dakṣi dāvane tvam viśikṣuḥ asi yajña mātaniḥ  tvam agne aditiḥ deva dāśuṣe tvam hotrā bhāratī vardhasegirā
translated: Thou, O Agni, art to be glorified for giving gifts; thou, O wise one, hast extended this sacrifice.🔽Thou, O Agni, art Aditi to the worshipper; thou, O god, as the Hotṛ priest, art increased by the hymn.

original: tvamiḷā ṣatahimāsi dakṣase tvaṃ vṛtrahā vasupate sarasvatī
analyzed: tvam iḍā ṣata himā asi dakṣase tvam vṛtra hā vasu pate sarasvatī
translated: Thou, O Agni, art Iḷā for a hundred winters, for strength; thou art the Vr̥itra-slayer, O lord of treasures, O Sarasvatī.

original: tvamagne subhṛta uttamaṃ vayastava spārhe varṇa ā sandṛśi śriyaḥ
analyzed: tvam agne su bhṛtaḥ uttamam vayaḥ tava spārhe varṇe ā san dṛśi śriyaḥ
translated: Thou, O Agni, art well-kindled, the best life, in thy lovely form are the glories of sight

original: tvaṃ vājaḥ prataraṇo bṛhannasi tvaṃ rayirbahulo viśvatas pṛthuḥ
analyzed: tvam vājaḥ prataraṇaḥ bṛhan asi tvam rayiḥ bahulaḥ viśvatas pṛthuḥ
translated: Thou art the mighty Vaja, the leader across, thou art the wide, all-pervading wealth

original: tvāmagna ādityāsa āsyaṃ tvāṃ jihvāṃ śucayaścakrirekave
analyzed: tvām agne ādityāsaḥ āsyam tvām jihvām śucayaḥ cakriḥ ekave
translated: Thee, O Agni, the Adityas have made the mouth, thee, O all-knower, the pure ones have made the tongue

original: tvāṃ rātiṣāco adhvareṣu saścire tve devā haviradantyāhutam
analyzed: tvām rātiṣācaḥ adhvareṣu saścire tve devāḥ haviḥ adanti āhutam
translated: Thee, the receivers of gifts, have waited upon in sacrifices, in thee, O god, the gods eat the offered oblation

original: tve agne viśve anṛtāso adruha āsā devā haviradantyāhutam
analyzed: tve agne viśve anṛtāsaḥ adruhaḥ āsā devāḥ haviḥ adanti āhutam
translated: In thee, O Agni, all the guileless, harmless gods eat the offered oblation

original: tvayā martāsaḥ svadanta āsutiṃ tvaṃ garbho vīrudhāṃ jajñiṣe śuciḥ
analyzed: tvayā martāsaḥ svadante āsutim tvam garbhaḥ vīrudhām jajñiṣe śuciḥ
translated: Through thee, O mortal ones, the oblation is enjoyed, thou art born as the pure embryo of the plants

original: tvaṃ tān saṃ ca prati cāsi majmanāgne sujāta pra ca devaricyase
analyzed: tvam tān sam ca prati ca asi majmanā agne su jāta pra ca deva ricyase
translated: Thou art he who unites and separates them by might, O Agni, well-born, thou surpassest the gods

original: pṛkṣo yadatra mahinā vi te bhuvadanu dyāvāpṛthivī rodasī ubhe
analyzed: pṛkṣaḥ yat atra mahinā vi te bhuvat anu dyāvāpṛthivī rodasī ubhe
translated: When the great food is here, through thy greatness, the two world-halves, heaven and earth, are spread out

original: ye stotṛbhyo goagrāmaśvapeśasamagne rātimupasṛjanti sūrayaḥ
analyzed: ye stotṛbhyaḥ go agrām aśva peśasam agne rātim upasṛjanti sūrayaḥ
translated: The nobles who bestow upon the praisers the gift of cattle and the choicest steeds, O Agni

original: asmāñca tāṃśca pra hi neṣi vasya ā bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ
analyzed: asmān ca tān ca pra hi neṣi vasyaḥ ā bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ
translated: Lead us and them to what is good. May we speak lofty words in the assembly, with brave sons

original: yajñena vardhata jātavedasamagniṃ yajadhvaṃ haviṣā tanā girā
analyzed: yajñena vardhata jātavedasam agnim yajadhvam haviṣā tanā girā
translated: With sacrifice increase the all-knowing Agni, worship him with oblation, with a song

original: samidhānaṃ suprayasaṃ svarṇaraṃ dyukṣaṃ hotāraṃvṛjaneṣu dhūrṣadam
analyzed: samidhānam su prayasam svarṇaram dyukṣam hotāram vṛjaneṣu dhūrṣadam
translated: Well-kindled, well-disposed, golden-hued, dwelling in the sky, the priest who stirs the people in the assemblies

original: abhi tvā naktīruṣaso vavāśire 'gne vatsaṃ na svasareṣudhenavaḥ
analyzed: abhi tvā naktīḥ uṣasaḥ vavāśire gne vatsam na svasareṣu dhenavaḥ
translated: The nights and dawns have looked upon you, O Agni, like cows on their calf among their own stalls

original: diva ivedaratirmānuṣā yugā kṣapo bhāsi puruvāra saṃyataḥ
analyzed: divaḥ iva idam ratiḥ mānuṣā yugā kṣapaḥ bhāsi puru vāra saṃyataḥ
translated: Like the course of the days among men, you shine in the night, O bountiful one, well-controlled

original: taṃ devā budhne rajasaḥ sudaṃsasaṃ divaspṛthivyoraratiṃnyerire
analyzed: tam devāḥ budhne rajasaḥ su daṃsasam divaspṛthivyoḥ aratiṃnyerire
translated: The gods have placed him, the well-appearing one, at the edge of the realm, the messenger between heaven and earth

original: rathamiva vedyaṃ śukraśociṣamagniṃ mitraṃ nakṣitiṣu praśaṃsyam
analyzed: ratham iva vedyam śukra śociṣam agnim mitram nakṣitiṣu praśaṃsyam
translated: Like a known chariot, with bright splendor, Agni, to be praised among men, like a friend

original: tamukṣamāṇaṃ rajasi sva ā dame candramiva surucaṃ hvāra ā dadhuḥ🔽pṛśnyāḥ pataraṃ citayantamakṣabhiḥ pātho na pāyuṃ janasī ubhe anu
analyzed: tam ukṣamāṇam rajasi sve ā dame candram iva su rucam hvāre ā dadhuḥ  pṛśnyāḥ pataram citayantam akṣabhiḥ pāthaḥ na pāyum janasī ubhe anu
translated: They have placed him, the shining one, in the realm, in his own abode, like the moon, in the cloud🔽The son of Pṛśni, the wise one, they have made to move with his rays, like a guardian of the path, along both worlds

original: sa hotā viśvaṃ pari bhūtvadhvaraṃ tamu havyairmanuṣa ṛñjate girā
analyzed: sa hotā viśvam pari bhūtu adhvaram tam u havyaiḥ manuṣaḥ ṛñjate girā
translated: He, the priest, having become all the sacrifice, him the men seek with offerings and with song

original: hiriśipro vṛdhasānāsu jarbhurad dyaurna stṛbhiścitayad rodasī anu
analyzed: hiri śipraḥ vṛdhasānāsu jarbhurat dyauḥ na stṛbhiḥ citayat rodasī anu
translated: The one with the golden beard, the swift one, has shone in the growing (nights), as if the heaven were with the stars, through the two worlds

original: sa no revat samidhānaḥ svastaye sandadasvān rayimasmāsu dīdihi
analyzed: sa naḥ revat samidhānaḥ svastaye san dadasvān rayim asmāsu dīdihi
translated: May he, well-kindled, for our prosperity, bestowing, grant us wealth, shine upon us

original: ā naḥ kṛṇuṣva suvitāya rodasī agne havyā manuṣodeva vītaye
analyzed: ā naḥ kṛṇuṣva suvitāya rodasī agne havyā manuṣodeva vītaye
translated: For our welfare, make the two worlds for us, O Agni, the oblations of men for the feast of the gods

original: dā no agne bṛhato dāḥ sahasriṇo duro na vājaṃ śrutyā apā vṛdhi🔽prācī dyāvāpṛthivī brahmaṇā kṛdhi svarṇa śukramuṣaso vi didyutaḥ
analyzed: dāḥ naḥ agne bṛhataḥ dāḥ sahasriṇaḥ duraḥ na vājam śrutyai apa ā vṛdhi  prācī dyāvāpṛthivī brahmaṇā kṛdhi svarṇa śukram uṣasaḥ vi didyutaḥ
translated: Grant us, O Agni, the great, the thousandfold, as a prize, increase our wealth by thy fame🔽Make the eastern heaven and earth ready with holy power, let the bright and golden lights of the dawn shine forth

original: sa idhāna uṣaso rāmyā anu svarṇa dīdedaruṣeṇa bhānunā🔽hotrābhiragnirmanuṣaḥ svadhvaro rājā viśāmatithiścārurāyave
analyzed: saḥ idhānaḥ uṣasaḥ rāmyāḥ anu svarṇa dīdedaruṣeṇa bhānunā  hotrābhiḥ agniḥ manuṣaḥ su adhvaraḥ rājā viśām atithiḥ cāru rāyave
translated: He, kindled, shines forth with his ruddy light after the dawns which are delightful to behold🔽By the oblations Agni, the guest of men, the king of the people, is made beautiful for the giver

original: evā no agne amṛteṣu pūrvya dhīṣ pīpāya bṛhaddiveṣu mānuṣā
analyzed: eva naḥ agne amṛteṣu pūrvya dhīḥ pīpāya bṛhaddiveṣu mānuṣā
translated: Thus, O Agni, the ancient one, may the hymn come to the immortals, the great one, among men, in the days

original: duhānā dhenurvṛjaneṣu kārave tmanā śatinaṃ pururūpamiṣaṇi
analyzed: duhānā dhenuḥ vṛjaneṣu kārave tmanā śatinam puru rūpam iṣaṇi
translated: The cow, yielding milk, for the singer in the assemblies, of her own accord, a hundredfold, in various forms, in the house

original: vayamagne arvatā vā suvīryaṃ brahmaṇā vā citayemā janānati
analyzed: vayam agne arvatā vā su vīryam brahmaṇā vā citayema janān ati
translated: We, O Agni, by the race or by the holy power, would surpass the people by our devotion

original: asmākaṃ dyumnamadhi pañca kṛṣṭiṣūccā svarṇaśuśucīta duṣṭaram🔽sa no bodhi sahasya praśaṃsyo yasmin sujātā iṣayanta sūrayaḥ🔽yamagne yajñamupayanti vājino nitye toke dīdivāṃsaṃ sve dame
analyzed: asmākam dyumnam adhi pañca kṛṣṭiṣu uccā duṣṭaram  sa naḥ bodhi sahasya praśaṃsyaḥ yasmin sujātāḥ iṣayanta sūrayaḥ  yam agne yajñam upayanti vājinaḥ nitye toke dīdivāṃsam sve dame
translated: May our glory be on high among the five peoples, may the bright and golden one shine forth, invincible🔽Be thou that, O conquering Agni, who is to be praised, in whom the well-born heroes rejoice🔽In whom, O Agni, the strong ones come to the sacrifice, to the ever-present, shining one, in their own abode

original: ubhayāso jātavedaḥ syāma te stotāro agne sūrayaśca śarmaṇi
analyzed: ubhayāsaḥ jātavedaḥ syāma te stotāraḥ agne sūrayaḥ ca śarmaṇi
translated: May we, O all-knower, be on both sides of thee, O Agni, the singers and the nobles in the shelter

original: vasvo rāyaḥ puruścandrasya bhūyasaḥ prajāvataḥ svapatyasya śagdhi naḥ
analyzed: vasvaḥ rāyaḥ puru ścandrasya bhūyasaḥ prajāvataḥ su apatyasya śagdhi naḥ
translated: Grant us, O Vasu, of abundant and most excellent wealth, of offspring, of self-rule.

original: ye stotṛbhyo / / /
analyzed: ye stotṛbhyaḥ
translated: Those who are to the praisers...

original: samiddho agnirnihitaḥ pṛthivyāṃ pratyaṃ viśvāni bhuvanānyasthāt
analyzed: samiddhaḥ agniḥ nihitaḥ pṛthivyām pratyam viśvāni bhuvanāni asthāt
translated: Agni, kindled, is placed on the earth, he has stood in all the worlds.

original: hotā pāvakaḥ pradivaḥ sumedhā devo devān yajatvagnirarhan
analyzed: hotā pāvakaḥ pradivaḥ sumedhāḥ devaḥ devān yajatu agniḥ arhan
translated: The priest, the purifier, the wise one, the god, Agni, worthy of worship, let him worship the gods.

original: narāśaṃsaḥ prati dhāmānyañjan tisro divaḥ prati mahnā svarciḥ
analyzed: narāśaṃsaḥ prati dhāmāni añjan tisraḥ divaḥ prati mahnā su arciḥ
translated: Narāśaṃsa, arranging the abodes, with his threefold light from the sky, through his greatness.

original: ghṛtapruṣā manasā havyamundan mūrdhan yajñasya samanaktu devān
analyzed: ghṛta pruṣā manasā havya mundan mūrdhan yajñasya samanaktu devān
translated: Anointing the oblation with ghee, let him besprinkle the gods with the head of the sacrifice.

original: īḷito agne manasā no arhan devān yakṣi mānuṣāt pūrvo adya
analyzed: īḍitaḥ agne manasā naḥ arhan devān yakṣi mānuṣāt pūrvaḥ adya
translated: Honored, O Agni, worthy of our mind, worship the gods today before the human one.

original: sa ā vaha marutāṃ śardho acyutamindraṃ naro barhiṣadaṃ yajadhvam
analyzed: saḥ ā vaha marutām śardhaḥ acyutam indram naraḥ barhiṣadam yajadhvam
translated: Bring hither the Maruts' troop, the imperishable, worship Indra, O men, who sits on the sacrificial grass.

original: deva barhirvardhamānaṃ suvīraṃ stīrṇaṃ rāye subharaṃ vedyasyām
analyzed: deva barhiḥ vardhamānam su vīram stīrṇam rāye subharam vedyasyām
translated: O divine sacrificial grass, increasing, with good heroes, spread out for wealth, well-filled, on this earth.

original: ghṛtenāktaṃ vasavaḥ sīdatedaṃ viśve devā ādityā yajñiyāsaḥ
analyzed: ghṛtena aktam vasavaḥ sīdata idam viśve devāḥ ādityāḥ yajñiyāsaḥ
translated: Anointed with ghee, let the Vasus, all the gods, the Ādityas worthy of sacrifice, sit on this (grass).

original: vi śrayantāmurviyā hūyamānā dvāro devīḥ suprāyaṇā namobhiḥ
analyzed: vi śrayantām urviyā hūyamānāḥ dvāraḥ devīḥ su prāyaṇāḥ namobhiḥ
translated: Let the doors, to be worshipped, well-opened, the divine ones, be spread out with their vastness, by the invocation.

original: vyacasvatīrvi prathantāmajuryā varṇaṃ punānāyaśasaṃ suvīram
analyzed: vyacasvatīḥ vi prathantām ajuryāḥ varṇam punānā ayaśasam su vīram
translated: Let them, purifying the fame with good heroes, be spread out, the undecaying ones, with vastness.

original: sādhvapāṃsi sanatā na ukṣite uṣāsānaktā vayyeva raṇvite🔽tantuṃ tataṃ saṃvayantī samīcī yajñasya peśaḥ sudughe payasvatī
analyzed: sādhu apāṃsi sanatā naḥ ukṣite uṣāsānaktā vayyā iva raṇvite  tantum tatam saṃvayantī samīcī yajñasya peśaḥ sudughe payasvatī
translated: The good hymns, ever fresh, are sprinkled on the seat, the dawn and night, the two loving maidens.🔽Weaving the woven thread, the two together, the form of sacrifice, the well-milking, rich in milk.

original: daivyā hotārā prathamā viduṣṭara ṛju yakṣataḥ saṃ ṛcāvapuṣṭarā
analyzed: daivyā hotārā prathamā viduṣṭarau ṛju yakṣataḥ sam ṛcā avapuṣṭarā
translated: The two divine Hotars, most skilled, most upright, most bountiful, worship with the two hymns.

original: devān yajantāv ṛtuthā samañjato nābhā pṛthivyā adhi sānuṣu triṣu
analyzed: devān yajantau ṛtuthā samañjataḥ nābhā pṛthivyāḥ adhi sānuṣu triṣu
translated: The two, worshipping the gods in due season, uniting, on the three heights of the earth's navel.

original: sarasvatī sādhayantī dhiyaṃ na iḷā devī bhāratī viśvatūrtiḥ
analyzed: sarasvatī sādhayantī dhiyam naḥ iḷā devī bhāratī viśvatūrtiḥ
translated: Sarasvatî, accomplishing the thought, the goddess Ilâ, Bhâratî, all-powerful,

original: tisro devīḥ svadhayā barhiredamachidraṃ pāntuśaraṇaṃ niṣadya
analyzed: tisraḥ devīḥ svadhayā barhiḥ ā idam achidram pāntu śaraṇam niṣadya
translated: The three goddesses, by their own nature, sitting on this unbroken seat, protect the sacrifice.

original: piśaṅgarūpaḥ subharo vayodhāḥ śruṣṭī vīro jāyate devakāmaḥ
analyzed: piśaṅga rūpaḥ subharaḥ vayodhāḥ śruṣṭī vīraḥ jāyate deva kāmaḥ
translated: The tawny-hued, well-nourished, life-bestowing hero, desired by the gods, is born by the will of the people.

original: prajāṃ tvaṣṭā vi ṣyatu nābhimasme athā devānāmapyetu pāthaḥ
analyzed: prajām tvaṣṭā vi syatu nābhim asme athā devānām apyetu pāthaḥ
translated: May Tvastr extend our offspring to our navel; then may it go to the abode of the gods.

original: vanaspatiravasṛjannupa sthādagnirhaviḥ sūdayāti pra dhībhiḥ
analyzed: vanaspatiḥ avasṛjan upa sthāt agniḥ haviḥ sūdayāti pra dhībhiḥ
translated: The lord of the forest, having loosed, stands near; Agni, with his thoughts, makes the offering ready.

original: tridhā samaktaṃ nayatu prajānan devebhyo daivyaḥ śamitopa havyam
analyzed: tridhā samaktam nayatu prajānan devebhyaḥ daivyaḥ śamitā upa havyam
translated: Let him, the divine, appointed, knowing, lead the offering thrice anointed to the gods.

original: ghṛtaṃ mimikṣe ghṛtamasya yonirghṛte śrito ghṛtaṃ vasya dhāma
analyzed: ghṛtam mimikṣe ghṛtam asya yoniḥ ghṛte śritaḥ ghṛtam vasya dhāma
translated: He mixes with ghee, his birthplace is ghee; in ghee he rests; ghee is his highest abode.

original: anuṣvadhamā vaha mādayasva svāhākṛtaṃ vṛṣabha vakṣi havyam
analyzed: anuṣvadham ā vaha mādayasva svāhākṛtam vṛṣabha vakṣi havyam
translated: Carry it on the path, make it rejoice, O bull, carry the oblation offered with svāhā

original: huve vaḥ sudyotmānaṃ suvṛktiṃ viśāmagnimatithiṃ suprayasam
analyzed: huve vaḥ sudyotmānam suvṛktim viśām agnim atithim su prayasam
translated: I invoke your well-shining, well-praised guest Agni, the hospitable one among the people

original: mitra iva yo didhiṣāyyo bhūd deva ādeve jane jātavedāḥ
analyzed: mitraḥ iva yaḥ didhiṣāyyaḥ bhūt devaḥ ādeve jane jātavedāḥ
translated: Who is to be desired like a friend, the god among the godless people, the all-knower

original: imaṃ vidhanto apāṃ sadhasthe dvitādadhurbhṛgavo vikṣvāyoḥ
analyzed: imam vidhantaḥ apām sadhasthe dvitā adadhuḥ bhṛgavaḥ vikṣvāyoḥ
translated: This one, the Bhrgus, have placed in the abode of the waters, in the two worlds, in all the people

original: eṣa viśvānyabhyastu bhūmā devānāmagniraratirjīrāśvaḥ
analyzed: eṣa viśvāni abhyastu bhūmā devānām agniḥ aratiḥ jīrāśvaḥ
translated: This one shall surpass all beings, Agni, the god, the messenger, the one with swift horses

original: agniṃ devāso mānuṣīṣu vikṣu priyaṃ dhuḥ kṣeṣyanto namitram
analyzed: agnim devāsaḥ mānuṣīṣu vikṣu priyam dhuḥ kṣeṣyantaḥ namitram
translated: The gods have placed Agni, the dear one, among human people, the one to be worshipped, the invincible one

original: sa dīdayaduśatīrūrmyā ā dakṣāyyo yo dāsvate dama ā
analyzed: sa dīdayat uśatīḥ ūrmyāḥ ā dakṣāyyaḥ yaḥ dāsvate dame ā
translated: He shines over the wicked with his waves, the one who is to be desired in the house, the one who is to give

original: asya raṇvā svasyeva puṣṭiḥ sandṛṣṭirasya hiyānasya dakṣoḥ
analyzed: asya raṇvā svasya iva puṣṭiḥ san dṛṣṭiḥ asya hiyānasya dakṣoḥ
translated: His radiance is like that of his own prosperity, the sight of him is like that of a powerful god

original: vi yo bharibhradoṣadhīṣu jihvāmatyo na rathyo dodhavīti vārān🔽ā yan me abhvaṃ vanadaḥ panantośigbhyo nāmimīta varṇam
analyzed: vi yaḥ bharibhrat oṣadhīṣu jihvāmatyaḥ na rathyaḥ dodhavīti vārān  ā yat me abhvam vanadaḥ pananta uśigbhyaḥ na āmimīta varṇam
translated: He who spreads his tongue over the plants, like a harnessed horse rushes through the waters🔽When the fearful one, the one who destroys, has bent down to me, he has measured out his form for the strong ones

original: sa citreṇa cikite raṃsu bhāsā jujurvān yo muhurā yuvā bhūt
analyzed: sa citreṇa cikite raṃsu bhāsā jujurvān yaḥ muhurā yuvā bhūt
translated: He shines with variegated, beautiful light, the one who is often young, the one who is to be served

original: ā yo vanā tātṛṣāṇo na bhāti vārṇa pathā rathyevasvānīt
analyzed: ā yaḥ vanā tātṛṣāṇaḥ na bhāti vārṇa pathā
translated: He who shines like one thirsting for the woods, he has come along the path of the waters like a chariot on its own way

original: kṛṣṇādhvā tapū raṇvaściketa dyauriva smayamāno nabhobhiḥ
analyzed: kṛṣṇa adhvā tapūḥ raṇvaḥ ciketa dyauḥ iva smayamānaḥ nabhobhiḥ
translated: The dark path, the red one, and the lovely one have been thought of, like the smiling sky with the clouds.

original: sa yo vyasthādabhi dakṣadurvīṃ paśurnaiti svayuragopāḥ
analyzed: sa yaḥ vyasthāt abhi dakṣadurvīm paśuḥ na eti svayuḥ a gopāḥ
translated: He who has set out to conquer the wide earth, like a cow without a keeper, goes as a beast.

original: agniḥ śociṣmānatasānyuṣṇan kṛṣṇavyathirasvadayan na bhūma
analyzed: agniḥ śociṣmān atasāni uṣṇan kṛṣṇa vyathiḥ asvadayat na bhūma
translated: Agni, the radiant one, burning the dry woods, devouring the black, has not satisfied the earth.

original: nū te pūrvasyāvaso adhītau tṛtīye vidathe manma śaṃsi
analyzed: nu te pūrvasya avasaḥ adhītau tṛtīye vidathe manma śaṃsi
translated: Now, in the performance of your first favor, in the third assembly, I will utter a hymn.

original: asme agne saṃyadvīraṃ bṛhantaṃ kṣumantaṃ vājaṃ svapatyaṃrayiṃ dāḥ🔽tvayā yathā gṛtsamadāso agne guhā vanvanta uparānabhi ṣyuḥ
analyzed: asme agne saṃyat vīram bṛhantam kṣumantam vājam su apatyaṃrayim dāḥ  tvayā yathā gṛtsamadāsaḥ agne guhā vanvantaḥ uparān abhi syuḥ
translated: O Agni, give us wealth with heroic sons, vast, powerful, victorious, and rich.🔽Just as the Gritsamadas, O Agni, found the hidden Uparas in the cave,

original: suvīrāso abhimātiṣāhaḥ smat sūribhyo gṛṇate tad vayo dhāḥ
analyzed: su vīrāsaḥ abhimātiṣāhaḥ smat sūribhyaḥ gṛṇate tat vayaḥ dhāḥ
translated: granting brave sons to our princes, O you who conquer enemies, grant that to the singer.

original: hotājaniṣṭa cetanaḥ pitā pitṛbhya ūtaye
analyzed: hotā ajaniṣṭa cetanaḥ pitā pitṛbhyaḥ ūtaye
translated: The priest was born, the wise one, the father, for the help of the fathers.

original: prayakṣañ jenyaṃ vasu śakema vājino yamam
analyzed: prayakṣam jenyam vasu śakema vājinaḥ yamam
translated: May we be able to serve the visible, the noble, the good, the powerful Yama,

original: ā yasmin sapta raśmayastatā yajñasya netari
analyzed: ā yasmin sapta raśmayaḥ tatāḥ yajñasya netari
translated: In whom the seven rays are spread out, the leader of the sacrifice,

original: manuṣvad daivyamaṣṭamaṃ potā viśvaṃ tadinvati
analyzed: manuṣvat daivyam aṣṭamam potā viśvam tadinvati
translated: The eighth, divine, like Manu, the purifier, he impels all that.

original: dadhanve vā yadīmanu vocad brahmāṇi veru tat
analyzed: dadhanve vā yadi īm anu vocat brahmāṇi vā īru tat
translated: If he follows that, or speaks the Brahman prayers, that is his truth.

original: pari viśvāni kāvyā nemiścakramivābhavat
analyzed: pari viśvāni kāvyā nemiḥ cakram iva abhavat
translated: He has become like a wheel, encompassing all the wise sayings.

original: sākaṃ hi śucinā śuciḥ praśāstā kratunājani
analyzed: sākam hi śucinā śuciḥ praśāstā kratunā ajani
translated: For the pure one is born together with the pure one to rule with the pure sacrifice

original: vidvānasya vratā dhruvā vayā ivānu rohate
analyzed: vidvānasya vratā dhruvā vayāḥ iva anu rohate
translated: The firm observances of the learned one ascend like old age

original: tā asya varṇamāyuvo neṣṭuḥ sacanta dhenavaḥ
analyzed: tāḥ asya varṇam āyuvaḥ neṣṭuḥ sacanta dhenavaḥ
translated: Those young cows follow his appearance, the cows of the hoster

original: kuvit tisṛbhya ā varaṃ svasāro yā idaṃ yayuḥ
analyzed: kuvid tisṛbhyaḥ ā varam svasāraḥ yāḥ idam yayuḥ
translated: Are the three sisters better than those who have come here?

original: yadī māturupa svasā ghṛtaṃ bharantyasthita
analyzed: yadī mātuḥ upa svasā ghṛtam bharantī asthita
translated: When the sister of the mother brings ghee as they stand

original: tāsāmadhvaryurāgatau yavo vṛṣṭīva modate
analyzed: tāsām adhvaryuḥ āgatau yavaḥ vṛṣṭī iva modate
translated: Of those two the Adhvaryu has come, like rain the barley rejoices

original: svaḥ svāya dhāyase kṛṇutāṃ ṛtvig ṛtvijam
analyzed: svaḥ svāya dhāyase kṛṇutām ṛtvij ṛtvijam
translated: Make the one who belongs to the self for the support of the self, the officiating priest for the officiating priest

original: stomaṃ yajñaṃ cādaraṃ vanemā rarimā vayam🔽yatha vidvānaraṃ karad viśvebhyo yajatebhyaḥ ayamagne tve api yaṃ yajñaṃ cakṛmā vayam
analyzed: stomam yajñam ca ādaram vanemā rarimā vayam  yathā vidvānaram karat viśvebhyaḥ yajatebhyaḥ ayam agne tve api yam yajñam cakṛma vayam
translated: We will perform the praise, the sacrifice, and the offering, we will strive🔽As the learned one makes the sacrifice for all the sacrificers, O Agni, this sacrifice which we have made for you, O Agni

original: imāṃ me agne samidhamimāmupasadaṃ vaneḥ
analyzed: imām me agne samidham imām upasadam vaneḥ
translated: Accept this my kindling-stick, this my approach,

original: imā u ṣu śrudhī giraḥ
analyzed: imāḥ u su śrudhi giraḥ
translated: Listen to these my songs

original: ayā te agne vidhemorjo napādaśvamiṣṭe
analyzed: ayā te agne vidhema ūrjaḥ napāt aśvam iṣṭe
translated: O Agni, we wish to serve you, the foot of strength, the horse is dear to you

original: enā sūktena sujāta
analyzed: enā sūktena sujāta
translated: With this hymn, O well-born one

original: taṃ tvā gīrbhirgirvaṇasaṃ draviṇasyuṃ draviṇodaḥ
analyzed: tam tvā gīrbhiḥ girvaṇasam draviṇasyum draviṇaḥ daḥ
translated: You, O Agni, the lover of praise, the seeker of wealth, the giver of wealth,

original: saparyema saparyavaḥ
analyzed: saparyema saparyavaḥ
translated: We will serve with service

original: sa bodhi sūrirmaghavā vasupate vasudāvan
analyzed: sa bodhi sūriḥ maghavā vasu pate vasu dāvan
translated: Be a patron, O bountiful one, lord of treasures, giver of treasures

original: yuyodhyasmad dveṣāṃsi
analyzed: yuyodhi asmat dveṣāṃsi
translated: Drive away our enemies

original: sa no vṛṣtiṃ divas pari sa no vājamanarvāṇam🔽sa naḥ sahasriṇīriṣaḥ
analyzed: sa naḥ vṛṣtim divaḥ pari sa naḥ vājam anarvāṇam  sa naḥ sahasriṇīḥ iṣaḥ
translated: Bestow on us rain from the sky, bestow on us irresistible strength,🔽And food in abundance.

original: īḷānāyāvasyave yaviṣṭha dūta no girā
analyzed: īḍānāya avasyave yaviṣṭha dūta naḥ girā
translated: To the most youthful messenger, to the one who is eager to help, to the one who is ready to act, with our song,

original: yajiṣṭha hotarā gahi
analyzed: yajiṣṭha hotarā gahi
translated: O most worthy priest, come hither.

original: antarhyagna īyase vidvān janmobhayā kave🔽dūto janyevamitryaḥ
analyzed: antar hi agne īyase vidvān janma ubhayā kave  dūtaḥ
translated: For, O Agni, thou goest between, knowing both races, O wise one,🔽As a messenger to the people, as a friend to the people.

original: sa vidvānā ca piprayo yakṣi cikitva ānuṣak
analyzed: sa vidvānā ca piprayaḥ yakṣi cikitvaḥ ānuṣak
translated: He, the wise one, shall serve and honour the one who is to be worshipped, and shall act in due order,

original: ā cāsmin satsi barhiṣi
analyzed: ā ca asmin satsi barhiṣi
translated: And shall sit down on this strew.

original: śreṣṭhaṃ yaviṣṭha bhāratāgne dyumantamā bhara
analyzed: śreṣṭham yaviṣṭha bhārata agne dyumantamā ā bhara
translated: O most youthful Agni, bring us the best, the most glorious wealth,

original: vaso puruspṛhaṃ rayim
analyzed: vaso puruspṛham rayim
translated: O Vasu, the wealth desired by many.

original: mā no arātirīśata devasya martyasya ca
analyzed: mā naḥ arātiḥ īśata devasya martyasya ca
translated: Let not hostility prevail over us, whether of a god or of a mortal.

original: parṣi tasyā utadviṣaḥ🔽viśvā uta tvayā vayaṃ dhārā udanyā iva
analyzed: parṣi tasyāḥ uta dviṣaḥ  viśvāḥ uta tvayā vayam dhārāḥ udanyāḥ iva
translated: Thou carriest us beyond that hatred and its poison.🔽And by thee, O Agni, may we all

original: ati gāhemahi dviṣaḥ
analyzed: ati gāhemahi dviṣaḥ
translated: Overcome our enemies, as over a river with its waves.

original: śuciḥ pāvaka vandyo 'gne bṛhad vi rocase
analyzed: śuciḥ pāvaka vandyaḥ gne bṛhat vi rocase
translated: O pure, purifying, adorable Agni, thou shinest forth in greatness,

original: tvaṃ ghṛtebhirāhutaḥ
analyzed: tvam ghṛtebhiḥ āhutaḥ
translated: Thou who art worshipped with ghee.

original: tvaṃ no asi bhāratāgne vaśābhirukṣabhiḥ
analyzed: tvam naḥ asi bhārata agne vaśābhiḥ ukṣabhiḥ
translated: Thou art our protector, O Agni, O Bharata, with barren cows and bulls,

original: aṣṭāpadībhirāhutaḥ
analyzed: aṣṭāpadībhiḥ āhutaḥ
translated: With eight-footed (cows), worshipped with oblations.

original: drvannaḥ sarpirāsutiḥ pratno hotā vareṇyaḥ
analyzed: dru annaḥ sarpiḥ āsutiḥ pratnaḥ hotā vareṇyaḥ
translated: The eater of wood, impelled by ghee, the ancient priest, to be chosen,

original: sahasas putro adbhutaḥ
analyzed: sahasaḥ putraḥ adbhutaḥ
translated: The son of strength, the wonderful one.

original: vājayanniva nū rathān yogānagnerupa stuhi
analyzed: vājayan iva nu rathān yogān agneḥ upa stuhi
translated: Praise the yokes of Agni's chariot as if urging them on,

original: yaśastamasya mīḷhuṣaḥ
analyzed: yaśastamasya mīḷhuṣaḥ
translated: Of him who is most glorious and most bountiful.

original: yaḥ sunītho dadāśuṣe 'juryo jarayannarim
analyzed: yaḥ su nīthaḥ dadāśuṣe juryaḥ jarayan arim
translated: He who, well-disposed, to the worshipper, undecaying, destroying the foe,

original: cārupratīkaāhutaḥ
analyzed: cārupratīka āhutaḥ
translated: is worshipped with beautiful appearance.

original: ya u śriyā dameṣvā doṣoṣasi praśasyate
analyzed: yaḥ u śriyā dama iṣvā doṣā uṣasi praśasyate
translated: He who is praised at dawn and evening in the dwellings through his glory,

original: yasya vrataṃ na mīyate
analyzed: yasya vratam na mīyate
translated: whose vow is not violated.

original: ā yaḥ svarṇa bhānunā citro vibhātyarciṣā
analyzed: ā yaḥ svarṇa bhānunā citraḥ vibhāti arciṣā
translated: He who, golden-hued, shines forth with his beautiful light,

original: añjānoajarairabhi
analyzed: añjānaḥ ajaraiḥ abhi
translated: anointed with the undecaying (waters),

original: atrimanu svarājyamagnimukthāni vāvṛdhuḥ
analyzed: atrim anu sva rājyam agnim ukthāni vāvṛdhuḥ
translated: After Atri, Agni, the self-ruling one, the praises have grown strong,

original: viśvā adhi śriyo dadhe
analyzed: viśvāḥ adhi śriyaḥ dadhe
translated: he has placed all glories upon (us).

original: agnerindrasya somasya devānāmūtibhirvayam
analyzed: agneḥ indrasya somasya devānām ūtibhiḥ vayam
translated: By the help of Agni, Indra, Soma, and the gods,

original: ariṣyantaḥsacemahyabhi ṣyāma pṛtanyataḥ🔽ni hotā hotṛṣadane vidānastveṣo dīdivānasadat sudakṣaḥ
analyzed: a riṣyantaḥ sacemahi abhi syāma pṛtanyataḥ  ni hotā hotṛṣadane vidānaḥ tveṣaḥ dīdivān asadat su dakṣaḥ
translated: may we, being free from enemies, conquer those who hate us.🔽The priest, the guest in the priest's seat, the radiant one, the shining one, the well-disposed one has sat down.

original: adabdhavratapramatirvasiṣṭhaḥ sahasrambharaḥ śucijihvo agniḥ
analyzed: adabdha vrata pramatiḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ sahasrambharaḥ śuci jihvaḥ agniḥ
translated: The Vasishtha, whose vow is inviolable, whose thought is wise, who bears a thousand, whose tongue is pure, Agni.

original: tvaṃ dūtastvamu naḥ paraspāstvaṃ vasya ā vṛṣabha praṇetā🔽agne tokasya nastane tanūnāmaprayuchan dīdyad bodhi gopāḥ
analyzed: tvam dūtaḥ tvam u naḥ paraspāḥ tvam vasyaḥ ā vṛṣabha praṇetā  agne tokasya nastane tanūnām aprayuchan dīdyat bodhi gopāḥ
translated: You are the messenger, you are our protector, you, O bull, are the leader to what is good for us.🔽O Agni, be a guardian, shining, not abandoning, of our offspring and bodies in the womb.

original: vidhema te parame janmannagne vidhema stomairavare sadhasthe
analyzed: vidhema te parame janman agne vidhema stomaiḥ avare sadhasthe
translated: We will worship you in the highest birth, O Agni, we will worship you with praises in the lower assembly.

original: yasmād yonerudārithā yaje taṃ pra tve havīṃṣi juhuresamiddhe
analyzed: yasmāt yoneḥ udāritha yaje tam pra tve havīṃṣi juhure samiddhe
translated: From whatever womb you have come forth, O sacrifice, to you are offered oblations in the well-kindled (fire).

original: agne yajasva haviṣā yajīyāñchruṣṭī deṣṇamabhi gṛṇīhi rādhaḥ
analyzed: agne yajasva haviṣā yajīyān śruṣṭī deṣṇam abhi gṛṇīhi rādhaḥ
translated: O Agni, offer sacrifice with the best oblation, accept the gift to be given, praise the gift

original: tvaṃ hyasi rayipatī rayīṇāṃ tvaṃ śukrasya vacaso manotā
analyzed: tvam hi asi rayi patiḥ rayīṇām tvam śukrasya vacasaḥ manotā
translated: For you are the lord of riches, of all riches, you are the invoker of the bright speech

original: ubhayaṃ te na kṣīyate vasavyaṃ divedive jāyamānasya dasma
analyzed: ubhayam te na kṣīyate vasavyam dive dive jāyamānasya dasma
translated: Both your treasures are inexhaustible, O wondrous one, as you are born day by day

original: kṛdhi kṣumantaṃ jaritāramagne kṛdhi patiṃ svapatyasya rāyaḥ
analyzed: kṛdhi kṣumantam jaritāram agne kṛdhi patim su apatyasya rāyaḥ
translated: Make the worshipper rich, O Agni, make him the lord of his own wealth

original: sainānīkena suvidatro asme yaṣṭā devānāyajiṣṭhaḥ svasti
analyzed: sainānīkena suvidatraḥ asme yaṣṭā devān āyajiṣṭhaḥ svasti
translated: With your army, O very generous one, be our priest, best worshipper of the gods, for our welfare

original: adabdho gopā uta naḥ paraspā agne dyumaduta revad didīhi
analyzed: adabdhaḥ gopāḥ uta naḥ paraspāḥ agne dyumat uta revat didīhi
translated: Be our unfailing protector and supporter, O Agni, shine forth splendidly and gloriously

original: johūtro agniḥ prathamaḥ piteveḷas pade manuṣā yat samiddhaḥ
analyzed: johūtraḥ agniḥ prathamaḥ pitā iva iḍaḥ pade manuṣā yat samiddhaḥ
translated: Agni, the invocator, first like a father, when kindled in the house, by men

original: śriyaṃ vasāno amṛto vicetā marmṛjenyaḥ śravasyaḥsa vājī
analyzed: śriyam vasānaḥ amṛtaḥ vicetāḥ marmṛjenyaḥ śravasyaḥsa vājī
translated: Wearing glory, immortal, discerning, to be praised, to be glorified, is the strong one

original: śrūyā agniścitrabhānurhavaṃ me viśvābhirgīrbhiramṛto vicetāḥ
analyzed: śrūyāḥ agniḥ citrabhānuḥ havam me viśvābhiḥ gīrbhiḥ amṛtaḥ vicetāḥ
translated: May Agni, the wondrously radiant one, the immortal, the discerning one, listen to my call with all his songs

original: śyāvā rathaṃ vahato rohitā votāruṣāha cakre vibhṛtraḥ
analyzed: śyāvā ratham vahataḥ rohitā cakre vibhṛtraḥ
translated: The two dark ones draw the chariot, the two red ones your two helpers, the two variegated ones the wheel

original: uttānāyāmajanayan suṣūtaṃ bhuvadagniḥ purupeśāsu garbhaḥ
analyzed: uttānāyām ajanayan suṣūtam bhuvat agniḥ puru peśāsu garbhaḥ
translated: In the outstretched (sky) they beget the well-lying one, Agni lies as an embryo in the wombs of men

original: śiriṇāyāṃ cidaktunā mahobhiraparīvṛto vasati pracetāḥ
analyzed: śiriṇāyām cit aktunā mahobhiḥ aparīvṛtaḥ vasati pracetāḥ
translated: Even in the shining one, with great powers, the discerning one dwells, not to be encompassed

original: jigharmyagniṃ haviṣā ghṛtena pratikṣiyantaṃ bhuvanāni viśvā
analyzed: jigharmi agnim haviṣā ghṛtena pratikṣiyantam bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: I worship Agni with oblation and ghee, the one who looks out over all the worlds,

original: pṛthuṃ tiraścā vayasā bṛhantaṃ vyaciṣṭhamannai rabhasaṃ dṛśānam
analyzed: pṛthum tiraścā vayasā bṛhantam vyaciṣṭham annaiḥ rabhasam dṛśānam
translated: Broad, extensive, with the vigor of a bird, most expansive, with food, shining brightly,

original: ā viśvataḥ pratyañcaṃ jigharmyarakṣasā manasā tajjuṣeta
analyzed: ā viśvatas pratyañcam jigharmi arakṣasā manasā tat juṣeta
translated: I worship from all sides the one who faces this way, let him approve it with a mind free from evil.

original: maryaśrīḥ spṛhayadvarṇo agnirnābhimṛśe tanvā jarbhurāṇaḥ
analyzed: marya śrīḥ spṛhayat varṇaḥ agniḥ na abhimṛśe tanvā jarbhurāṇaḥ
translated: Agni, with the beauty of a young man, with a desirable complexion, not to be touched with the body, trembling,

original: jñeyā bhāgaṃ sahasāno vareṇa tvādūtāso manuvad vadema
analyzed: jñeyāḥ bhāgam sahasānaḥ vareṇa tvādūtāsaḥ manu vat vadema
translated: To be known, conquering, with a share, through a boon, may we speak as messengers like Manu.

original: anūnamagniṃ juhvā vacasyā madhupṛcaṃ dhanasājohavīmi
analyzed: anūnam agnim juhvā vacasyā madhu pṛcam dhanasā johavīmi
translated: With my tongue, with speech, I invoke Agni, the one with a honey-sweet hymn, the winner of wealth,

original: śrudhī havamindra mā riśaṇyaḥ syāma te dāvane vasūnām
analyzed: śrudhi havam indra mā riśaṇyaḥ syāma te dāvane vasūnām
translated: Listen to the call, O Indra, let not our enemies prevail. We are yours to give of the treasures.

original: imā hi tvāmūrjo vardhayanti vasūyavaḥ sindhavo na kṣarantaḥ
analyzed: imāḥ hi tvām ūrjaḥ vardhayanti vasūyavaḥ sindhavaḥ na kṣarantaḥ
translated: For these powers of yours increase you, seeking wealth, like streams flowing, not decreasing.

original: sṛjo mahīrindra yā apinvaḥ pariṣṭhitā ahinā śūra pūrvīḥ
analyzed: sṛjaḥ mahīḥ indra yāḥ apinvaḥ pariṣṭhitāḥ ahinā śūra pūrvīḥ
translated: O Indra, the great ones which you have filled, the many which are surrounded by the serpent,

original: amartyaṃ cid dāsaṃ manyamānamavābhinadukthairvāvṛdhānaḥ🔽uktheṣvin nu śūra yeṣu cākan stomeṣvindra rudriyeṣu ca
analyzed: amartyam cit dāsam manyamānam avābhinat ukthaiḥ vāvṛdhānaḥ  uktheṣu id nu śūra yeṣu cākan stomeṣu indra rudriyeṣu ca
translated: The Dāsa who thought himself immortal, you have struck down with hymns, having grown strong.🔽In the hymns, O hero, in which you delight, in the praises, O Indra, in the Rudra hymns,

original: tubhyedetā yāsu mandasānaḥ pra vāyave sisrate na śubhrāḥ
analyzed: tubhya id etāḥ yāsu mandasānaḥ pra vāyave sisrate na śubhrāḥ
translated: To you, in which you rejoice, the bright ones flow forth like streams for Vāyu.

original: śubhraṃ nu te śuṣmaṃ vardhayantaḥ śubhraṃ vajraṃ bāhvordadhānāḥ
analyzed: śubhram nu te śuṣmam vardhayantaḥ śubhram vajram bāhvoḥ dadhānāḥ
translated: Exalting thy pure strength, placing in thy arms thy pure thunderbolt,

original: śubhrastvamindra vāvṛdhāno asme dāsīrviśaḥ sūryeṇa sahyāḥ
analyzed: śubhraḥ tvam indra vāvṛdhānaḥ asme dāsīḥ viśaḥ sūryeṇa sahyāḥ
translated: Thou, O Indra, hast become pure, to be magnified, to be worshipped, O thou of great bounty.

original: guhā hitaṃ guhyaṃ gūḷhamapsvapīvṛtaṃ māyinaṃ kṣiyantam
analyzed: guhā hitam guhyam gūḍham apsu apīvṛtam māyinam kṣiyantam
translated: The hidden, the secret, the concealed in the waters, the guileful one who dwells in the earth,

original: uto apo dyāṃ tastabhvāṃsamahannahiṃ śūra vīryeṇa
analyzed: uta u apaḥ dyām tastabhvāṃsam ahan ahim śūra vīryeṇa
translated: And the sky, O hero, thou hast expanded with thy power, thou hast expanded the serpent.

original: stavā nu ta indra pūrvyā mahānyuta stavāma nūtanā kṛtāni
analyzed: stavā nu te indra pūrvyā mahāni uta stavāma nūtanā kṛtāni
translated: Now I will praise thy ancient greatness, O Indra, and also thy recent deeds.

original: stavā vajraṃ bāhvoruśantaṃ stavā harī sūryasya ketū
analyzed: stavā vajram bāhvā ūru śantam stavā harī sūryasya ketū
translated: I will praise thy thunderbolt that delights in thy arms, I will praise thy two bay steeds, the banners of the sun.

original: harī nu ta indra vājayantā ghṛtaścutaṃ svāramasvārṣṭām
analyzed: harī nu te indra vājayantā ghṛtaścutam svāram asvārṣṭām
translated: Now, O Indra, let thy two bay steeds, the bestowers of strength, carry thee to the place that drops with ghee, to the place that is to be enjoyed.

original: vi samanā bhūmiraprathiṣṭāraṃsta parvataścit sariṣyan
analyzed: vi samanā bhūmiḥ aprathiṣṭa araṃsta parvataḥ cit sariṣyan
translated: The earth, the common place, has been extended, the mountain has rejoiced, as if about to move.

original: ni parvataḥ sādyaprayuchan saṃ mātṛbhirvāvaśāno akrān
analyzed: ni parvataḥ sādya prayuchan sam mātṛbhiḥ vāvaśānaḥ akrān
translated: The mountain, the firm one, has been shaken, rejoicing with its mothers, it has been moved.

original: dūre pāre vāṇīṃ vardhayanta indreṣitāṃ dhamaniṃ paprathan ni🔽indro mahāṃ sindhumāśayānaṃ māyāvinaṃ vṛtramasphuran niḥ
analyzed: dūre pāre vāṇīm vardhayantaḥ indra iṣitām dhamanim paprathat ni  indraḥ mahām sindhum āśayānam māyāvinam vṛtram asphurat niḥ
translated: From afar, from the other side, they have magnified the voice, they have extended the wind impelled by Indra.🔽Indra has shattered Vṛtra, the deceitful one, who lay in the great abode, in the water.

original: arejetāṃ rodasī bhiyāne kanikradato vṛṣṇo asya vajrāt
analyzed: arejetām rodasī bhiyāne kanikradataḥ vṛṣṇaḥ asya vajrāt
translated: The two world-halves have trembled in fear of his roaring, of the roar of this powerful one, of his thunderbolt.

original: aroravīd vṛṣṇo asya vajro 'mānuṣaṃ yan mānuṣo nijūrvāt
analyzed: aroravīt vṛṣṇaḥ asya vajraḥ mānuṣam yat mānuṣaḥ nijūrvāt
translated: The thunderbolt of this brown (bull) has roared, when the human (Indra) has driven away the superhuman (Dasyus).

original: ni māyino dānavasya māyā apādayat papivān sutasya🔽pibāpibedindra śūra somaṃ mandantu tvā mandinaḥ sutāsaḥ
analyzed: ni māyinaḥ dānavasya māyāḥ apādayat papivān sutasya  piba ā piba id indra śūra somam mandantu tvā mandinaḥ sutāsaḥ
translated: The drinker has cast away the illusions of the deceitful Dānava, of the pressed (Soma).🔽Drink, O Indra, the Soma, O hero! Let the gladdening juices gladden thee!

original: pṛṇantaste kukṣī vardhayantvitthā sutaḥ paura indramāva
analyzed: pṛṇantaḥ te kukṣī vardhayantu itthā sutaḥ pauraḥ indram āva
translated: May the full ones fill thee, and make thy sides to swell. Thus pressed, O thou of the city, for Indra.

original: tve indrāpyabhūma viprā dhiyaṃ vanema ṛtayā sapantaḥ
analyzed: tve indra apyabhūma viprāḥ dhiyam vanema ṛtayā sapantaḥ
translated: We have come to thee, O Indra, O sages, to gain the thought, longing with holy order.

original: avasyavo dhīmahi praśastiṃ sadyaste rāyo dāvane syāma
analyzed: avasyavaḥ dhīmahi praśastim sadyas te rāyaḥ dāvane syāma
translated: We will gain the praise, O thou who art to be invoked. May we be the first to obtain thy wealth.

original: syāma te ta indra ye ta ūtī avasyava ūrjaṃ vardhayantaḥ
analyzed: syāma te te indra ye te ūtī avasyavaḥ ūrjam vardhayantaḥ
translated: May we be they, O Indra, who are thy helpers, increasing strength, O thou who art to be invoked.

original: śuṣmintamaṃ yaṃ cākanāma devāsme rayiṃ rāsi vīravantam
analyzed: śuṣmintamam yam cākanāma deva asme rayim rāsi vīravantam
translated: The most powerful whom we have chosen, O god, bestow on us that wealth, O Indra, which is full of heroes.

original: rāsi kṣayaṃ rāsi mitramasme rāsi śardha indra mārutaṃnaḥ
analyzed: rāsi kṣayam rāsi mitram asme rāsi śardhaḥ indra mārutam naḥ
translated: Bestow a home, bestow a friend on us. Bestow the Marut host on us, O Indra.

original: sajoṣaso ye ca mandasānāḥ pra vāyavaḥ pāntyagraṇītim
analyzed: sajoṣasaḥ ye ca mandasānāḥ pra vāyavaḥ pānti agraṇītim
translated: Those who are of one mind with thee, and those who rejoice, the Vāyus, protect the leader.

original: vyantvin nu yeṣu mandasānastṛpat somaṃ pāhi drahyadindra
analyzed: vyantu id nu yeṣu mandasānaḥ tṛpat somam pāhi drahyat indra
translated: Do thou rejoice in those in whom thou rejoicest. Drink the Soma to thy fill, be strong, O Indra.

original: asmān su pṛtsvā tarutrāvardhayo dyāṃ bṛhadbhirarkaiḥ
analyzed: asmān su pṛtsva tarutra avardhayaḥ dyām bṛhadbhiḥ arkaiḥ
translated: In battles thou hast helped us, O thou who art to be invoked. Thou hast increased the heaven with thy great hymns.

original: bṛhanta in nu ye te tarutrokthebhirvā sumnamāvivāsān
analyzed: bṛhantaḥ id nu ye te tarutra ukthebhiḥ vā sumnam āvivāsān
translated: O mighty one, who will invite you with lauds, O conqueror, to favor?

original: stṛṇānāso barhiḥ pastyāvat tvotā idindra vājamagman
analyzed: stṛṇānāsaḥ barhiḥ pastyāvat tvotāḥ id indra vājam agman
translated: Spreading the grass, protected by the people, urged on by you, O Indra, they have come for the prize.

original: ugreṣvin nu śūra mandasānastrikadrukeṣu pāhi somamindra🔽pradodhuvacchmaśruṣu prīṇāno yāhi haribhyāṃ sutasyapītim
analyzed: ugreṣu id nu śūra mandasānaḥ trikadrukeṣu pāhi somam indra  pradodhuvat śmaśruṣu prīṇānaḥ yāhi haribhyām sutasya pītim
translated: O mighty one, O hero, rejoicing in the fierce (drink), protect the Soma for Indra on the Trikadruka (mountain).🔽Licking the beard, delighting in the mouth, come to the drinking of the pressed (Soma) with the two bay horses.

original: dhiṣvā śavaḥ śūra yena vṛtramavābhinad dānumaurṇavābham🔽apāvṛṇorjyotirāryāya ni savyataḥ sādi dasyurindra
analyzed: dhiṣva śavaḥ śūra yena vṛtram avābhinat dānum aurṇavābham  apāvṛṇoḥ jyotiḥ āryāya ni savyatas sādi dasyuḥ indra
translated: Sharpen your strength, O hero, with which you struck down the cloud-like Vrtra, the Dânu.🔽You opened the light for the Ârya; from the left side the Dasyu was driven away by you, O Indra.

original: sanema ye ta ūtibhistaranto viśvā spṛdha āryeṇa dasyūn
analyzed: sanema ye te ūtibhiḥ tarantaḥ viśvāḥ spṛdhaḥ āryeṇa dasyūn
translated: May we, with your help, O Indra, crossing all our enemies, overcome the Dasyus with the Ârya.

original: asmabhyaṃ tat tvāṣṭraṃ viśvarūpamarandhayaḥ sākhyasya tritāya
analyzed: asmabhyam tat tvāṣṭram viśva rūpam arandhayaḥ sākhyasya tritāya
translated: You gave to Trita of Sâkhya the Tvastr-formed (bull), which had all colors, for his share.

original: asya suvānasya mandinastritasya nyarbudaṃ vāvṛdhāno astaḥ
analyzed: asya suvānasya mandinaḥ tritasya nyarbudam vāvṛdhānaḥ astaḥ
translated: Having grown, he left the Nyarbudi of Trita, of this gladdening one who was pressed.

original: avartayat sūryo na cakraṃ bhinad valamindro aṅgirasvān
analyzed: avartayat sūryaḥ na cakram bhinat valam indraḥ aṅgirasvān
translated: The sun turned his wheel; Indra, the Angiras, cleft the cloud.

original: nūnaṃ sā te prati varaṃ jaritre duhīyadindra dakṣiṇā maghonī
analyzed: nūnam sā te prati varam jaritre duhīyat indra dakṣiṇā maghonī
translated: That same (cow) of yours, O Indra, which yields a reward to the singer, should now yield a rich gift to the praiser.

original: śikṣā stotṛbhyo māti dhag bhago no bṛhad vadema v / s /
analyzed: śikṣa stotṛbhyaḥ mā ati dhak bhagaḥ naḥ bṛhat vadema u s
translated: Do not let the good fortune of the praisers be destroyed; may we speak lofty words, O lord of the bay horses.

original: yo jāta eva prathamo manasvān devo devān kratunā paryabhūṣat
analyzed: yaḥ jātaḥ eva prathamaḥ manasvān devaḥ devān kratunā paryabhūṣat
translated: He who, born first, the wise one, the god, by his will hath surpassed the gods,

original: yasya śuṣmād rodasī abhyasetāṃ nṛmṇasya mahnā sa janāsa indraḥ
analyzed: yasya śuṣmāt rodasī abhyasetām nṛmṇasya mahnā sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: Through whose might the two worlds have been shaken, through the greatness of his manliness, he is Indra among men.

original: yaḥ pṛthivīṃ vyathamānāmadṛṃhad yaḥ parvatān prakupitānaramṇāt
analyzed: yaḥ pṛthivīm vyathamānām adṛṃhat yaḥ parvatān prakupitān aramṇāt
translated: He who steadied the trembling earth, who calmed the angry mountains,

original: yo antarikṣaṃ vimame varīyo yo dyāmastabhnāt sa janāsa indraḥ
analyzed: yaḥ antarikṣam vimame varīyaḥ yaḥ dyām astabhnāt sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: Who measured out the wider atmosphere, who set the sky in place, he is Indra among men.

original: yo hatvāhimariṇāt sapta sindhūn yo gā udājadapadhā valasya
analyzed: yaḥ hatvā ahim ariṇāt sapta sindhūn yaḥ gāḥ udājat apadhāḥ valasya
translated: He who slew the demon and released the seven rivers, who milked out the cows from the cave of Vala,

original: yo aśmanorantaragniṃ jajāna saṃvṛk samatsu s / j / i /
analyzed: yaḥ aśmanoḥ antar agnim jajāna saṃvṛj samatsu s j i
translated: Who from the cleft of the rock gave birth to Agni, who is victorious in battles, he is Indra among men.

original: yenemā viśvā cyavanā kṛtāni yo dāsaṃ varṇamadharaṃguhākaḥ🔽śvaghnīva yo jigīvān lakṣamādadaryaḥ puṣṭāni s / j / i /🔽yaṃ smā pṛchanti kuha seti ghoramutemāhurnaiṣo astītyenam
analyzed: yena imā viśvā cyavanā kṛtāni yaḥ dāsam varṇam adharaṃguhā akaḥ  śvaghnī iva yaḥ jigīvān lakṣam adadaryaḥ puṣṭāni s i  yam sma pṛcchanti kuha sa iti ghoram uta imā āhuḥ na eṣaḥ asti iti enam
translated: By whom all these things have been made to move, who has hidden the lowest caste, the Dasa,🔽Like a victorious dog-keeper, he takes away the wealth of the enemy, he is Indra among men.🔽When they ask, Where is he, the terrible one? they say, He does not exist.

original: so aryaḥ puṣtīrvija ivā mināti śradasmai dhattas / j / i /
analyzed: saḥ aryaḥ puṣtīḥ vijaḥ iva ā mināti śradasmai dhattaḥ i
translated: But he, like a victorious one, takes away the wealth of the enemy, give to him who believes, he is Indra among men.

original: yo radhrasya coditā yaḥ kṛśasya yo brahmaṇo nādhamānasyakīreḥ
analyzed: yaḥ radhrasya coditā yaḥ kṛśasya yaḥ brahmaṇaḥ nādhamānasya akīreḥ
translated: He who impels the poor, the weak, the one who sings the praise of the Brahman who is lowly,

original: yuktagrāvṇo yo 'vitā suśipraḥ sutasomasya s / j / i /
analyzed: yukta grāvṇaḥ yaḥ vitā su śipraḥ suta somasya ā i
translated: The protector of the Soma-presser, O thou of fair eyebrows, of him whose stones are rightly placed,

original: yasyāśvāsaḥ pradiśi yasya gāvo yasya grāmā yasya viśve rathāsaḥ
analyzed: yasya aśvāsaḥ pradiśi yasya gāvaḥ yasya grāmāḥ yasya viśve rathāsaḥ
translated: Whose horses are in the east, whose cows, whose villages, whose all chariots,

original: yaḥ sūryaṃ ya uṣasaṃ jajāna yo apāṃ netā s / j / i /
analyzed: yaḥ sūryam yaḥ uṣasam jajāna yaḥ apām netā s i
translated: Who begat the sun, who begat the dawn, who is the leader of the waters,

original: yaṃ krandasī saṃyatī vihvayete pare 'vara ubhayā amitrāḥ
analyzed: yam krandasī saṃyatī vihvayete pare vare ubhayāḥ amitrāḥ
translated: Whom the two roaring armies, the distant and the near, the enemies on both sides, make to tremble,

original: samānaṃ cid rathamātasthivāṃsā nānā havete s / j / i /
analyzed: samānam cit ratham ātasthivāṃsā nānā havete
translated: Though seated in the same chariot, they call upon him separately,

original: yasmān na ṛte vijayante janāso yaṃ yudhyamānā avase havante
analyzed: yasmāt na ṛte vijayante janāsaḥ yam yudhyamānāḥ avase havante
translated: From whom the people are not victorious without, whom they invoke for help in battle,

original: yo viśvasya pratimānaṃ babhūva yo acyutacyut s / j / i /
analyzed: yaḥ viśvasya pratimānam babhūva yaḥ a cyuta cyut
translated: Who has become the measure of all, who is the mover of the unmoving,

original: yaḥ śaśvato mahyeno dadhānānamanyamānāñcharvā jaghāna
analyzed: yaḥ śaśvataḥ mahyenaḥ dadhānān a manyamānān śarvā jaghāna
translated: Who slew with his own might those who were always giving great offence, who were arrogant,

original: yaḥ śardhate nānudadāti śṛdhyāṃ yo dasyorhantās / j / i /
analyzed: yaḥ śardhate na anudadāti śṛdhyām yaḥ dasyoḥ hantā i
translated: Who does not give way to the one who threatens, who is the slayer of the Dasyu,

original: yaḥ śambaraṃ parvateṣu kṣiyantaṃ catvāriṃśyāṃ śaradyanvavindat
analyzed: yaḥ śambaram parvateṣu kṣiyantam catvāriṃśyām śaradi anvavindat
translated: Who found in the autumn of forty years Śambara lying on the mountains,

original: ojāyamānaṃ yo ahiṃ jaghāna dānuṃ śayānaṃs / j / i /
analyzed: ojāyamānam yaḥ ahim jaghāna dānum śayānaḥ j i
translated: Who slew the swollen serpent, who slew the lying Dānu,

original: yaḥ saptaraśmirvṛṣabhastuviṣmānavāsṛjat sartave saptasindhūn
analyzed: yaḥ sapta raśmiḥ vṛṣabhaḥ tuviṣmān avāsṛjat sartave sapta sindhūn
translated: Who, the seven-rayed bull of great power, let loose the seven rivers to flow.

original: yo rauhiṇamasphurad vajrabāhurdyāmārohantaṃs / j / i /
analyzed: yaḥ rauhiṇam asphurat vajra bāhuḥ dyām ārohantam i
translated: He whose arm with the thunderbolt flashes, who, ascending to the sky, is the lord of the people.

original: dyāvā cidasmai pṛthivī namete śuṣmāccidasya parvatā bhayante
analyzed: dyāvā cit asmai pṛthivī namete śuṣmāt cit asya parvatāḥ bhayante
translated: Even the sky and earth bow to him, and the mountains tremble at his might.

original: yaḥ somapā nicito vajrabāhuryo vajrahastaḥ s / j / i /
analyzed: yaḥ soma pā nicitaḥ vajra bāhuḥ yaḥ vajra hastaḥ s i
translated: He who is the Soma-drinker, the one with the thunderbolt in his arm, he who has the thunderbolt in his hand, is the lord of the people.

original: yaḥ sunvantamavati yaḥ pacantaṃ yaḥ śaṃsantaṃ yaḥ śaśamānamūtī
analyzed: yaḥ sunvantam avati yaḥ pacantam yaḥ śaṃsantam yaḥ śaśamānam ūtī
translated: He who protects the one who presses, the one who cooks, the one who praises, the one who strives,

original: yasya brahma vardhanaṃ yasya somo yasyedaṃ rādhaḥ s / j / i /
analyzed: yasya brahma vardhanam yasya somaḥ yasya idam rādhaḥ
translated: whose strength is prayer, whose is Soma, whose is this gift, is the lord of the people.

original: yaḥ sunvate pacate dudhra ā cid vājaṃ dardarṣi sa kilāsi satyaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ sunvate pacate dudhraḥ ā cit vājam dardarṣi sa kila asi satyaḥ
translated: He who even to the one who presses and cooks the oblation bestows strength, he is indeed the true one.

original: vayaṃ ta indra viśvaha priyāsaḥ suvīrāso vidathamā vadema
analyzed: vayam te indra viśvaha priyāsaḥ su vīrāsaḥ vidathamā vadema
translated: We, O Indra, all of us, your dear ones, with good heroes, may we speak in the assembly.

original: ṛturjanitrī tasyā apas pari makṣū jāta āviśad yāsu vardhate
analyzed: ṛtuḥ janitrī tasyāḥ apaḥ pari makṣū jātaḥ āviśat yāsu vardhate
translated: The season is the mother, the waters are its surroundings. The one who is born quickly enters the waters in which he grows.

original: tadāhanā abhavat pipyuṣī payo 'ṃśoḥ pīyūṣaṃ prathamaṃ tadukthyam
analyzed: tadā ahanāḥ abhavat pipyuṣī payaḥ ṃśoḥ pīyūṣam prathamam tat ukthyam
translated: That became the swelling milk, the first milk of the portion, that is the Ukthya.

original: sadhrīmā yanti pari bibhratīḥ payo viśvapsnyāya pra bharanta bhojanam
analyzed: sadhrīmāḥ yanti pari bibhratīḥ payaḥ viśvapsnyāya pra bharanta bhojanam
translated: The Sradhas go around, bearing the milk, they bring the food for the all-nourishing one.

original: samāno adhvā pravatāmanuṣyade yastākṛṇoḥ prathamaṃ sāsyukthyaḥ
analyzed: samānaḥ adhvā pravatām anuṣya de yaḥ tā akṛṇoḥ prathamam sa asi ukthyaḥ
translated: The common path of the rivers is the one you made first, that is the Ukthya.

original: anveko vadati yad dadāti tad rūpā minan tadapā eka īyate
analyzed: anu ekaḥ vadati yat dadāti tat rūpā minan tad apāḥ ekaḥ īyate
translated: One says that he gives, another that he takes away form, one goes to him as an enemy.

original: viśvā ekasya vinudastitikṣate yastākṛ / / /
analyzed: viśvāḥ ekasya vinudaḥ titikṣate yaḥ tākṛ
translated: The punishments of one are endured by all, he who...

original: prajābhyaḥ puṣṭiṃ vibhajanta āsate rayimiva pṛṣṭhaṃ prabhavantamāyate
analyzed: prajābhyaḥ puṣṭim vibhajantaḥ āsate rayim iva pṛṣṭham prabhavantam āyate
translated: They sit dividing nourishment for the people, like wealth they extend to the back.

original: asinvan daṃṣṭraiḥ pituratti bhojanaṃ yastākṛ / / /
analyzed: asinvan daṃṣṭraiḥ pituḥ atti bhojanam
translated: Without chewing, he eats his father's food with his teeth, he who...

original: adhākṛṇoḥ pṛthivīṃ sandṛśe dive yo dhautīnāmahihannāriṇak pathaḥ
analyzed: adha akṛṇoḥ pṛthivīm sandṛśe dive yaḥ dhautīnām ahi han āriṇak pathaḥ
translated: You have made the earth visible to the sky, he who, slaying the serpents of the clouds, has cleared the paths.

original: taṃ tvā stomebhirudabhirna vājinaṃ devaṃ devā ajanan sāsyukthyaḥ
analyzed: tam tvā stomebhiḥ udabhiḥ na vājinam devam devāḥ ajanan sa asi ukthyaḥ
translated: You, O God, the gods have generated with praises, like a strong horse, he who is worthy of praise.

original: yo bhojanaṃ ca dayase ca vardhanamārdrādā śuṣkaṃ madhumad dudohitha
analyzed: yaḥ bhojanam ca dayase ca vardhanam ārdrāt ā śuṣkam madhumat dudohitha
translated: You who give food and increase, from the moist you have milked the dry, the sweet.

original: sa śevadhiṃ ni dadhiṣe vivasvati viśvasyaika īśiṣe sāsyu /
analyzed: sa śevadhim ni dadhiṣe vivasvati viśvasya ekaḥ īśiṣe sa asyu
translated: You have placed the treasure in the sun, you are the sole lord of all, he who is worthy of praise.

original: yaḥ puṣpiṇīśca prasvaśca dharmaṇādhi dāne vyavanīradhārayaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ puṣpiṇīḥ ca prasvaḥ ca dharmaṇā adhi dāne
translated: You who by law have placed the flowering and the unflowering in the gift, the waters and the land.

original: yaścāsamā ajano didyuto diva ururūrvānabhitaḥ s / u /
analyzed: yaḥ ca asamāḥ ajanaḥ didyutaḥ divaḥ uruḥ ūrva an abhitas s
translated: And you who have generated the unequal flashes of lightning from the sky, the wide and the narrow, the near and the distant.

original: yo nārmaraṃ sahavasuṃ nihantave pṛkṣāya ca dāsaveśāya cāvahaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ nārmaram sahavasum nihantave pṛkṣāya ca dāsaveśāya ca avahaḥ
translated: You who have brought the treasure with wealth to slay the demon, for the wild beast and for the lord of the Dasyus.

original: ūrjayantyā apariviṣṭamāsyamutaivādya purukṛts / u /
analyzed: ūrjayantyāḥ apariviṣṭam āsyam uta eva adya puru kṛt u
translated: With the nourishing one, your mouth untouched, and today, O much-worker, you...

original: śataṃ vā yasya daśa sākamādya ekasya śruṣṭau yad dhacodamāvitha🔽arajjau dasyūn samunab dabhītaye suprāvyoabhavaḥ s / u /
analyzed: śatam vā yasya daśa sākamādyaḥ ekasya śruṣṭau yat hacodamāvitha  a rajjau dasyūn samunap dabhītaye su
translated: He whose hundred or ten are together at once, when thou didst help one in his hearing, in his call.🔽Thou madest the Dasyus, without a cord, for Dabhîti, easy to be conquered, O Indra.

original: viśvedanu rodhanā asya pauṃsyaṃ dadurasmai dadhire kṛtnave dhanam
analyzed: viśvā id anu rodhanā asya pauṃsyam daduḥ asmai dadhire kṛtnave dhanam
translated: All the barriers of his manly power they gave to him, they gave wealth to Kṛtnu.

original: ṣaḷ astabhnā viṣṭiraḥ pañca sandṛśaḥ pariparo abhavaḥ s / u /🔽supravācanaṃ tava vīra vīryaṃ yadekena kratunā vindase vasu
analyzed: ṣaḍ astabhnāḥ viṣṭiraḥ pañca sandṛśaḥ pariparaḥ abhavaḥ s u  su pravācanam tava vīra vīryam yat ekena kratunā vindase vasu
translated: Thou didst support the five regions, the five sights, thou didst become the all-surrounding, O Indra.🔽The praiseworthy deed of thine, O hero, is thy manly power, that by one sacrifice thou findest wealth.

original: jātūṣṭhirasya pra vayaḥ sahasvato yā cakartha sendra viśvāsyukthyaḥ
analyzed: jātūṣṭhirasya pra vayaḥ sahasvataḥ yā cakartha sa indra viśvā asi ukthyaḥ
translated: The strength of Jâtuṣṭhira, the mighty one, which thou didst make, O Indra, is worthy of all praise.

original: aramayaḥ sarapasastarāya kaṃ turvītaye ca vayyāya ca srutim
analyzed: aramayaḥ sarapasastarāya kam turvītaye ca vayyāya ca srutim
translated: Thou madest easy the path for Turvîti and Vyaṣva to travel, O thou who art easily invoked.

original: nīcā santamudanayaḥ parāvṛjaṃ prāndhaṃ śroṇaṃ śravayan s / u /
analyzed: nīcā santam udanayaḥ parāvṛjam pra andham śroṇam śravayan s u
translated: Thou didst raise up the low, the distant, the blind, the lame, making them hear, O Indra.

original: asmabhyaṃ tad vaso dānāya rādhaḥ samarthayasva bahu te vasavyam
analyzed: asmabhyam tat vaso dānāya rādhaḥ samarthayasva bahu te vasavyam
translated: That bounty, O Vasu, for our gift, make ready for us: thou hast much wealth, O Indra.

original: indra yaccitraṃ śravasyā anu dyūn bṛhad vadema v / s /
analyzed: indra yat citram śravasyāḥ anu dyūn bṛhat vadema s
translated: O Indra, that wonderful glory which we may obtain through the days, let us speak it forth, O Indra.

original: adhvaryavo bharatendrāya somamāmatrebhiḥ siñcatā madyamandhaḥ
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ bharata indrāya somam āmatrebhiḥ siñcata madyam andhaḥ
translated: O Adhvaryus, bring the Soma to Indra, pour the intoxicating drink with the cups.

original: kāmī hi vīraḥ sadamasya pītiṃ juhota vṛṣṇe tadideśa vaṣṭi
analyzed: kāmī hi vīraḥ sadamasya pītim juhota vṛṣṇe tat dideśa vaṣṭi
translated: For the hero, the lover, is ever ready to offer his draught to the strong one, he has appointed it, he desires it.

original: adhvaryavo yo apo vavrivāṃsaṃ vṛtraṃ jaghānāśanyeva vṛkṣam
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ yaḥ apaḥ vavrivāṃsam vṛtram jaghāna aśanyā iva vṛkṣam
translated: O Adhvaryus, he who struck down the cloud-covered Vrtra like a tree with a thunderbolt,

original: tasmā etaṃ bharata tadvaśāyaneṣa indro arhati pītimasya
analyzed: tasmai etam bharata tad vaśāyan iṣaḥ indraḥ arhati pītimasya
translated: To him, O Bharata, to him who is to be served, Indra deserves the drink of this (Soma).

original: adhvaryavo yo dṛbhīkaṃ jaghāna yo gā udājadapa hi valaṃ vaḥ
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ yaḥ dṛbhīkam jaghāna yaḥ gāḥ udājat apa hi valam vaḥ
translated: O Adhvaryus, he who struck down Dṛbhīka, who brought forth the cows, who split your rock,

original: tasmā etamantarikṣe na vātamindraṃ somairorṇuta jūrna vastraiḥ
analyzed: tasmai etam antarikṣe na vātam indram somaiḥ orṇuta jūḥ na vastraiḥ
translated: To him, to Indra, in the atmosphere like the wind, anoint with the Somas, as with garments.

original: adhvaryavo ya uraṇaṃ jaghāna nava cakhvāṃsaṃ navatiṃ cabāhūn
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ yaḥ uraṇam jaghāna nava cakhvāṃsam navatim cabāhūn
translated: O Adhvaryus, he who struck down Uraṇa, and the nine-and-ninety, and the nine,

original: yo arbudamava nīcā babādhe tamindraṃ somasyabhṛthe hinota
analyzed: yaḥ arbudam ava nīcā babādhe tam indram soma syabhṛthe hinota
translated: Who oppressed the demon Arbudi with his might, to him, to Indra, lead him to the bath of Soma.

original: adhvaryavo yaḥ svaśnaṃ jaghāna yaḥ śuṣṇamaśuṣaṃ yo vyaṃsam
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ yaḥ su aśnam jaghāna yaḥ śuṣṇam aśuṣam yaḥ vyaṃsam
translated: O Adhvaryus, he who struck down Svaṣna, who struck down Śuṣṇa, the wicked, who struck down Vyansa,

original: yaḥ pipruṃ namuciṃ yo rudhikrāṃ tasmā indrāyāndhaso juhota🔽adhvaryavo yaḥ śataṃ śambarasya puro bibhedāśmaneva pūrvīḥ
analyzed: yaḥ piprum namucim yaḥ rudhikrām tasmai indrāya andhasaḥ juhota  adhvaryavaḥ yaḥ śatam śambarasya puraḥ bibheda aśmanā iva pūrvīḥ
translated: Who struck down Pipru, Namuci, and Rudhikra, to him, to Indra, offer the drink.🔽O Adhvaryus, he who split a hundred of Śambara's forts like many (other) forts,

original: yo varcinaḥ śatamindraḥ sahasramapāvapad bharatāsomamasmai
analyzed: yaḥ varcinaḥ śatam indraḥ sahasram apāvapat bharatāsomam asmai
translated: Who cast down a hundred and a thousand of the Vr̥itchas, to him, to Indra, bring the Soma.

original: adhvaryavo yaḥ śatamā sahasraṃ bhūmyā upasthe 'vapajjaghanvān
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ yaḥ śatamā sahasram bhūmyāḥ upasthe vapat jaghanvān
translated: O Adhvaryus, he who, with a hundred, with a thousand, bent his knee in the lap of the earth,

original: kutsasyāyoratithigvasya vīrān nyāvṛṇag bharatā somamasmai
analyzed: kutsasya āyoḥ atithigvasya vīrān nyāvṛṇak bharatā somam asmai
translated: The heroes of Kutsa's son Atithigva, the Bharatas have brought him Soma.

original: adhvaryavo yan naraḥ kāmayādhve śruṣṭī vahanto naśathā tadindre🔽gabhastipūtaṃ bharata śrutāyendrāya somaṃ yajyavo juhota
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ yat naraḥ kāmayādhve śruṣṭī vahantaḥ naśatha tat indre  gabhasti pūtam bharata śrutāya indrāya somam yajyavaḥ juhota
translated: O Adhvaryus, if men desire to hear, carrying the oblations, go to that for Indra.🔽Bring the Soma purified in the filter, O Bharatas, for the famous Indra; offer the Soma to be sacrificed to.

original: adhvaryavaḥ kartanā śruṣṭimasmai vane nipūtaṃ vana un nayadhvam🔽juṣāṇo hastyamabhi vāvaśe va indrāya somaṃ madiraṃ juhota
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ kartana śruṣṭim asmai vane nipūtam vane ud nayadhvam  juṣāṇaḥ hastyam abhi vāvaśe vaḥ indrāya somam madiram juhota
translated: O Adhvaryus, for him who hears, cut out; bring from the wood the Soma purified in the wood.🔽Accepting the oblation, be inclined to us; offer to Indra the intoxicating Soma.

original: adhvaryavaḥ payasodharyathā goḥ somebhirīṃ pṛṇatā bhojamindram
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ payasodharyathā goḥ somebhiḥ īm pṛṇata bhojam indram
translated: O Adhvaryus, as the milk of the cow is guarded, so with the Somas fill Indra, the enjoyer.

original: vedāhamasya nibhṛtaṃ ma etad ditsantaṃ bhūyo yajataściketa
analyzed: veda aham asya nibhṛtam me etat ditsantam bhūyas yajataḥ ciketa
translated: I know his secret, I have understood the giver, and him who sacrifices more.

original: adhvaryavo yo divyasya vasvo yaḥ pārthivasya kṣamyasya rājā🔽tamūrdaraṃ na priṇatā yavenendraṃ somebhistadapovo astu
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ yaḥ divyasya vasvaḥ yaḥ pārthivasya kṣamyasya rājā  tam ūrdaram na priṇatā yavena indram somebhiḥ tat apovaḥ astu
translated: O Adhvaryus, he who is the king of heavenly wealth, of earthly, of the forgiving,🔽Him, the most bountiful, honour with barley; to Indra offer the Somas. Let that be your reward.

original: asmabhyaṃ tad / / /
analyzed: asmabhyam tat
translated: To us that...

original: pra ghā nvasya mahato mahāni satyā satyasya karaṇāni vocam
analyzed: pra ghā nu asya mahataḥ mahāni satyā satyasya karaṇāni vocam
translated: Now indeed will I proclaim the great and mighty deeds of him, the true ones of the true one.

original: trikadrukeśvapibat sutasyāsya made ahimindro jaghāna
analyzed: trikadru keśu apibat sutasya asya made ahim indraḥ jaghāna
translated: Indra, the king of Trikadruka, drank of this Soma juice, and in its intoxication he slew the dragon

original: avaṃśe dyāmastabhāyad bṛhantamā rodasī apṛṇadantarikṣam
analyzed: avaṃśe dyām astabhāyat bṛhantamā rodasī apṛṇat antarikṣam
translated: He set the lofty heaven in its place, and filled the two world-halves, the sky and the earth

original: sa dhārayad pṛthivīṃ paprathacca somasya tā mada indraścakāra
analyzed: sa dhārayat pṛthivīm paprathat ca somasya tā made indraḥ cakāra
translated: He supported the earth and extended it. Indra made this the joy of Soma

original: sadmeva prāco vi mimāya mānairvajreṇa khānyatṛṇan nadīnām
analyzed: sadma iva prācaḥ vi mimāya mānaiḥ vajreṇa khāni atṛṇat nadīnām
translated: He measured the eastern waters as in a house, and with his thunderbolt he dug the channels of the rivers

original: vṛthāsṛjat pathibhirdīrghayāthaiḥ somasya tā / / /
analyzed: vṛthā sṛjat pathibhiḥ dīrghayāthaiḥ somasya tā
translated: He set them free in the paths of long duration. Indra made this the joy of Soma

original: sa pravoḷhṝn parigatyā dabhīterviśvamadhāgāyudhamiddhe agnau
analyzed: sa pravoḷhṝn parigatya dabhīteḥ viśvam adhāk āyudham iddhe agnau
translated: He, having gone around the Pravoḷhṛs of Dabhīti, in the blazing fire, obtained all the weapons

original: saṃ gobhiraśvairasṛjad rathebhiḥ so / / /
analyzed: sam gobhiḥ aśvaiḥ asṛjat rathebhiḥ saḥ
translated: He united them with cattle, horses, and chariots. Indra made this the joy of Soma

original: sa īṃ mahīṃ dhunimetoraramṇāt so asnātṝnapārayat svasti🔽ta utsnāya rayimabhi pra tasthuḥ so / / /🔽sodañcaṃ sindhumariṇān mahitvā vajreṇāna uṣasaḥ saṃ pipeṣa
analyzed: saḥ īm mahīm dhunim etoḥ aramṇāt saḥ asnātṝn apārayat svasti  te utsnāya rayim abhi pra tasthuḥ saḥ  saḥ udañcam sindhum ariṇāt mahitvā vajreṇa anaḥ uṣasaḥ sam pipeṣa
translated: He enjoyed this great and trembling earth. He delivered the bathers safely🔽Having bathed, they went forth to abundant wealth. Indra made this the joy of Soma🔽He crossed the flowing river with his greatness, and with his thunderbolt he crushed the dawns

original: ajavaso javinībhirvivṛścan so / / /🔽sa vidvānapagohaṃ kanīnāmāvirbhavannudatiṣṭhat parāvṛk
analyzed: ajavasaḥ javinībhiḥ vivṛścan saḥ  sa vidvān apagoham kanīnām āvirbhavan udatiṣṭhat parāvṛj
translated: He, the swift one, tearing with his swiftnesses. Indra made this the joy of Soma🔽He, the wise one, having become the protector of the weak, stood up, turning away from the distant

original: prati śroṇa sthād vyanagacaṣṭa so / / /
analyzed: prati śroṇa sthāt vyanagacaṣṭa saḥ
translated: He looked down from the ridge. Indra made this the joy of Soma

original: bhinad valamaṅgirobhirgṛṇāno vi parvatasya dṛṃhitānyairat
analyzed: bhinat valam aṅgirobhiḥ gṛṇānaḥ vi parvatasya dṛṃhitāni airat
translated: Breaking the stronghold with the Aṅgiras hymns, he cleft the firm bonds of the mountain with his might

original: riṇag rodhāṃsi kṛtrimāṇyeṣāṃ so / / /
analyzed: riṇak rodhāṃsi kṛtrimāṇi eṣām saḥ
translated: He cut off their artificial barriers, he...

original: svapnenābhyupyā cumuriṃ dhuniṃ ca jaghantha dasyaṃ pra dabhītimāvaḥ
analyzed: svapnena abhyupya cumurim dhunim ca jaghantha dasyam pra dabhītim āvaḥ
translated: Having approached with sleep, thou slewest Chumuri and Dhuni, and the Dasyu, the terrible, thou slewest

original: rambhī cidatra vivide hiraṇyaṃ so / / /
analyzed: rambhī cit atra vivide hiraṇyam saḥ
translated: Even the greedy one found gold here, he...

original: nūnaṃ sā te prati / / /🔽pra vaḥ satāṃ jyeṣṭhatamāya suṣṭutimagnāviva samidhāne havirbhare
analyzed: nūnam sā te prati  pra vaḥ satām jyeṣṭhatamāya suṣṭutim agnau iva samidhāne haviḥ bhare
translated: Surely that is for thee...🔽To the most excellent of you, to Indra, we offer praise, as with fuel to a blazing fire, we bring oblations

original: indramajuryaṃ jarayantamukṣitaṃ sanād yuvānamavase havāmahe
analyzed: indram ajuryam jarayantam ukṣitam sanāt yuvānam avase havāmahe
translated: To the ever-youthful Indra, the ancient one, the youthful one, we call for help, to the one who is to be worshipped

original: yasmādindrād bṛhataḥ kiṃ caneṃ ṛte viśvānyasmin sambhṛtādhi vīryā
analyzed: yasmāt indrāt bṛhataḥ kim cana īṃ ṛte viśvāni yasmin sambhṛtā adhi vīryā
translated: From whom, from Indra, the great one, nothing is excluded, in whom all manly powers are gathered

original: jaṭhare somaṃ tanvī saho maho haste vajraṃ bharati śīrṣaṇi kratum
analyzed: jaṭhare somam tanvī sahaḥ mahaḥ haste vajram bharati śīrṣaṇi kratum
translated: In his belly he bears the Soma, in his slender body the great strength, in his hand the thunderbolt, in his head the wisdom

original: na kṣoṇībhyāṃ paribhve ta indriyaṃ na samudraiḥ parvatairindra te rathaḥ
analyzed: na kṣoṇībhyām paribhve te indriyam na samudraiḥ parvataiḥ indra te rathaḥ
translated: Neither the two worlds nor the oceans nor the mountains can obstruct thy power, O Indra, thy chariot

original: na te vajramanvaśnoti kaścana yadāśubhiḥ patasi yojanā puru
analyzed: na te vajram anvaśnoti kaścana yadā āśubhiḥ patasi yojanā puru
translated: None can equal thy thunderbolt, when thou fliest with thy swift horses many a league

original: viśve hyasmai yajatāya dhṛṣṇave kratuṃ bharanti vṛṣabhāya saścate
analyzed: viśve hi asmai yajatāya dhṛṣṇave kratum bharanti vṛṣabhāya saścate
translated: For all these, to this sacrificer, to the bold one, they bring the sacrificial essence, to the bull who is to be worshipped

original: vṛṣā yajasva haviṣā viduṣṭaraḥ pibendra somaṃ vṛṣabheṇa bhānunā
analyzed: vṛṣā yajasva haviṣā viduṣṭaraḥ piba indra somam vṛṣabheṇa bhānunā
translated: As a bull, offer oblations, more excellent, O Indra, drink the Soma with thy bull-like light

original: vṛṣṇaḥ kośaḥ pavate madhva ūrmirvṛṣabhānnāya vṛṣabhāya pātave
analyzed: vṛṣṇaḥ kośaḥ pavate madhvaḥ ūrmiḥ vṛṣabha annāya vṛṣabhāya pātave
translated: The sweet wave, the bull's vessel, flows, for the bull, for the strong one, to drink

original: vṛṣaṇādhvaryū vṛṣabhāso adrayo vṛṣaṇaṃ somaṃ vṛṣabhāya suṣvati
analyzed: vṛṣaṇā adhvaryū vṛṣabhāsaḥ adrayaḥ vṛṣaṇam somam vṛṣabhāya
translated: The bull-like Adhvaryus, the bull-like pressing-stones press the bull-like Soma for the bull-like one

original: vṛṣā te vajra uta te vṛṣā ratho vṛṣaṇā harī vṛṣabhāṇyāyudhā
analyzed: vṛṣā te vajraḥ uta te vṛṣā rathaḥ vṛṣaṇā harī vṛṣabhāṇi āyudhā
translated: Thy thunderbolt is a bull, O Indra, thy chariot is a bull, thy two bulls are bulls, thy weapons are bulls

original: vṛṣṇo madasya vṛṣabha tvamīśiṣa indra somasya vṛṣabhasya tṛpṇuhi
analyzed: vṛṣṇaḥ madasya vṛṣabha tvam īśiṣe indra somasya vṛṣabhasya tṛpṇuhi
translated: Thou art the lord of the bull's rapture, O Indra, be satisfied with the bull-like Soma

original: pra te nāvaṃ na samane vacasyuvaṃ brahmaṇā yāmi savaneṣudādhṛṣiḥ🔽kuvin no asya vacaso nibodhiṣadindramutsaṃ na vasunaḥ sicāmahe
analyzed: pra te nāvam na samane vacasyuvam brahmaṇā yāmi savaneṣu dādhṛṣiḥ  kuvid naḥ asya vacasaḥ nibodhiṣat indram utsam na vasunaḥ sicāmahe
translated: With prayer I come to thee, as in a race, to thy ship, to thy response, O thou who art not to be overcome at the libations🔽Will he not be inclined to listen to this speech of ours? We long for Indra as for a spring of wealth

original: purā sambādhādabhyā vavṛtsva no dhenurna vatsaṃ yavasasya pipyuṣī
analyzed: purā sambādhāt abhyā vavṛtsva naḥ dhenuḥ na vatsam yavasasya pipyuṣī
translated: Turn unto us from the throng, as a milch-cow to her calf, who is full of milk for the grass

original: sakṛt su te sumatibhiḥ śatakrato saṃ patnībhirna vṛṣaṇo nasīmahi
analyzed: sakṛt su te sumatibhiḥ śatakrato sam patnībhiḥ na vṛṣaṇaḥ nasīmahi
translated: Once with thy favours, O thou of a hundred powers, we will win the prize, as bulls with their mates

original: nūnaṃ sā / / /
analyzed: nūnam sā
translated: That indeed is...

original: tadasmai navyamaṅgirasvadarcata śuṣmā yadasya pratnathodīrate
analyzed: tat asmai navyam aṅgirasvat arcata śuṣmāḥ yat asya pratnathā udīrate
translated: Sing to him this new song, as to Angiras, when his ancient powers are stirred

original: viśvā yad gotrā sahasā parīvṛtā made somasya dṛṃhitānyairayat
analyzed: viśvā yat gotrā sahasā parīvṛtā made somasya dṛṃhitāni airayat
translated: When he encompassed with his might all the clans, and shook the firm ones in the rapture of the Soma.

original: sa bhutu yo ha prathamāya dhāyasa ojo mimāno mahimānamātirat
analyzed: sa bhutu yaḥ ha prathamāya dhāyasaḥ ojaḥ mimānaḥ mahimānam ātirat
translated: He who, in the first creation, having measured out strength, extended his greatness.

original: śūro yo yutsu tanvaṃ parivyata śīrṣaṇi dyāṃ mahinā pratyamuñcata
analyzed: śūraḥ yaḥ yutsu tanvam parivyata śīrṣaṇi dyām mahinā pratyamuñcata
translated: The hero who, in battle, enveloped his body, and with his might set the sky on his head.

original: adhākṛṇoḥ prathamaṃ vīryaṃ mahad yadasyāgre brahmaṇā śuṣmamairayaḥ
analyzed: adha akṛṇoḥ prathamam vīryam mahat yat asya agre brahmaṇā śuṣmam airayaḥ
translated: Then thou madest the first great deed of hero might, when thou didst send forth with prayer the strength of this (Agni).

original: ratheṣṭhena haryaśvena vicyutāḥ pra jīrayaḥ sisrate sadhryak pṛthak
analyzed: ratheṣṭhena hari aśvena vicyutāḥ pra jīrayaḥ sisrate sadhryak pṛthak
translated: The ancient ones, scattered by the charioteer with the two bay steeds, flow apart in the same place.

original: adhā yo viśvā bhuvanābhi majmaneśānakṛt pravayā abhyavardhata🔽ād rodasī jyotiṣā vahnirātanot sīvyan tamāṃsi dudhitā samavyayat
analyzed: adhā yaḥ viśvā bhuvanā abhi majmanā īśāna kṛt pravayāḥ abhyavardhata  āt rodasī jyotiṣā vahniḥ ātanot sīvyan tamāṃsi dudhitā samavyayat
translated: Then he who for the lordship of all beings by his power increased the eastern ones.🔽Then the bearer carried the two worlds with light, sewing together the dark spaces, he moved.

original: sa prācīnān parvatān dṛṃhadojasādharācīnamakṛṇodapāmapaḥ
analyzed: sa prācīnān parvatān dṛṃhat ojasā adharācīnam akṛṇot apām apaḥ
translated: He, with might, made firm the eastern mountains, and made the waters flow downward from above.

original: adhārayat pṛthivīṃ viśvadhāyasamastabhnān māyayā dyāmavasrasaḥ
analyzed: adhārayat pṛthivīm viśva dhāyasam astabhnāt māyayā dyām avasrasaḥ
translated: He supported the earth, the supporter of all, he with his magic power held the sky from falling.

original: sāsmā araṃ bāhubhyāṃ yaṃ pitākṛṇod viśvasmādā januṣo vedasas pari
analyzed: sā asmai aram bāhubhyām yam pitā akṛṇot viśvasmāt ā īṃ januṣaḥ vedasaḥ pari
translated: He whom the father made easy to be borne with his arms, him all generations know from the birth of wealth.

original: yenā pṛthivyāṃ ni kriviṃ śayadhyai vajreṇa hatvyavṛṇak tuviṣvaṇiḥ
analyzed: yena pṛthivyām ni krivim śayadhyai vajreṇa hatvī avṛṇak tuviṣvaṇiḥ
translated: With which he laid down on the earth the corpse to be slain, with the thunderbolt, the mighty one smote him who was to be slain.

original: amājūriva pitroḥ sacā satī samānādā sadasastvāmiye bhagam
analyzed: amājūḥ iva pitroḥ sacā satī samāna ādā sadasaḥ tvā āmiye bhagam
translated: Like one not yet born, being together with the parents, from the same seat, from the same assembly, I choose you, O Bhaga.

original: kṛdhi praketamupa māsyā bhara daddhi bhāgaṃ tanvo yena māmahaḥ🔽bhojaṃ tvāmindra vayaṃ huvema dadiṣ ṭvamindrāpāṃsi vājān
