analyzed: kṛdhi praketam upa mā asyāḥ bhara daddhi bhāgam tanvaḥ yena māmahaḥ  bhojam tvām indra vayam huvema dadiḥ tvam indra apāṃsi vājān
translated: Make me a good protector, bring me to your side, give me a share of the body by which I may be filled.🔽O Indra, we must invoke you as a bountiful one. You, O Indra, must give us abundant riches.

original: aviḍḍhīndra citrayā na ūti kṛdhi vṛśannindra vasyaso naḥ
analyzed: aviḍḍhi indra citrayā naḥ ūti kṛdhi vṛśan indra vasyasaḥ naḥ
translated: O Indra, grant us your wondrous help. Make us rich, O Indra, in good things.

original: nūnaṃ sā / / /
analyzed: nūnam sā
translated: That indeed is the one...

original: prātā ratho navo yoji sasniścaturyugastrikaśaḥ saptaraśmiḥ
analyzed: prātā rathaḥ navaḥ yoji sasniḥ catur yugaḥ trikaśas sapta raśmiḥ
translated: The new chariot has been yoked in the morning, swift, with four yokes, three seats, seven reins,

original: daśāritro manuṣyaḥ svarṣāḥ sa iṣṭibhirmatibhīraṃhyo bhūt
analyzed: daśa aritraḥ manuṣyaḥ svarṣāḥ saḥ iṣṭibhiḥ matibhiḥ raṃhyaḥ bhūt
translated: with ten guiding reins, self-luminous, human, it has become swift through sacrifices and thoughts.

original: sāsmā araṃ prathamaṃ sa dvitīyamuto tṛtīyaṃ manuṣaḥ sa hotā
analyzed: sa asmai aram prathamam sa dvitīyam uta u tṛtīyam manuṣaḥ sa hotā
translated: He is our first, he is our second, and he is our third human priest.

original: anyasyā garbhamanya ū jananta so anyebhiḥ sacate jenyo vṛṣā
analyzed: anyasyāḥ garbham anye u jananta saḥ anyebhiḥ sacate jenyaḥ vṛṣā
translated: Another begets the embryo of another. He, the excellent bull, associates with others.

original: harī nu kaṃ ratha indrasya yojamāyai sūktena vacasā navena
analyzed: harī nu kam rathe indrasya yojamāyai sūktena vacasā navena
translated: To which of Indra's two bays is the chariot to be yoked for his journey? With a new hymn and speech,

original: mo ṣu tvāmatra bahavo hi viprā ni rīraman yajamānāso anye
analyzed: mā u su tvām atra bahavaḥ hi viprāḥ ni rīraman yajamānāsaḥ anye
translated: O Indra, may many other sacrificers not delight you here.

original: ā dvābhyāṃ haribhyāmindra yāhyā caturbhirā ṣaḍbhirhūyamānaḥ
analyzed: ā dvābhyām haribhyām indra yāhi ā caturbhiḥ ā ṣaḍbhiḥ hūyamānaḥ
translated: Come with two tawny ones, O Indra, and with four, and with six, invoked

original: āṣṭābhirdaśabhiḥ somapeyamayaṃ sutaḥsumakha mā mṛdhas kaḥ
analyzed: ā aṣṭābhiḥ daśabhiḥ soma peya mayam sutaḥ su makha mā mṛdhaḥ kaḥ
translated: With eight, with ten, this Soma is pressed for thee to drink. O good sacrificer, let there be no strife.

original: ā viṃśatyā triṃśatā yāhyarvāṃ ā catvāriṃśatā haribhiryajānaḥ
analyzed: ā viṃśatyā triṃśatā yāhi arvān ā catvāriṃśatā haribhiḥ yajānaḥ
translated: Come with twenty, with thirty, come hither, and with forty, O worshipper with tawny ones

original: ā pañcāśatā surathebhirindrā ṣaṣṭyā saptatyā somapeyam
analyzed: ā pañcāśatā su rathebhiḥ indra ṣaṣṭyā saptatyā soma peyam
translated: With fifty, O Indra, with sixty, with seventy, with Soma to drink

original: āśītyā navatyā yāhyarvāṃ ā śatena haribhiruhyamānaḥ
analyzed: ā aśītyā navatyā yāhi arvān ā śatena haribhiḥ uhyamānaḥ
translated: With eighty, with ninety, come hither, mounted on a hundred tawny ones

original: ayaṃ hi te śunahotreṣu soma indra tvāyā pariṣikto madāya
analyzed: ayam hi te śunahotreṣu somaḥ indra tvāyā pariṣiktaḥ madāya
translated: For this Soma is thine, O Indra, among the Śunahotra priests, sprinkled around for thy rapture

original: mama brahmendra yāhyachā viśvā harī dhuri dhiṣvā rathasya
analyzed: mama brahma indra yāhi achā viśvā harī dhuri dhiṣvā rathasya
translated: With my prayer, O Indra, come hither. Place the two tawny ones in the yoke of the chariot

original: purutrā hi vihavyo babhūthāsmiñchūra savane mādayasva
analyzed: purutrā hi vihavyaḥ babhūtha asmin śūra savane mādayasva
translated: For thou hast become worthy of invocation in many ways. Rejoice, O hero, at this libation

original: na ma indreṇa sakhyaṃ vi yoṣadasmabhyamasya dakṣiṇā duhīta
analyzed: na me indreṇa sakhyam vi yoṣat asmabhyam asya dakṣiṇā duhīta
translated: Let not my friendship with Indra be severed. Let him yield to us as a milch-cow his gifts

original: upa jyeṣṭhe varūthe gabhastau prāyeprāye jigīvāṃsaḥ syāma🔽nūnaṃ sā / / /
analyzed: upa jyeṣṭhe varūthe gabhastau prāye prāye jigīvāṃsaḥ syāma  nūnam sā
translated: In the most excellent protection, in the two arms, may we be victorious in every battle🔽This indeed is thy Soma, O Indra, among the Śunahotra priests, sprinkled around for thy rapture

original: apāyyasyāndhaso madāya manīṣiṇaḥ suvānasya prayasaḥ
analyzed: apāyyasya andhasaḥ madāya manīṣiṇaḥ suvānasya prayasaḥ
translated: Of the wise one, of the one who pours out the juice, for the rapture of the drunkard,

original: yasminnindraḥ pradivi vāvṛdhāna oko dadhe brahmaṇyantaśca naraḥ
analyzed: yasmin indraḥ pradivi vāvṛdhānaḥ okaḥ dadhe brahmaṇyantaḥ ca naraḥ
translated: In whom Indra, having grown in the expanse, has placed his abode, and the men who are devoted to prayer

original: asya mandāno madhvo vajrahasto 'himindro arṇovṛtaṃ vi vṛścat
analyzed: asya mandānaḥ madhvaḥ vajra hastaḥ him indraḥ arṇaḥ vṛtam vi vṛścat
translated: May Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt, rejoicing in this sweet drink, cleave asunder the cloud-enveloped serpent.

original: pra yad vayo sa svasarāṇyachā prayāṃsi ca nadīnāṃ cakramanta
analyzed: pra yat sa svasarāṇi achā prayāṃsi ca nadīnām cakramanta
translated: When the bird has entered its own abodes and the courses of the rivers have been completed,

original: sa māhina indro arṇo apāṃ prairayadahihāchā samudram
analyzed: sa māhinaḥ indraḥ arṇaḥ apām prairayat ahihā achā samudram
translated: Indra, the mighty one, has set the waters in motion, and the serpent has gone to the ocean.

original: ajanayat sūryaṃ vidad gā aktunāhnāṃ vayunāni sādhat
analyzed: ajanayat sūryam vidat gāḥ aktunā ahnām vayunāni sādhat
translated: He has generated the sun, found the cows with his light, and accomplished the functions of the days.

original: so apratīni manave purūṇīndro dāśad dāśuṣe hanti vṛtram
analyzed: saḥ apratīni manave purūṇi indraḥ dāśat dāśuṣe hanti vṛtram
translated: Indra has given many boons to Manu, the worshipper, and he slays Vrtra.

original: sadyo yo nṛbhyo atasāyyo bhūt paspṛdhānebhyaḥ sūryasya sātau
analyzed: sadyas yaḥ nṛbhyaḥ atasāyyaḥ bhūt paspṛdhānebhyaḥ sūryasya sātau
translated: He who is most to be invoked by men has become so for those who strive in the race for the sun.

original: sa sunvata indraḥ sūryamā devo riṇaṃ martyāya stavān
analyzed: sa sunvate indraḥ sūryamā devaḥ riṇam martyāya stavān
translated: Indra, the god, has given the Soma-presser the sun, the treasure, to the mortal, when praised.

original: ā yad rayiṃ guhadavadyamasmai bharadaṃśaṃ naitaśo daśasyan
analyzed: ā yat rayim guhadavat yamasmai bharadaṃśam na etaśaḥ daśasyan
translated: When he has brought him wealth that is hidden from blame, he has favored him like a relative.

original: sa randhayat sadivaḥ sārathaye śuṣṇamaśuṣaṃ kuyavaṃ kutsāya
analyzed: sa randhayat sadivas sārathaye śuṣṇam aśuṣam kuyavam kutsāya
translated: He has given to the charioteer of the day, to Kutsa, Shushṇa, the wicked one, the evil one, to be killed.

original: divodāsāya navatiṃ ca navendraḥ puro vyairacchambarasya
analyzed: divodāsāya navatim ca nava indraḥ puraḥ vyairat śambarasya
translated: Indra has given to Divodasa ninety-nine cities of Shamvara.

original: evā ta indrocathamahema śravasyā na tmanā vājayantaḥ
analyzed: eva te indra ucatham ahema śravasyā na tmanā vājayantaḥ
translated: Thus, O Indra, we will bring you the best praise, seeking glory by ourselves, stirring up strength.

original: aśyāma tat sāptamāśuṣāṇā nanamo vadharadevasya pīyoḥ
analyzed: aśyāma tat sāptamā śuṣāṇāḥ nanamaḥ vadharadevasya pīyoḥ
translated: May we obtain that, the seventh, in our striving, the killing of the enemy of the god's drink.

original: evā te gṛtsamadāḥ śūra mamnāvasyavo na vayunāni takṣuḥ
analyzed: eva te gṛtsamadāḥ śūra mamnā avasyavaḥ na vayunāni takṣuḥ
translated: Thus, O hero, the Gritsamadas, eager for your favour, have fashioned their offerings

original: brahmaṇyanta indra te navīya iṣamūrjaṃ sukṣitiṃ sumnamaśyuḥ
analyzed: brahmaṇyantaḥ indra te navīyaḥ iṣam ūrjam su kṣitim sumnam aśyuḥ
translated: In the Brahmanas, O Indra, they have desired food, strength, good abode, and bliss.

original: nūnaṃ sā / / /
analyzed: nūnam sā
translated: That (grace) of yours, O Indra, is not to be deceived.

original: vayaṃ te vaya indra viddhi ṣu ṇaḥ pra bharāmahe vājayurna ratham
analyzed: vayam te vayaḥ indra viddhi su naḥ pra bharāmahe vājayuḥ na ratham
translated: Know us, O Indra, as your own people; we are bringing you, as one who strives for strength, a chariot.

original: vipanyavo dīdhyato manīṣā sumnamiyakṣantastvāvato nṝn
analyzed: vipanyavaḥ dīdhyataḥ manīṣā sumnam iyakṣantaḥ tvāvataḥ nṝn
translated: The wise, seeking bliss, have set their thoughts on you, O you who have many helpers, O men.

original: tvaṃ na indra tvābhirūtī tvāyato abhiṣṭipāsi janān
analyzed: tvam naḥ indra tvā abhirūtī tvāyataḥ abhiṣṭi pā asi janān
translated: You, O Indra, with your help, with your protection, guard the people.

original: tvamino dāśuṣo varūtetthādhīrabhi yo nakṣati tvā
analyzed: tvaminaḥ dāśuṣaḥ varūtā itthā adhīḥ abhi yaḥ nakṣati tvā
translated: You, O bountiful one, are the protector of the worshipper here, whom you favour.

original: sa no yuvendro johūtraḥ sakhā śivo narāmastu pātā
analyzed: sa naḥ yuvā indraḥ johūtraḥ sakhā śivaḥ narām astu pātā
translated: May that young Indra, the invocator, the friend, be a kind protector to men.

original: yaḥ śaṃsantaṃ yaḥ śaśamānamūtī pacantaṃ ca stuvantaṃca praṇeṣat
analyzed: yaḥ śaṃsantam yaḥ śaśamānam ūtī pacantam ca stuvantam ca praṇeṣat
translated: He who would lead away him who praises, him who strives, him who is ready, him who cooks and sings praises,

original: tamu stuṣa indraṃ taṃ gṛṇīṣe yasmin purā vāvṛdhuḥ śāśaduśca
analyzed: tam u stuṣe indram tam gṛṇīṣe yasmin purā vāvṛdhuḥ śāśaduḥ ca
translated: To him I praise Indra, to him I sing, in whom they have grown strong and rejoiced in former times.

original: sa vasvaḥ kāmaṃ pīparadiyāno brahmaṇyato nūtanasyāyoḥ
analyzed: sa vasvaḥ kāmam pīparadiyānaḥ brahmaṇyataḥ nūtanasya āyoḥ
translated: May he, when entreated, grant the wish of wealth to the worshipper, to the new and the old.

original: so aṅgirasāmucathā jujuṣvān brahmā tūtodindro gātumiṣṇan
analyzed: saḥ aṅgirasām ucathā jujuṣvān brahmā tūtot indraḥ gātum iṣṇan
translated: He, the Brahman, the Angirases' messenger, is entreated, Indra, eager to go his way.

original: muṣṇannuṣasaḥ sūryeṇa stavānaśnasya cicchiśnathat pūrvyāṇi
analyzed: muṣṇan uṣasaḥ sūryeṇa stavān aśnasya cit śiśnathat pūrvyāṇi
translated: Shining with the sun on the dawns, he has shattered the ancient works of the eater.

original: sa ha śruta indro nāma deva ūrdhvo bhuvan manuṣe dasmatamaḥ
analyzed: sa ha śrutaḥ indraḥ nāma devaḥ ūrdhvaḥ bhuvat manuṣe dasmatamaḥ
translated: He, indeed, is heard of as Indra, the god who has risen up as the most wonderful one for men.

original: ava priyamarśasānasya sāhvāñchiro bharad dāsasya svadhāvān
analyzed: ava priyamarśasānasya sāhvān śiraḥ bharat dāsasya svadhāvān
translated: The self-existent one brought down the head of Priyarsa's enemy, the Dāsa, to be slaughtered.

original: sa vṛtrahendraḥ kṛṣṇayonīḥ purandaro dāsīrairayad vi
analyzed: sa vṛtrahā indraḥ kṛṣṇa yonīḥ purandaraḥ dāsīḥ airayat vi
translated: That Indra, the slayer of Vṛtra, brought the black-born Dāsas, the slaves, to subjection,

original: ajanayan manave kṣāmapaśca satrā śaṃsaṃ yajamānasya tūtot
analyzed: ajanayat manave kṣāmapaḥ ca satrā śaṃsam yajamānasya tūtot
translated: and generated the Kṣatriyas for Manu. He always supports the sacrificer's praise.

original: tasmai tavasyamanu dāyi satrendrāya devebhirarṇasātau
analyzed: tasmai tavasyam anu dāyi satrā indrāya devebhiḥ arṇa sātau
translated: To him, the powerful one, give the sacrificial fee, to Indra, for the sake of the flowing waters,

original: prati yadasya vajraṃ bāhvordhurhatvī dasyūn pura āyasīrni tārīt
analyzed: prati yat asya vajram bāhvā ūrdhuḥ hatvī dasyūn puraḥ āyasīḥ ni tārīt
translated: when his thunderbolt is firmly fixed in his arms, the slayer, having killed the Dasyus, opened the iron doors.

original: nūnaṃ sā / / /
analyzed: nūnam sā
translated: That indeed is...

original: viśvajite dhanajite svarjite satrājite nṛjita urvarājite
analyzed: viśva jite dhana jite svar jite satrā jite nṛ jite urvarā jite
translated: To the conqueror of all, the conqueror of wealth, the conqueror of heaven, the conqueror of the sacrifice, the conqueror of men, the conqueror of the wide earth,

original: aśvajite gojite abjite bharendrāya somaṃ yajatāya haryatam🔽abhibhuve 'bhibhaṅgāya vanvate 'ṣāḷhāya sahamānāya vedhase
analyzed: aśva jite go jite ap jite bhara indrāya somam yajatāya haryatam  abhibhuve bhibhaṅgāya vanvate ṣāḷhāya sahamānāya vedhase
translated: to the conqueror of horses, the conqueror of cows, the conqueror of waters, to Indra, the worshipped one, offer the Soma, the delightful one.🔽To the overcomer, the conqueror, the one who gains, the mighty one, the wise one,

original: tuvigraye vahnaye duṣṭarītave satrāsāhe nama indrāya vocata
analyzed: tuvigraye vahnaye duṣṭarītave satrāsāhe namaḥ indrāya vocata
translated: to the one with great power, the burning one, the one with evil ways, the one who strikes terror, to Indra offer homage.

original: satrāsāho janabhakṣo janaṃsahaścyavano yudhmo anu joṣamukṣitaḥ
analyzed: satrā sāhaḥ jana bhakṣaḥ janaṃsahaḥ cyavanaḥ yudhmaḥ anu joṣam ukṣitaḥ
translated: The one who strikes terror, the one who devours the people, the one who conquers the people, the one who is to be overthrown, the warrior, sprinkled according to his desire,

original: vṛtaṃcayaḥ sahurirvikṣvārita indrasya vocaṃ pra kṛtāni vīryā🔽anānudo vṛṣabho dodhato vadho gambhīra ṛṣvo asamaṣṭakāvyaḥ
analyzed: vṛtaṃcayaḥ sahuriḥ vikṣvāritaḥ indrasya vocam pra kṛtāni vīryā  anānudaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ dodhataḥ vadhaḥ gambhīraḥ ṛṣvaḥ a samaṣṭa kāvyaḥ
translated: I will proclaim the deeds of Indra, the conqueror, the mighty, praised among the people,🔽The unvanquished bull, the slayer of the rushing foe, deep, lofty, of unequalled power,

original: radhracodaḥ śnathano vīḷitas pṛthurindraḥ suyajña uṣasaḥ svarjanat
analyzed: radhra codaḥ śnathanaḥ vīḍitaḥ pṛthuḥ indraḥ su yajñaḥ uṣasaḥ svar janat
translated: The swift-moving, the splitting, the wide-extending Indra, the well-worshipped, the giver of light to the dawns,

original: yajṇena gātumapturo vividrire dhiyo hinvānā uśijo manīṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: yajṇena gātumapturaḥ vividrire dhiyaḥ hinvānāḥ uśijaḥ manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: By sacrifice the swift-moving ones have extended their path, the wise, the active, the inspired thoughts,

original: abhisvarā niṣadā gā avasyava indre hinvānā draviṇānyāśata
analyzed: abhisvarā niṣadā gāḥ avasyavaḥ indre hinvānāḥ draviṇāni āśata
translated: The singers, the sitters, the cows, the desires, have urged Indra on to bestow wealth.

original: indra śreṣṭhāni draviṇāni dhehi cittiṃ dakṣasya subhagatvaṃ asme
analyzed: indra śreṣṭhāni draviṇāni dhehi cittim dakṣasya subhaga tvam asme
translated: O Indra, bestow the best riches upon us, the mind of Daksha, and good fortune among us,

original: poṣaṃ rayīṇāmariṣṭiṃ tanūnāṃ svādmānaṃ vācaḥ sudinatvamahnām
analyzed: poṣam rayīṇām ariṣṭim tanūnām svādmānam vācaḥ sudina tvam ahnām
translated: The increase of wealth, the safety of our bodies, the sweetness of speech, and the fair days of the year.

original: trikadrukeṣu mahiṣo yavāśiraṃ tuviśuṣmastṛpat somamapibad viṣṇunā sutaṃ yathāvaśat
analyzed: trikadrukeṣu mahiṣaḥ yava āśiram tuvi śuṣmaḥ tṛpat somam apibat viṣṇunā sutam
translated: On the Trikadrukas the mighty one, the eater of barley, of great strength, was satisfied and drank the Soma, the pressed (juice), as he desired, with Vishnu.

original: sa īṃ mamāda mahi karma kartave mahāmuruṃ sainaṃ saścad devo devaṃ satyamindraṃsatya induḥ
analyzed: saḥ īm mamāda mahi karma kartave mahām urum saḥ enam saścat devaḥ devam satyam indram satyaḥ induḥ
translated: He drank it to perform great deeds. The god, the true one, shall win him, the god, the true Indra.

original: adha tviṣīmānabhyojasā kriviṃ yudhābhavadā rodasī apṛṇadasya majmanā pra vāvṛdhe
analyzed: adha tviṣīmān abhyojasā krivim yudhā abhavadāḥ rodasī apṛṇadasya majmanā pra vāvṛdhe
translated: Then the shining one, with might, slew Kṛvi in battle. He filled the two worlds with his glory. He grew great by his power.

original: adhattānyaṃ jaṭhare premaricyata sainaṃ / / /
analyzed: adhatta anyam jaṭhare sā enam
translated: He placed another in his belly, he was filled with love, he...

original: sākaṃ jātaḥ kratunā sākamojasā vavakṣitha sākaṃ vṛddho vīryaiḥ sāsahirmṛdho vicarṣaṇiḥ
analyzed: sākam jātaḥ kratunā sākam ojasā vavakṣitha sākam vṛddhaḥ vīryaiḥ sāsahiḥ mṛdhaḥ vicarṣaṇiḥ
translated: Born together with the sacrifice, together with strength you have grown. Together with the powers you have grown, the invincible one, the swift one,

original: dātā rādhaḥ stuvate kāmyaṃ vasu sainaṃ / / /
analyzed: dātā rādhaḥ stuvate kāmyam vasu sa enam
translated: The giver of wealth, of desirable riches, to the one who praises. He...

original: tava tyan naryaṃ nṛto 'pa indra prathamaṃ pūrvyaṃ divi pravācyaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: tava tyad naryam nṛto pa indra prathamam pūrvyam divi pravācyam kṛtam
translated: That manly, dancing deed of yours, O Indra, the first, the ancient, to be proclaimed in heaven,

original: yad devasya śavasā prāriṇā asuṃ riṇannapaḥ🔽bhuvad viśvamabhyādevamojasā vidādūrjaṃ śatakraturvidādiṣam🔽gaṇānāṃ tvā gaṇapatiṃ havāmahe kaviṃ kavīnāmupamaśravastamam
analyzed: yat devasya śavasā prāriṇāḥ asum riṇan apaḥ  bhuvat viśvam abhyādevam ojasā vidāt ūrjam śatakratuḥ vidādiṣam  gaṇānām tvā gaṇa patim havāmahe kavim kavīnām upamaśravastamam
translated: When by the power of the god you drove away the demon and released the waters,🔽You became all-pervading through your power. Shatakratu has found strength and has found food.🔽We call you, the lord of the hosts, the leader of the hosts, the wise one among the wise, most renowned.

original: jyeṣṭharājaṃ brahmaṇāṃ brahmaṇas pata ā naḥ ṣṛṇvannūtibhiḥ sīda sādanam
analyzed: jyeṣṭharājam brahmaṇām brahmaṇas pate ā naḥ sṛṇvan ūtibhiḥ sīda sādanam
translated: The eldest king of the Brahmans, the lord of the Brahmans, sit in your seat, listening to our help.

original: devāścit te asurya pracetaso bṛhaspate yajñiyaṃ bhāgamānaśuḥ
analyzed: devāḥ cit te asurya pracetasaḥ bṛhaspate yajñiyam bhāgam ānaśuḥ
translated: Even the gods, your divine, wise ones, O Brihaspati, have obtained a share in the sacrifice.

original: usrā iva sūryo jyotiṣā maho viśveṣāmijjanitā brahmaṇāmasi
analyzed: usrāḥ iva sūryaḥ jyotiṣā mahaḥ viśveṣām id janitā brahmaṇām asi
translated: Like the two dawns, the sun with its great light, you are the generator of all the Brahmans.

original: ā vibādhyā parirāpastamāṃsi ca jyotiṣmantaṃ rathaṃ ṛtasya tiṣṭhasi
analyzed: ā vibādhya pariḥ apaḥ tamāṃsi ca jyotiṣmantam ratham ṛtasya tiṣṭhasi
translated: Having driven away the enemies, the slanderers, and the darkness, you sit in the chariot of truth, full of light.

original: bṛhaspate bhīmamamitradambhanaṃ rakṣohaṇaṃgotrabhidaṃ svarvidam
analyzed: bṛhaspate bhīmam amitra dambhanam rakṣaḥ haṇam gotra bhidam svar vidam
translated: O Brihaspati, terrible, subduing enemies, slaying demons, cleaving the clans, finding heaven,

original: sunītibhirnayasi trāyase janaṃ yastubhyaṃ dāśān na tamaṃho aśnavat
analyzed: su nītibhiḥ nayasi trāyase janam yaḥ tubhyam dāśāt na tam aṃhaḥ aśnavat
translated: With good counsels thou leadest and savest the people; no misfortune befalls him who gives to thee.

original: brahmadviṣastapano manyumīrasi bṛhaspate mahi tat te mahitvanam
analyzed: brahma dviṣaḥ tapanaḥ manyum īrasi bṛhaspate mahi tat te mahitvanam
translated: Thou sendest forth wrath, O Brihaspati, burning against the Brahmana-haters; great is that greatness of thine.

original: na tamaṃho na duritaṃ kutaścana nārātayastitirurna dvayāvinaḥ
analyzed: na tam aṃhaḥ na duritam kutaścana na arātayaḥ titiruḥ na dvayāvinaḥ
translated: No misfortune, no evil from any side, no reproaches, no double-dealing,

original: viśvā idasmād dhvaraso vi bādhase yaṃ sugopā rakṣasi brahmaṇas pate
analyzed: viśvāḥ idasmāt dhvarasaḥ vi bādhase yam su gopāḥ rakṣasi brahmaṇas pate
translated: From all these thou keepest him afar, O lord of prayer, whom thou, well-guarding, protectest.

original: tvaṃ no gopāḥ pathikṛd vicakṣaṇastava vratāya matibhirjarāmahe
analyzed: tvam naḥ gopāḥ pathikṛt vicakṣaṇaḥ tava vratāya matibhiḥ jarāmahe
translated: Thou art our guardian, O all-seeing one, making paths; for thy rule we honour with our thoughts.

original: bṛhaspate yo no abhi hvaro dadhe svā taṃ marmartu duchunā harasvatī
analyzed: bṛhaspate yaḥ naḥ abhi hvaraḥ dadhe svā tam marmartu duchunā harasvatī
translated: O Brihaspati, him who against us hath raised a weapon, quickly slay with thy sharp arrows.

original: uta vā yo no marcayādanāgaso 'rātīvā martaḥ sānuko vṛkaḥ
analyzed: uta vā yaḥ naḥ marcayāt anāgasaḥ rātīvā martaḥ sānukaḥ vṛkaḥ
translated: Or him who, innocent, would attack us, the man with his following, the wolf with evil intentions.

original: bṛhaspate apa taṃ vartayā pathaḥ sugaṃ no asyai devavītaye kṛdhi
analyzed: bṛhaspate apa tam vartaya pathaḥ su gam naḥ asyai deva vītaye kṛdhi
translated: O Brihaspati, turn away from us that path; make easy for us this way to the feast of the gods.

original: trātāraṃ tvā tanūnāṃ havāmahe 'vaspartaradhivaktāramasmayum
analyzed: trātāram tvā tanūnām havāmahe vaspartar adhivaktāram asmayum
translated: We invoke thee as the protector of our bodies, the remover of evil, the overcomer of enemies.

original: bṛhaspate devanido ni barhaya mā durevā uttaraṃ sumnamun naśan
analyzed: bṛhaspate deva nidaḥ ni barhaya mā durevāḥ uttaram sumnam ud naśan
translated: O Brihaspati, crush the haters of the gods, drive away the evil thought that would lead us astray.

original: tvayā vayaṃ suvṛdhā brahmaṇas pate spārhā vasu manuṣyā dadīmahi
analyzed: tvayā vayam suvṛdhā brahmaṇas pate spārhā vasu manuṣyāḥ dadīmahi
translated: Through thee, O Brihaspati, the lord of prayer, may we obtain the wealth which men desire.

original: yā no dūre taḷito yā arātayo 'bhi santi jambhayā tā anapnasaḥ
analyzed: yāḥ naḥ dūre taḷitaḥ yāḥ arātayaḥ bhi santi jambhaya tāḥ anapnasaḥ
translated: Those who are far away, those who are near, those who hate us, crush them, O thou of boundless might.

original: tvayā vayamuttamaṃ dhīmahe vayo bṛhaspate papriṇā sasninā yujā
analyzed: tvayā vayam uttamam vayaḥ bṛhaspate papriṇā sasninā yujā
translated: Through thee, O Brihaspati, we seek the highest life, to be enjoyed, O lord of prayer, with the swift one as thy mate.

original: mā no duḥśaṃso abhidipsurīśata pra suśaṃsā matibhistāriṣīmahi
analyzed: mā naḥ duḥśaṃsaḥ abhidipsuḥ īśata pra su śaṃsāḥ matibhiḥ tāriṣīmahi
translated: Let not the evil-speaking, the envious one, prevail over us. With good thoughts may we be delivered from him.

original: anānudo vṛṣabho jagmirāhavaṃ niṣṭaptā śatruṃ pṛtanāsusāsahiḥ
analyzed: anānudaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ jagmiḥ āhavam niṣṭaptā śatrum pṛtanā susāsahiḥ
translated: The irresistible bull hath gone to the fight, the scorcher of the foe, the conqueror in battles.

original: asi satya ṛṇayā brahmaṇas pata ugrasya cid damitā vīḷuharṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: asi satyaḥ ṛṇayāḥ brahmaṇas pate ugrasya cit damitā vīḍu harṣiṇaḥ
translated: Thou art true, O lord of prayer, by the bond, the subduer even of the fierce one, the shaker of the reed.

original: adevena manasā yo riśaṇyati śāsāmugro manyamāno jighāṃsati
analyzed: adevena manasā yaḥ riśaṇyati śāsām ugraḥ manyamānaḥ jighāṃsati
translated: He who with a godless mind hateth us, the fierce one who, thinking himself a ruler, seeketh to slay (us),

original: bṛhaspate ma praṇak tasya no vadho ni karma manyuṃ durevasya śardhataḥ
analyzed: bṛhaspate ma praṇak tasya naḥ vadhaḥ ni karma manyum durevasya śardhataḥ
translated: O Brihaspati, let not his weapon prevail against us. Crush the deed and the wrath of the evil-minded one who is eager to attack.

original: bhareṣu havyo namasopasadyo gantā vājeṣu sanitā dhanaṃ dhanam
analyzed: bhareṣu havyaḥ namasā upasadyaḥ gantā vājeṣu sanitā dhanam dhanam
translated: In battles he is to be invoked, to be worshipped with reverence, the winner of wealth, of every kind of wealth.

original: viśvā idaryo abhidipsvo mṛdho bṛhaspatirvi vavarhā rathāṃ iva
analyzed: viśvāḥ idaryaḥ abhidipsvaḥ mṛdhaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ vi vavarha rathān iva
translated: All the enemies, all the haters, all the enemies who seek to injure, Brihaspati hath scattered like chariots.

original: tejiṣthayā tapani rakṣasastapa ye tvā nide dadhire dṛṣṭavīryam
analyzed: tejiṣthayā tapani rakṣasaḥ tapa ye tvā nide dadhire dṛṣṭa vīryam
translated: With thy most burning heat torment the Rākshasas, who have laid their snares for thee, O thou of wondrous power.

original: āvistat kṛṣva yadasat ta ukthyaṃ bṛhaspate vi parirāpo ardaya
analyzed: āvis tat kṛṣva yat asat te ukthyam bṛhaspate vi pariḥ apaḥ ardaya
translated: Do this, O thou of lofty thought, that which is worthy of thy praise: O Br̥ihaspati, destroy the revilers.

original: bṛhaspate ati yadaryo arhād dyumad vibhāti kratumajjaneṣu
analyzed: bṛhaspate ati yat aryaḥ arhāt dyumat vibhāti kratumat janeṣu
translated: O Br̥ihaspati, when the foe hath passed beyond the reach of the strong one, he shineth in his might among the people.

original: yad dīdayacchavasa ṛtaprajāta tadasmasu draviṇaṃ dhehicitram🔽mā na stenebhyo ye abhi druhas pade nirāmiṇo ripavo 'nneṣu jāgṛdhuḥ
analyzed: yat dīdayat śavasaḥ ṛta prajāta tat asmasu draviṇam dhehi citram  mā naḥ stenebhyaḥ ye abhi druhaḥ pade nirāmiṇaḥ ripavaḥ nneṣu jāgṛdhuḥ
translated: When thou, O thou of true birth, hast shone with thy strength, bestow upon us wealth in wondrous abundance.🔽Guard us from those who steal, from those who stand in paths of guile, from those who watch for food, from those who hate us.

original: ā devānāmohate vi vrayo hṛdi bṛhaspate naparaḥ sāmno viduḥ
analyzed: ā devānām ohate vi vrayaḥ hṛdi bṛhaspate na paraḥ sāmnaḥ viduḥ
translated: The thoughts of the Gods are hidden in the heart: none knoweth the hymn of praise beyond, O Br̥ihaspati.

original: viśvebhyo hi tvā bhuvanebhyas pari tvaṣṭājanat sāmnaḥ sāmnaḥ kaviḥ
analyzed: viśvebhyaḥ hi tvā bhuvanebhyaḥ pari tvaṣṭā ajanat sāmnaḥ sāmnaḥ kaviḥ
translated: For Tvaṣṭar, the sage, hath fashioned thee for all the worlds, for each hymn of praise.

original: sa ṛṇacid ṛṇayā brahmaṇas patirdruho hantā maha ṛtasya dhartari🔽tava śriye vyajihīta parvato gavāṃ gotramudasṛjo yadaṅgiraḥ🔽indreṇa yujā tamasā parīvṛtaṃ bṛhaspate nirapāmaubjo arṇavam
analyzed: saḥ ṛṇa cit ṛṇayāḥ brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ druhaḥ hantā mahaḥ ṛtasya dhartari  tava śriye vyajihīta parvataḥ gavām gotram udasṛjaḥ yat aṅgiraḥ  indreṇa yujā tamasā parīvṛtam bṛhaspate nirapām aubjaḥ arṇavam
translated: He, Br̥ihaspati, the Lord of prayer, who knoweth well the debt, the slayer of the treacherous, the great upholder of the law.🔽For thy glory the mountain hath been cleft in twain: thou hast let loose the herd of cattle, O Aṅgiras.🔽With Indra as thy friend, O Br̥ihaspati, thou hast cleft the cloud that compassed heaven about.

original: brahmaṇas pate tvamasya yantā sūktasya bodhi tanayaṃ ca jinva
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ pate tvam asya yantā sūktasya bodhi tanayam ca jinva
translated: O Lord of prayer, thou art the guide of this our hymn: inspire the son who is to win the prize.

original: viśvaṃ tad bhadraṃ yadavanti devā bṛhad vadema / / /
analyzed: viśvam tat bhadram yat avanti devāḥ bṛhat vadema
translated: All that is good which the gods favour, we will speak loudly.

original: semāmaviḍḍhi prabhṛtiṃ ya īśiṣe 'yā vidhema navayā mahā girā
analyzed: sa imām aviḍḍhi prabhṛtim yaḥ īśiṣe yā vidhema navayā mahā girā
translated: Grant us this prosperity, O Lord, we will serve you with new great praise.

original: yathā no mīḍhvān stavate sakhā tava bṛhaspatesīṣadhaḥ sota no matim
analyzed: yathā naḥ mīḍhvān stavate sakhā tava bṛhaspate isīṣadhaḥ sa uta naḥ matim
translated: O Brihaspati, that your friend may praise us well, O Lord, sharpen our thought.

original: yo nantvānyanaman nyojasotādardarmanyunā śambarāṇi vi
analyzed: yaḥ nantvāni anamat nyojasā uta adardar manyunā śambarāṇi vi
translated: Having bent other bows, O Lord of strength, you have shattered many weapons.

original: prācyāvayadacyutā brahmaṇas patirā cāviśad vasumantaṃ vi parvatam
analyzed: prācyāvayat acyutā brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ ā ca aviśat vasumantam vi parvatam
translated: Brahmanaspati has shaken off the immovable, and has entered the mountain rich in wealth.

original: tad devānāṃ devatamāya kartvamaśrathnan dṛḷhāvradanta vīḷitā🔽ud gā ājadabhinad brahmaṇā valamagūhat tamo vyacakṣayat svaḥ
analyzed: tat devānām devatamāya kartvam aśrathnan dṛḍhā avradanta vīḍitā  ud gāḥ ājat abhinat brahmaṇā valam agūhat tamaḥ vyacakṣayat svar
translated: They have stretched out the most divine of the gods' (acts), the firm-jawed have shattered the strong.🔽The cow has risen, with holy power she has burst the cloud, she has looked upon the light.

original: aśmāsyamavataṃ brahmaṇas patirmadhudhāramabhi yamojasātṛṇat
analyzed: aśma āsyam avatam brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ madhu dhāram abhi yam ojasā atṛṇat
translated: Brahmanaspati has drawn out the stone, the honey-bearing, with his own strength.

original: tameva viśve papire svardṛśo bahu sākaṃ sisicurutsamudriṇam
analyzed: tam eva viśve papire svar dṛśaḥ bahu sākam sisicuḥ utsamudriṇam
translated: All of them have drunk it, the seers of heaven. They have sprinkled much together, the ocean-born.

original: sanā tā kā cid bhuvanā bhavītvā mādbhiḥ śaradbhirduro varanta vaḥ
analyzed: sanā tā kā cit bhuvanā bhavītvā mādbhiḥ śaradbhiḥ duraḥ varanta vaḥ
translated: Let that be the most ancient of all existing things. With the waters, with the autumns, they have chosen you as their husband.

original: ayatantā carato anyadanyadid ya cakāra vayunā brahmaṇas patiḥ
analyzed: a yatantā carataḥ anyat anyat id ya cakāra vayunā brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ
translated: They have moved, each to a different place, those that have been made. What Brahmanaspati has done, the ordinances.

original: abhinakṣanto abhi ye tamānaśurnidhiṃ paṇīnāṃ paramaṃguhā hitam
analyzed: abhinakṣantaḥ abhi ye tam ānaśuḥ nidhim paṇīnām paramaṃguhā hitam
translated: They who have seized and carried off the treasure of the Pāṇis, hidden away in the highest place,

original: te vidvāṃsaḥ praticakṣyānṛtā punaryata uāyan tadudīyurāviśam
analyzed: te vidvāṃsaḥ praticakṣya anṛtā punar yatas uāyan tat udīyuḥ āviśam
translated: Those wise ones, having seen the falsehood, have returned again, and have entered the abode of the truthful.

original: ṛtāvānaḥ praticakṣyānṛtā punarāta ā tasthuḥ kavayo mahas pathaḥ🔽te bāhubhyāṃ dhamitamagnimaśmani nakiḥ ṣo astyaraṇo jahurhi tam
analyzed: ṛtāvānaḥ praticakṣya anṛtā punarāte ā tasthuḥ kavayaḥ mahaḥ pathaḥ  te bāhubhyām dhamitam agnim aśmani nakir ṣaḥ asti araṇaḥ jahuḥ hi tam
translated: The truthful ones, having seen the falsehood, have returned again, and have stood on the path of the great ones.🔽With their arms they have shaken Agni from the stone; none has found the way to him, for they have left him.

original: ṛtajyena kṣipreṇa brahmaṇas patiryatra vaṣṭi pra tadaśnoti dhanvanā
analyzed: ṛta jyena kṣipreṇa brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ yatra vaṣṭi pra tat aśnoti dhanvanā
translated: With the string of truth, with the swift one, with the Brahman's lord, wherever he aims, he reaches with the bow.

original: tasya sādhvīriṣavo yābhirasyati nṛcakṣaso dṛśaye karṇayonayaḥ
analyzed: tasya sādhvīḥ iṣavaḥ yābhiḥ asyati nṛ cakṣasaḥ dṛśaye karṇa yonayaḥ
translated: His arrows are good, with which he shoots, the eye-seers, born from the ear, for the sake of sight.

original: sa saṃnayaḥ sa vinayaḥ purohitaḥ sa suṣṭutaḥ sa yudhibrahmaṇas patiḥ
analyzed: sa saṃnayaḥ sa vinayaḥ purohitaḥ sa suṣṭutaḥ sa yudhibrahmaṇaḥ patiḥ
translated: That is the union, that is the separation, the priest, well-praised, the Brahman's lord in battle.

original: cākṣmo yad vājaṃ bharate matī dhanādit sūryastapati tapyaturvṛthā
analyzed: cākṣmaḥ yat vājam bharate matī dhanādidh sūryaḥ tapati tapyatuḥ vṛthā
translated: When the powerful one brings the prize, the wealth of the thoughts, the sun shines, the one to be heated, in vain.

original: vibhu prabhu prathamaṃ mehanāvato bṛhaspateḥ suvidatrāṇi rādhyā
analyzed: vibhu prabhu prathamam mehanāvataḥ bṛhaspateḥ suvidatrāṇi rādhyā
translated: The all-pervading lord, the first, of the one who rains, of Bṛhaspati, may his most friendly favors come to us.

original: imā sātāni venyasya vājino yena janā ubhaye bhuñjate viśaḥ
analyzed: imā sātāni venyasya vājinaḥ yena janau ubhaye bhuñjate viśaḥ
translated: These are the gifts of the active one, the strong one, by whom the people on both sides enjoy the clans.

original: yo 'vare vṛjane viśvathā vibhurmahāmu raṇvaḥ śavasā vavakṣitha
analyzed: yaḥ vare vṛjane viśvathā vibhuḥ mahā mu raṇvaḥ śavasā vavakṣitha
translated: He who in the lower world is all-pervading, vast, and kind with great power has extended himself

original: sa devo devān prati paprathe pṛthu viśvedu tāparibhūrbrahmaṇas patiḥ
analyzed: sa devaḥ devān prati paprathe pṛthu viśvedu tāparibhūḥ brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ
translated: That god has spread out to the gods in various ways. He is the lord of all, the lord of prayer.

original: viśvaṃ satyaṃ maghavānā yuvoridāpaścana pra minanti vrataṃ vām
analyzed: viśvam satyam maghavānā yuvoridā apaścana pra minanti vratam vām
translated: All this is true, O bountiful ones. Even the waters do not transgress your vow.

original: achendrābrahmaṇaspatī havirno 'nnaṃ yujeva vājinā jigātam
analyzed: achā indrābrahmaṇaspatī haviḥ naḥ nnam yujā iva vājinā jigātam
translated: Come, O Indra and Brahmaṇaspati, to our offering, to our food, as if yoking strong horses.

original: utāśiṣṭhā anu śṛṇvanti vahnayaḥ sabheyo vipro bharate matī dhanā
analyzed: uta āśiṣṭhāḥ anu śṛṇvanti vahnayaḥ sabheyaḥ vipraḥ bharate matī dhanā
translated: And the most powerful ones listen to the messengers. The assembly-man, the inspired one, brings the treasures of thought.

original: vīḷudveṣā anu vaśa ṛṇamādadiḥ sa ha vājī samithe brahmaṇas patiḥ
analyzed: vīḷu dveṣāḥ anu vaśe ṛṇamādadiḥ sa ha vājī samithe brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ
translated: The one who hates Vṛtra, who follows the vow, who takes the debt, he is the powerful one in the assembly, the lord of prayer.

original: brahmaṇas paterabhavad yathāvaśaṃ satyo manyurmahi karmākariṣyataḥ
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ pateḥ abhavat yathāvaśam satyaḥ manyuḥ mahi karma a kariṣyataḥ
translated: He became as he wished from the lord of prayer. The true anger of the one who will do great deeds.

original: yo gā udājat sa dive vi cābhajan mahīva rītiḥ śavasāsarat pṛthak
analyzed: yaḥ gāḥ udājat sa dive vi ca abhajat mahī iva rītiḥ śavasā asarat pṛthak
translated: He who milked out the cows, he divided them for the sky. Like a great mountain, he moved them apart with his power.

original: brahmaṇas pate suyamasya viśvahā rāyaḥ syāma rathyo vayasvataḥ
analyzed: brahmaṇas pate su yamasya viśvahā rāyaḥ syāma rathyaḥ vayasvataḥ
translated: O lord of prayer, may we always have wealth that is easy to rule, that is a chariot, and that is self-existent.

original: vīreṣu vīrānupa pṛṃdhi nastvaṃ yadīśāno brahmaṇā veṣi me havam
analyzed: vīreṣu vīrān upa pṛṃdhi naḥ tvam yadi īśānaḥ brahmaṇā veṣi me havam
translated: You who are the lord, protect our heroes among the heroes, if you, by prayer, know my call.

original: brahmaṇas pate tvamasya / / /
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ pate tvam asya
translated: O lord of prayer, you are the lord of this...

original: indhāno agniṃ vanavad vanuṣyataḥ kṛtabrahmā śūśuvad rātahavya it
analyzed: indhānaḥ agnim vanavat vanuṣyataḥ kṛta brahmā śūśuvat rāta havyaḥ id
translated: Kindling the fire, he will win the man who strives, with prayer accomplished, offering gifts, he will shine.

original: jātena jātamati sa pra sarsṛte yaṃyaṃ yujaṃkṛṇute brahmaṇas patiḥ
analyzed: jātena jāta mati sa pra sarsṛte yam yam yujaṃkṛṇute brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ
translated: With the born he goes to the born, whomsoever Brahmanaspati makes his companion.

original: vīrebhirvīrān vanavad vanuṣyato gobhī rayiṃ paprathad bodhati tmanā
analyzed: vīrebhiḥ vīrān vanavat vanuṣyataḥ gobhiḥ rayim paprathat bodhati tmanā
translated: With heroes he will win the men who strive, with cows he will extend his wealth, he awakens by himself.

original: tokaṃ ca tasya tanayaṃ ca vardhate yaṃyaṃ / / /
analyzed: tokam ca tasya tanayam ca vardhate yaṃyaṃ
translated: His offspring and his son grow great, whomsoever...

original: sindhurna kṣodaḥ śimīvān ṛghāyato vṛṣeva vadhrīnrabhi vaṣṭyojasā
analyzed: sindhuḥ na kṣodaḥ śimīvān ṛghāyataḥ vṛṣā iva vadhrīn rabhi vaṣṭi ojasā
translated: Like a river, impetuous, irresistible, like a bull he attacks the cows with might.

original: agneriva prasitirnāha vartave yaṃyaṃ / /
analyzed: agneḥ iva prasitiḥ na aha vartave yaṃyaṃ
translated: Like the rush of Agni, he cannot be turned back, whomsoever...

original: tasmā arṣanti divyā asaścataḥ sa satvabhiḥ prathamo goṣugachati
analyzed: tasmai arṣanti divyāḥ asaścataḥ sa satvabhiḥ prathamaḥ goṣugachati
translated: For him the heavenly, imperishable ones flow, he, the first, goes to the cows with the strong ones.

original: anibhṛṣṭataviṣirhantyojasā yaṃyaṃ / / /
analyzed: a nibhṛṣṭa taviṣiḥ hanti ojasā yaṃ yaṃ
translated: With his uncrushed power he conquers with might, whomsoever...

original: tasmā id viśve dhunayanta sindhavo 'chidrā śarma dadhire purūṇi
analyzed: tasmai id viśve dhunayanta sindhavaḥ chidrā śarma dadhire purūṇi
translated: For him all the streams are shaken, they have provided many uninjured protections.

original: devānāṃ sumne subhagaḥ sa edhate yaṃyaṃ / / /🔽ṛjuricchaṃso vanavad vanuṣyato devayannidadevayantamabhyasat
analyzed: devānām sumne subhagaḥ saḥ edhate yaṃ yaṃ  ṛjuḥ id śaṃsaḥ vanavat vanuṣyataḥ devayan idadevayantam abhyasat
translated: In the bliss of the gods he prospers, the fortunate one, whomsoever...🔽The straight-flying one will win the man who strives, the worshipper has approached the worshipper.

original: suprāvīrid vanavat pṛtsu duṣṭaraṃ yajvedayajyorvi bhajāti bhojanam
analyzed: su prāvīridh vanavat pṛtsu duṣṭaram yajvā id ayajyā urvi bhajāti bhojanam
translated: He will win the well-heroic one, hard to overcome in battles, the sacrificer divides the food of the non-sacrificer.

original: yajasva vīra pra vihi manāyato bhadraṃ manaḥ kṛṇuṣva vṛtratūrye
analyzed: yajasva vīra pra vihi manāyataḥ bhadram manaḥ kṛṇuṣva vṛtratūrye
translated: O hero, perform sacrifice, drive away the niggardly one, make thy mind good for the battle with Vritra.

original: haviṣ kṛṇuṣva subhago yathāsasi brahmaṇas paterava ā vṛṇīmahe
analyzed: haviṣ kṛṇuṣva subhagaḥ yathā asasi brahmaṇaḥ pateḥ avaḥ ā vṛṇīmahe
translated: Make offering, be prosperous that thou mayest prosper. We choose the favour of the Lord of prayer.

original: sa ijjanena sa viśā sa janmanā sa putrairvājaṃ bharatedhanā nṛbhiḥ
analyzed: saḥ id janena sa viśā sa janmanā sa putraiḥ vājam bharata idhanā nṛbhiḥ
translated: He, with the people, with the clan, with the family, with the sons, gains strength and wealth through men.

original: devānāṃ yaḥ pitaramāvivāsati śraddhāmanā haviṣā brahmaṇas patim
analyzed: devānām yaḥ pitaram āvivāsati śraddhā manāḥ haviṣā brahmaṇaḥ patim
translated: He who honours the father of the gods, the Lord of prayer, with faith and offering.

original: yo asmai havyairghṛtavadbhiravidhat pra taṃ prācā nayati brahmaṇas patiḥ
analyzed: yaḥ asmai havyaiḥ ghṛtavadbhiḥ avidhat pra tam prācā nayati brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ
translated: He whom he has anointed with oblations of ghee, the Lord of prayer leads him to the eastern heaven.

original: uruṣyatīmaṃhaso rakṣatī riṣo 'ṃhościdasmā urucakriradbhutaḥ
analyzed: uruṣyati īm aṃhasaḥ rakṣatī riṣaḥ ṃhoḥ cit asmai uru cakriḥ adbhutaḥ
translated: He protects from distress, he guards from injury, he is a wondrous protector from every woe.

original: imā gira ādityebhyo ghṛtasnūḥ sanād rājabhyo juhvā juhomi
analyzed: imāḥ giraḥ ādityebhyaḥ ghṛtasnūḥ sanāt rājabhyaḥ juhvā juhomi
translated: To the Adityas, the ancient kings, I offer with the ladle these praises, anointed with ghee.

original: śṛṇotu mitro aryamā bhago nastuvijāto varuṇo dakṣo aṃśaḥ
analyzed: śṛṇotu mitraḥ aryamā bhagaḥ naḥ tuvi jātaḥ varuṇaḥ dakṣaḥ aṃśaḥ
translated: May Mitra, Aryaman, Bhaga, the mighty Varuṇa, Daksha, and Amsha listen to us.

original: imaṃ stomaṃ sakratavo me adya mitro aryamā varuṇo juṣanta🔽ādityāsaḥ śucayo dhārapūtā avṛjinā anavadyā ariṣṭāḥ
analyzed: imam stomam sa kratavaḥ me adya mitraḥ aryamā varuṇaḥ juṣanta  ādityāsaḥ śucayaḥ dhāra pūtāḥ a vṛjināḥ anavadyāḥ ariṣṭāḥ
translated: May Mitra, Aryaman, and Varuṇa, of one mind, accept this hymn of mine this day.🔽The Ādityas, pure, cleansed by the filter, unwearied, unblamable, uninjured,

original: ta ādityāsa uravo gabhīrā adabdhāso dipsanto bhūryakṣāḥ
analyzed: te ādityāsaḥ uravaḥ gabhīrāḥ adabdhāsaḥ dipsantaḥ bhūri akṣāḥ
translated: Those Ādityas, wide, deep, unassailable, watchful, with great eyes,

original: antaḥ paśyanti vṛjinota sādhu sarvaṃ rājabhyaḥ paramā cidanti
analyzed: antar paśyanti vṛjinā uta sādhu sarvam rājabhyaḥ paramā cit anti
translated: The wicked and the good both see within them all things are known to the kings even the most secret

original: dhārayanta ādityāso jagat sthā devā viśvasya bhuvanasya gopāḥ
analyzed: dhārayantaḥ ādityāsaḥ jagat stha devāḥ viśvasya bhuvanasya gopāḥ
translated: The Adityas support the world, the gods are the guardians of all the universe

original: dīrghādhiyo rakṣamāṇā asuryaṃ ṛtāvānaścayamānā ṛṇāni
analyzed: dīrgha ādhiyaḥ rakṣamāṇāḥ asuryam ṛtāvānaḥ cayamānāḥ ṛṇāni
translated: Guarding the Asura nature with farreaching thoughts, the righteous ones arranging the debts

original: vidyāmādityā avaso vo asya yadaryaman bhaya ā cin mayobhu🔽yuṣmākaṃ mitrāvaruṇā praṇītau pari śvabhreva duritānivṛjyām
analyzed: vidyāma ādityāḥ avasaḥ vaḥ asya yat aryaman bhaye ā cit mayobhu  yuṣmākam mitrāvaruṇā praṇītau pari śvabhrā iva duritānivṛjyām
translated: O Adityas, we know your favour, O Aryaman, that it is in fear of you that we are afraid🔽Through your guidance, O Mitra and Varuna, may I pass beyond all troubles as over a bridge

original: sugo hi vo aryaman mitra panthā anṛkṣaro varuṇa sādhurasti
analyzed: su gaḥ hi vaḥ aryaman mitra panthāḥ anṛkṣaraḥ varuṇa sādhuḥ asti
translated: For your path, O Aryaman, O Mitra, is easy to travel, O Varuna, it is free from obstacles

original: tenādityā adhi vocatā no yachatā no duṣparihantu śarma
analyzed: tena ādityāḥ adhi vocata naḥ yacchata naḥ duṣparihantu śarma
translated: By that, O Adityas, do you favour us, grant us protection that is hard to overcome

original: pipartu no aditī rājaputrāti dveṣāṃsyaryamā sugebhiḥ
analyzed: pipartu naḥ aditiḥ rāja putrā ati dveṣāṃsi aryamā su gebhiḥ
translated: May Aditi, the royal daughter, protect us, may Aryaman with easy paths carry us beyond enmities

original: bṛhan mitrasya varuṇasya śarmopa syāma puruvīrā ariṣṭāḥ
analyzed: bṛhat mitrasya varuṇasya śarma upa syāma puru vīrāḥ ariṣṭāḥ
translated: May we, with many heroes, be unharmed under the great protection of Mitra and Varuna

original: tisro bhūmīrdhārayan trīnruta dyūn trīṇi vratā vidathe antareṣām
analyzed: tisraḥ bhūmīḥ dhārayan trīn ruta dyūn trīṇi vratā vidathe antareṣām
translated: Supporting the three worlds and the three heavens, the three vows are in their midst in the sacred place

original: ṛtenādityā mahi vo mahitvaṃ tadaryaman varuṇa mitra cāru
analyzed: ṛtena ādityāḥ mahi vaḥ mahi tvam tat aryaman varuṇa mitra cāru
translated: By law, O Adityas, your greatness is great, that is fair, O Aryaman, O Varuna, O Mitra

original: trī rocanā divyā dhārayanta hiraṇyayāḥ śucayo dhārapūtāḥ
analyzed: trī rocanā divyā dhārayanta hiraṇyayāḥ śucayaḥ dhāra pūtāḥ
translated: They support the three golden, pure, purifying, heavenly lights

original: asvapnajo animiṣā adabdhā uruśaṃsā ṛjave martyāya
analyzed: a svapnajaḥ animiṣāḥ adabdhāḥ uru śaṃsāḥ ṛjave martyāya
translated: Not born of sleep, not winking, not deceived, of wide renown, to the upright man

original: tvaṃ viśveṣāṃ varuṇāsi rājā ye ca devā asura ye ca martāḥ
analyzed: tvam viśveṣām varuṇa asi rājā ye ca devāḥ asura ye ca martāḥ
translated: You, O Varuṇa, are the king of all the gods, of the Asuras and of men.

original: śataṃ no rāsva śarado vicakṣe 'cyāmāyūṃṣi sudhitāni pūrvā
analyzed: śatam naḥ rāsva śaradaḥ vicakṣe cyāma āyūṃṣi sudhitāni pūrvā
translated: Grant us a hundred winters to behold, O thou of good counsel, our days prolonged.

original: na dakṣiṇā vi cikite na savyā na prācīnamādityā notapaścā
analyzed: na dakṣiṇā vi cikite na savyā na prācīnam ādityāḥ na uta paścā
translated: Neither the south nor the north do I consider, nor the east, O Ādityas, nor the west.

original: pākyā cid vasavo dhīryā cid yuṣmānīto abhayaṃjyotiraśyām
analyzed: pākyā cit vasavaḥ dhīryā cit yuṣmānītaḥ abhayaṃjyotiḥ aśyām
translated: Even in the midst of danger, O Vasus, in the midst of thought, I would be in your protection, in safe keeping, in light.

original: yo rājabhya ṛtanibhyo dadāśa yaṃ vardhayanti puṣṭayaścanityāḥ
analyzed: yaḥ rājabhyaḥ ṛta nibhyaḥ dadāśa yam vardhayanti puṣṭayaḥ ca nityāḥ
translated: He who has given to the kings who are like truth, whom the ever-present prosperings strengthen,

original: sa revān yāti prathamo rathena vasudāvā vidatheṣu praśastaḥ
analyzed: sa revān yāti prathamaḥ rathena vasu dāvā vidatheṣu praśastaḥ
translated: He, the rich one, goes first on his chariot, bestowing wealth, praised in the assemblies.

original: śucirapaḥ sūyavasā adabdha upa kṣeti vṛddhavayāḥ suvīraḥ
analyzed: śuciḥ apaḥ sū yavasāḥ adabdhaḥ upa kṣeti vṛddha vayāḥ su vīraḥ
translated: The pure one, with good pasture, not deceived, dwells near the waters, of great age, with good heroes.

original: nakiṣ ṭaṃ ghnantyantito na dūrād ya ādityānāṃ bhavati praṇītau
analyzed: nakir tam ghnanti antitas na dūrāt yaḥ ādityānām bhavati praṇītau
translated: None slays him from near or from afar, who is in the guidance of the Ādityas.

original: adite mitra varuṇota mṛḷa yad vo vayaṃ cakṛmā kaccidāgaḥ
analyzed: adite mitra varuṇa uta mṛḍa yat vaḥ vayam cakṛma kaccit āgaḥ
translated: O Aditi, O Mitra, O Varuṇa, forgive us whatever sin we have committed against you.

original: urvaśyāmabhayaṃ jyotirindra mā no dīrghā abhi naśan tamisrāḥ
analyzed: urvaśyām abhayam jyotiḥ indra mā naḥ dīrghāḥ abhi naśan tamisrāḥ
translated: May we have wide shelter, light, and safety, O Indra; may the long nights not deceive us.

original: ubhe asmai pīpayataḥ samīcī divo vṛṣṭiṃ subhago nāma puṣyan
analyzed: ubhe asmai pīpayataḥ samīcī divaḥ vṛṣṭim subhagaḥ nāma puṣyan
translated: Both of them pour for him, in unison, the rain from heaven, the prosperous one, nourishing the name.

original: ubhā kṣayāvājayan yāti pṛtsūbhāvardhau bhavataḥ sādhū asmai
analyzed: ubhā kṣayau ājayan yāti pṛtsu ubhau ardhau bhavataḥ sādhū asmai
translated: He conquers both abodes and goes to the contests; both halves of the day are good for him.

original: yā vo māyā abhidruhe yajatrāḥ pāśā ādityā ripave vicṛttāḥ
analyzed: yāḥ vaḥ māyāḥ abhidruhe yajatrāḥ pāśāḥ ādityāḥ ripave vicṛttāḥ
translated: Your magic powers, O you to be worshipped, which are stretched out as snares against the enemy, O Ādityas,

original: aśvīva tānati yeṣaṃ rathenāriṣṭā urāvā śarman syāma
analyzed: aśvī iva tānati yeṣam rathena ariṣṭāḥ urāvā śarman syāma
translated: May we, like horses, pass beyond them with a chariot, and be unharmed and safe.

original: māhaṃ maghono varuṇa priyasya bhūridāvna ā vidaṃ śūnamāpeḥ
analyzed: mā aham maghonaḥ varuṇa priyasya bhūri dāvnaḥ ā vidam śūnam āpeḥ
translated: I, O Varuṇa, do not wish to find the misfortune of a generous and much-giving friend.

original: mā rāyo rājan suyamādava sthāṃ bṛhad vadema / / /
analyzed: mā rāyaḥ rājan su yamāt ava sthām bṛhat vadema
translated: Do not deprive me, O king, of wealth that is easily obtained. May we speak lofty words.

original: idaṃ kaverādityasya svarājo viśvāni sāntyabhyastu mahnā
analyzed: idam kaveḥ ādityasya svarājaḥ viśvāni sānti abhyastu mahnā
translated: This, O wise one, of the self-ruling Āditya, may all the people approach with their greatness.

original: ati yo mandro yajathāya devaḥ sukīrtiṃ bhikṣe varuṇasya bhūreḥ
analyzed: ati yaḥ mandraḥ yajathāya devaḥ su kīrtim bhikṣe varuṇasya bhūreḥ
translated: He who is the delightful god to be worshipped, I beg for the wealth of good fame from Varuṇa.

original: tava vrate subhagāsaḥ syāma svādhyo varuṇa tuṣṭuvāṃsaḥ
analyzed: tava vrate subhagāsaḥ syāma su ādhyaḥ varuṇa tuṣṭuvāṃsaḥ
translated: O Varuṇa, may we be prosperous under your rule, O you who are to be praised, O you who are to be praised.

original: upāyana uṣasāṃ gomatīnāmagnayo na jaramāṇā anu dyūn
analyzed: upāyane uṣasām gomatīnām agnayaḥ na jaramāṇāḥ anu dyūn
translated: The dawns, which are to be approached, which are rich in cattle, the fires, which are to be worshipped, follow the days.

original: tava syāma puruvīrasya śarmannuruśaṃsasya varuṇa praṇetaḥ
analyzed: tava syāma puru vīrasya śarman uru śaṃsasya varuṇa praṇetar
translated: May we be under the protection of you, O Varuṇa, who have many heroes, O you who are to be praised, O you who are to be praised.

original: yūyaṃ naḥ putrā aditeradabdhā abhi kṣamadhvaṃ yujyāya devāḥ
analyzed: yūyam naḥ putrāḥ aditeḥ adabdhāḥ abhi kṣamadhvam yujyāya devāḥ
translated: You, O sons, who are not to be deceived, of Aditi, be gracious to us, O gods, for the sake of union.

original: pra sīmādityo asṛjad vidhartān ṛtaṃ sindhavo varuṇasya yanti
analyzed: pra sīmā ādityaḥ asṛjat vidhartān ṛtam sindhavaḥ varuṇasya yanti
translated: The sun hath set the boundaries, the Ordainer: the rivers flow according to the statute of Varuna.

original: na śrāmyanti na vi mucantyete vayo na paptū raghuyāparijman
analyzed: na śrāmyanti na vi mucanti ete vayaḥ na paptuḥ raghuyā parijman
translated: They neither toil nor rest: they never fail us, like a bird to its nest, O thou of rapid course.

original: vi macchrathāya raśanāmivāga ṛdhyāma te varuṇa khāṃ ṛtasya
analyzed: vi mat śrathāya raśanām iva āgaḥ ṛdhyāma te varuṇa khām ṛtasya
translated: For my prosperity, O thou of great dominion, I draw thee to me as a rein: may we prosper, O Varuna, in thy law.

original: mā tantuśchedi vayato dhiyaṃ me mā mātrā śāryapasaḥ pura ṛtoḥ
analyzed: mā tantuḥ chedi vayataḥ dhiyam me mā mātrā śāri apasaḥ puras ṛtoḥ
translated: Cut not the thread of my life, nor my thought, nor me, O thou of wondrous help, before the time.

original: apo su myakṣa varuṇa bhiyasaṃ mat samrāḷ ṛtāvo 'nu mā gṛbhāya
analyzed: apa u su myakṣa varuṇa bhiyasam mat samrāj ṛtāvaḥ nu mā gṛbhāya
translated: O Varuna, make thou the water clear for me: be gracious unto me, O thou of true decrees.

original: dāmeva vatsād vi mumugdhyaṃho nahi tvadāre nimiṣaścaneśe
analyzed: dāmā iva vatsāt vi mumugdhi aṃhaḥ nahi tvad āre nimiṣaḥ cana īśe
translated: As one unties a knot from out the calf, so loose thou my sin, for none is lord over thee, not even Nimiṣa.

original: mā no vadhairvaruṇa ye ta iṣṭāvenaḥ kṛṇvantamasura bhrīṇanti
analyzed: mā naḥ vadhaiḥ varuṇa ye te iṣṭau enaḥ kṛṇvantam asura bhrīṇanti
translated: O Varuna, let not those bonds of thine which are set for the sinner reach me, O Asura.

original: mā jyotiṣaḥ pravasathāni ganma vi ṣū mṛdhaḥ śiśratho jīvase naḥ
analyzed: mā jyotiṣaḥ pravasathāni ganma vi su mṛdhaḥ śiśrathaḥ jīvase naḥ
translated: Let us not go to the abodes of light: cast off the darts that we may live.

original: namaḥ purā te varuṇota nūnamutāparaṃ tuvijāta bravāma
analyzed: namaḥ purā te varuṇa uta nūnam uta aparam tuvi jāta bravāma
translated: To thee, O thou of mighty birth, we speak, adoration in the past, now, and again hereafter.

original: tve hi kaṃ parvate na śritānyapracyutāni dūḷabha vratāni
analyzed: tve hi kam parvate na śritāni a pracyutāni dūḷabha vratāni
translated: For in thee, O thou of wondrous power, are all the laws that are established as on a mountain, that never fail.

original: para ṛṇā sāvīradha matkṛtāni māhaṃ rājannanyakṛtena bhojam
analyzed: paras mad kṛtāni mā aham rājan anya kṛtena bhojam
translated: Deliver me from the debts I have incurred: let me not, O King, be made to pay another's debts.

original: avyuṣṭā in nu bhūyasīruṣāsa ā no jīvān varuṇa tāsu śādhi
analyzed: a vyuṣṭāḥ id nu bhūyasīḥ uṣāsaḥ ā naḥ jīvān varuṇa tāsu śādhi
translated: O Varuṇa, rule over our living creatures in the dawns that are still more unrisen.

original: yo me rājan yujyo vā sakhā vā svapne bhayaṃ bhīrave mahyamāha
analyzed: yaḥ me rājan yujyaḥ vā sakhā vā svapne bhayam bhīrave mahyam āha
translated: O king, whether it be a friend or a companion who tells me in a dream of fear for me,

original: steno vā yo dipsati no vṛko vā tvaṃ tasmād varuṇapāhyasmān🔽māhaṃ maghono / / /
analyzed: stenaḥ vā yaḥ dipsati naḥ vṛkaḥ vā tvam tasmāt varuṇa pāhi asmān  mā aham maghonaḥ
translated: Or a thief or a wolf who threatens us, from that, O Varuṇa, protect us.🔽May I not be deprived of the wealth of the generous ones.

original: dhṛtavratā ādityā iṣirā āre mat karta rahasūrivāgaḥ
analyzed: dhṛta vratāḥ ādityāḥ iṣirāḥ āre mat karta rahasūri vāgaḥ
translated: The powerful Ādityas, whose vows are firm, keep far from me the evil-speaking one, as from a sorcerer.

original: śṛṇvato vo varuṇa mitra devā bhadrasya vidvānavase huvevaḥ
analyzed: śṛṇvataḥ vaḥ varuṇa mitra devāḥ bhadrasya vidvān avase huvevaḥ
translated: O Varuṇa, O Mitra, O gods, I call you, knowing good, to help, while you listen.

original: yūyaṃ devāḥ pramatiryūyamojo yūyaṃ dveṣāṃsi sanutaryuyota
analyzed: yūyam devāḥ pramatiḥ yūyam ojaḥ yūyam dveṣāṃsi sanutar yuyota
translated: You gods are the overseer, you are the strength, you ward off the hostilities that reach you.

original: abhikṣattāro abhi ca kṣamadhvamadyā ca no mṛḷayatāparaṃ ca
analyzed: abhi kṣattāraḥ abhi ca kṣamadhvam adya ca naḥ mṛḍayata aparam ca
translated: Be you the repellers of those who revile us, and be gracious to us now and hereafter.

original: kimū nu vaḥ kṛṇavāmāpareṇa kiṃ sanena vasava āpyena
analyzed: kim u nu vaḥ kṛṇavāma apareṇa kim sanena vasavaḥ āpyena
translated: What else shall we do for you with our service, O Vasus, with what obtainable by us?

original: yūyaṃ no mitrāvaruṇādite ca svastimindrāmaruto dadhāta
analyzed: yūyam naḥ mitrāvaruṇā adite ca svastim indrāmarutaḥ dadhāta
translated: You, O Mitra-Varuṇa, O Ādityas, and you, O Indra-Maruts, grant us well-being.

original: haye devā yūyamidāpaya stha te mṛḷata nādhamānāya mahyam
analyzed: haye devāḥ yūyam idāpayaḥ stha te mṛḍata nādhamānāya mahyam
translated: O gods, you must help us in this matter. Be gracious to me, the one who is afflicted.

original: mā vo ratho madhyamavāḷ ṛte bhūn mā yuṣmāvastvāpiṣu śramiṣma
analyzed: mā vaḥ rathaḥ madhyama vāh ṛte bhūt mā yuṣmāvastvāpiṣu śramiṣma
translated: Let not your chariot be left behind without us, let us not be exhausted in your service.

original: pra va eko mimaya bhūryāgo yan mā piteva kitavaṃ śaśāsa
analyzed: pra vaḥ ekaḥ mimaya bhūri āgaḥ yat mā pitā iva kitavam śaśāsa
translated: One alone is to be honoured with abundant offerings, since you have instructed me like a father, O deceitful one.

original: āre pāṣā āre aghāni devā mā mādhi putre vimiva grabhīṣṭa
analyzed: āre āre āre aghāni devāḥ mā mā adhi putre grabhīṣṭa
translated: Keep away the stone, keep away the evil deeds, O gods, do not seize me like a son in a noose.

original: arvāñco adyā bhavatā yajatrā ā vo hārdi bhayamāno vyayeyam
analyzed: arvāñcaḥ adya bhavata yajatrāḥ ā vaḥ hārdi bhayamānaḥ vyayeyam
translated: Turn towards us today, O you who are to be worshipped, I, fearing you, would go to my own heart.

original: trādhvaṃ no devā nijuro vṛkasya trādhvaṃ kartādavapado yajatrāḥ
analyzed: trādhvam naḥ devāḥ nijuraḥ vṛkasya trādhvam kartā adavapadaḥ yajatrāḥ
translated: Protect us, O gods, from the wolf's snare, protect us from the pit, O you who are to be worshipped.

original: māhaṃ maghono / / /
analyzed: mā aham maghonaḥ
translated: Do not let me be deprived of the generous ones...

original: ṛtaṃ devāya kṛṇvate savitra indrāyāhighne na ramanta āpaḥ
analyzed: ṛtam devāya kṛṇvate savitre indrāya ahi ghne na ramante āpaḥ
translated: The waters rejoice in the truth made for the god Savitar, for Indra the slayer of Ahi.

original: aharaharyātyakturapāṃ kiyātyā prathamaḥ sarga āsām
analyzed: ahar ahar yāti aktuḥ apām kiyātyā prathamaḥ sargaḥ āsām
translated: Day after day the first creation of these waters passes away.

original: yo vṛtrāya sinamatrābhariṣyat pra taṃ janitrī viduṣa uvāca
analyzed: yaḥ vṛtrāya sinam atra ābhariṣyat pra tam janitrī viduṣe uvāca
translated: He who was about to bring down the rain for Vritra, the mother, knowing, spoke to him.

original: patho radantīranu joṣamasmai divedive dhunayo yantyartham
analyzed: pathaḥ radantīḥ anu joṣam asmai dive dive dhunayaḥ yanti artham
translated: Grinding the paths for him according to his will, the waves come for their purpose day by day.

original: ūrdhvo hyasthādadhyantarikṣe 'dhā vṛtrāya pra vadhaṃjabhāra
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ hi asthāt adhi antarikṣe dhāḥ vṛtrāya pra vadhaṃjabhāra
translated: For he stood up high in the atmosphere, then he took up the weapon to strike Vritra.

original: mihaṃ vasāna upa hīmadudrot tigmāyudho ajayacchatrumindraḥ
analyzed: miham vasānaḥ upa hi imadudrot tigma āyudhaḥ ajayat śatrum indraḥ
translated: Wearing the thunderbolt, he rushed forth, Indra, sharp-weaponed, conquered the enemy.

original: bṛhaspate tapuṣāśneva vidhya vṛkadvaraso asurasya vīrān
analyzed: bṛhaspate tapuṣā aśnā iva vidhya vṛkadvaraso asurasya vīrān
translated: O Brihaspati, pierce the Asura's heroes with the heat, as with a dart, O you who have the wolves' roar.

original: yathā jaghantha dhṛṣatā purā cidevā jahi śatrumasmākamindra🔽ava kṣipa divo aśmānamuccā yena śatruṃ mandasāno nijūrvāḥ
analyzed: yathā jaghantha dhṛṣatā purā cit evā jahi śatrum asmākam indra  ava kṣipa divaḥ aśmānam uccā yena śatrum mandasānaḥ nijūrvāḥ
translated: As of old thou didst boldly slay the foe, so slay thou the foe for us, O Indra🔽Cast down from heaven the stone that is on high, wherewith, rejoicing, thou didst hurl away the foe

original: tokasya sātau tanayasya bhūrerasmānardhaṃ kṛṇutādindra gonām
analyzed: tokasya sātau tanayasya bhūreḥ asmān ardham kṛṇutāt indra gonām
translated: In the winning of offspring, in the gaining of a son, in the winning of much wealth, make us sharers of the cows, O Indra

original: pra hi kratuṃ vṛhatho yaṃ vanutho radhrasya stho yajamānasya codau
analyzed: pra hi kratum vṛhathaḥ yam vanuthaḥ radhrasya sthaḥ yajamānasya codau
translated: For ye increase the power which ye favour, ye are the supporters of the poor sacrificer

original: indrāsomā yuvamasmānaviṣṭamasmin bhayasthe kṛṇutamu lokam
analyzed: indrāsomāḥ yuvam asmān aviṣṭam asmin bhayasthe kṛṇutamu lokam
translated: O Indra and Soma, ye two, make ye for us a place of safety in this fearful place

original: na mā taman na śraman nota tandran na vocāma mā sunoteti somam
analyzed: na mā taman na śraman na uta tandrat na vocāma mā sunota iti somam
translated: Let not sloth, nor weariness, nor languor come upon me, nor let us say, 'Do not press out the Soma'

original: yo me pṛṇād yo dadad yo nibodhād yo mā sunvantamupa gobhirāyat
analyzed: yaḥ me pṛṇāt yaḥ dadat yaḥ nibodhāt yaḥ mā sunvantam upa gobhiḥ āyat
translated: He who hath filled me, who hath given to me, who hath understood me, who hath come to me the presser with gifts of cattle

original: sarasvati tvamasmānaviḍḍhi marutvatī dhṛṣatī jeṣi śatrūn
analyzed: sarasvati tvam asmān aviḍḍhi marutvatī dhṛṣatī jeṣi śatrūn
translated: O Sarasvatî, do thou endow us with offspring; thou, accompanied by the Maruts, shalt conquer the foes

original: tyaṃ cicchardhantaṃ taviṣīyamāṇamindro hanti vṛṣabhaṃ śaṇḍikānām
analyzed: tyam cit śardhantam taviṣīyamāṇam indraḥ hanti vṛṣabham śaṇḍikānām
translated: Indra slays the rushing, overweening bull of the Śaṇḍikas

original: yo naḥ sanutya uta vā jighatnurabhikhyāya taṃ tigitena vidhya
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ sanutyaḥ uta vā jighatnuḥ abhikhyāya tam tigitena vidhya
translated: Him who is fain to injure us, or who hungers, pierce with thy sharpest shaft, O thou who art to be invoked

original: bṛhaspata āyudhairjeṣi śatrūn druhe rīṣantaṃ pari dhehi rājan
analyzed: bṛhaspate āyudhaiḥ jeṣi śatrūn druhe rīṣantam pari dhehi rājan
translated: O Brhaspati, with thy weapons thou shalt conquer the foes; O king, place him who hateth us on every side in thy power

original: asmākebhiḥ satvabhiḥ śūra śūrairvīrya kṛdhi yāni te kartvāni
analyzed: asmākebhiḥ satvabhiḥ śūra śūraiḥ vīrya kṛdhi yāni te kartvāni
translated: O hero, with our heroes, O mighty one, perform those deeds which are to be done by thee

original: jyogabhūvannanudhūpitāso hatvī teśāmā bharāno vasūni
analyzed: jyok abhūvan anudhūpitāsaḥ hatvī teśāmā bharānaḥ vasūni
translated: They have become prosperous, well-perfumed, the slayers of the enemies, bringing treasures

original: taṃ vaḥ śardhaṃ mārutaṃ sumnayurgiropa bruve namasā daivyaṃ janam
analyzed: tam vaḥ śardham mārutam sumnayuḥ girā upa bruve namasā daivyam janam
translated: To that Marut host I address my songs with reverence, to the divine people, to win their favour

original: yathā rayiṃ sarvavīraṃ naśāmahā apatyasācaṃ śrutyaṃ divedive
analyzed: yathā rayim sarva vīram naśāmahai apatyasācam śrutyam dive dive
translated: That we may obtain wealth with all heroes, accompanied by offspring, to be heard, day by day

original: asmākaṃ mitrāvaruṇāvataṃ rathamādityai rudrairvasubhiḥ sacābhuvā
analyzed: asmākam mitrāvaruṇā avatam ratham ādityaiḥ rudraiḥ vasubhiḥ sacābhuvā
translated: May the chariot of Mitra and Varuna, of the Adityas, Rudras, and Vasus, come to us, all of one mind

analyzed: pra yat vayaḥ na paptan vasmanaḥ pari śravasyavaḥ hṛṣīvantaḥ vanarṣadaḥ
translated: When, like birds, they have flown around the dwelling, the famous ones, rejoicing, pouring rain

original: adha smā na udavatā sajoṣaso rathaṃ devāso abhi vikṣu vājayum
analyzed: adha smā naḥ udavata sajoṣasaḥ ratham devāsaḥ abhi vikṣu vājayum
translated: Then, O ye gods, of one accord, on the high road, the chariot which wins booty among the people

original: yadāśavaḥ padyābhistitrato rajaḥ pṛthivyāḥ sānau jaṅghananta pāṇibhiḥ
analyzed: yadā aśavaḥ padyābhiḥ titrataḥ rajaḥ pṛthivyāḥ sānau jaṅghananta pāṇibhiḥ
translated: When the swift ones, with their feet, cross the path of the earth, the ridge of the earth, with their hands

translated: And may Indra, he who is worshipped by all men, of good resolve, with the Marut host of heaven🔽May he stand by us with help free from danger, the chariot, for the great gain, for the winning of booty

analyzed: uta sya devaḥ bhuvanasya sakṣaṇiḥ tvaṣṭā gnābhiḥ sajoṣāḥ jūjuvat ratham
translated: And may the god who rules the world, Tvastr, in accord with the wives, equip the chariot

analyzed: iḷā bhagaḥ bṛhaddivā uta rodasī pūṣā purandhiḥ aśvinau adhā patī
translated: Ila, Bhage, Brihaddiva, the two worlds, Pusan, Purandhi, the two Asvins, the two Adhipatis

analyzed: uta tye devī subhage mithūdṛśā uṣāsānaktā
translated: And you two divine, prosperous, similar-looking ones, dawn and night, have been the most active among the moving beings

analyzed: stuṣe yat vām pṛthivi navyasā sthātuḥ ca vayaḥ trivayāḥ upastire

translated: Bring with thy mind the willing one to hear, the milch-cow who yields plenteous food and never fails.

analyzed: padyābhiḥ āśum vacasā ca vājinam tvām hinomi puruhūta viśvahā
translated: With the swift-moving words I urge thee on, the strong one, the swift one, O thou who art invoked by many, at all times.
