analyzed: rākām aham su havām suṣṭutī huve śṛṇotu naḥ subhagā bodhatu tmanā
translated: I call on Raka, easy to invoke, with fair praises; may the prosperous one hear us and be gracious to us.

original: sīvyatvapaḥ sūcyāchidyamānayā dadātu vīraṃ satadāyamukthyam
analyzed: sīvyatu apaḥ sūcyā a chidyamānayā dadātu vīram satadāyam ukthyam
translated: May she sew up the waters with her needle, and give us a hero worthy of the hymn.

original: yāste rāke sumatayaḥ supeśaso yābhirdadāsi dāśuṣe vasūni
analyzed: yāḥ te rāke sumatayaḥ supeśasaḥ yābhiḥ dadāsi dāśuṣe vasūni
translated: O Raka, thy most excellent and most beautiful favours, by which thou givest wealth to the worshipper,

original: tābhirno adya sumanā upāgahi sahasrapoṣaṃ subhage rarāṇā
analyzed: tābhiḥ naḥ adya sumanāḥ upāgahi sahasra poṣam subhage rarāṇā
translated: With those come to us today with a good mind, O blessed one, bestowing a thousandfold increase.

original: sinīvāli pṛthuṣṭuke yā devānāmasi svasā
analyzed: sinīvāli pṛthuṣṭuke yā devānām asi svasā
translated: O Sinivāli, of wide fame, thou who art the sister of the gods,

original: juṣasva havyamāhutaṃ prajāṃ devi didiḍḍhi naḥ
analyzed: juṣasva havyam āhutam prajām devi didiḍḍhi naḥ
translated: Accept the offered oblation, and grant us offspring, O goddess.

original: yā subāhuḥ svaṅguriḥ suṣūmā bahusūvarī
analyzed: yā su bāhuḥ su aṅguriḥ suṣūmā bahusūvarī
translated: She who has fair arms, who is well-born, who is very gracious, who has many sons,

original: tasyai viśpatnyai haviḥ sinīvālyai juhotana
analyzed: tasyai viś patnyai haviḥ sinīvālyai juhotana
translated: To her, the mistress of the house, to Sinivāli, offer the oblation.

original: yā guṅgūryā sinīvālī yā rākā yā sarasvatī
analyzed: yā guṅgūryā sinīvālī yā rākā yā sarasvatī
translated: She who is Guṅgūri, Sinivāli, Raka, Sarasvatī,

original: indrāṇīmahva ūtaye varuṇānīṃ svastaye
analyzed: indrāṇīm ahve ūtaye varuṇānīm svastaye
translated: We invoke Indrāṇī for help, Varuṇānī for well-being.

original: ā te pitarmarutāṃ sumnametu mā naḥ sūryasya sandṛṣo yuyothāḥ
analyzed: ā te pitar marutām sumnam etu mā naḥ sūryasya sandṛṣaḥ yuyothāḥ
translated: O father, may the favour of the Maruts come to thee; do not forsake us in the sight of the sun.

original: abhi no vīro arvati kṣameta pra jāyemahi rudra prajābhiḥ
analyzed: abhi naḥ vīraḥ arvati kṣameta pra jāyemahi rudra prajābhiḥ
translated: May the hero favour us in the race, O Rudra, may we beget offspring with offspring.

original: tvādattebhī rudra śantamebhiḥ śataṃ himā aśīya bheṣajebhiḥ
analyzed: tvādattebhiḥ rudra śantamebhiḥ śatam himā aśīya bheṣajebhiḥ
translated: With your most gentle gifts, O Rudra, may I obtain a hundred winters with your healing herbs.

original: vyasmad dveṣo vitaraṃ vyaṃho vyamīvāścātayasvā viṣūcīḥ
analyzed: vi asmat dveṣaḥ vitaram vyaṃhaḥ vyamīvāḥ cātayasva viṣūcīḥ
translated: Drive away from us hatred, drive away affliction, drive away sicknesses in every direction.

original: śreṣṭho jātasya rudra śriyāsi tavastamastavasāṃ vajrabāho
analyzed: śreṣṭhaḥ jātasya rudra śriyā asi tavastamaḥ tavasām vajra bāho
translated: O Rudra, you are the best by birth through glory, most powerful of the powerful, O you with the thunderbolt in your hand.

original: parṣi ṇaḥ pāramaṃhasaḥ svasti viśvā abhītī rapaso yuyodhi
analyzed: parṣi naḥ pāram aṃhasaḥ svasti viśvāḥ abhītīḥ rapasaḥ yuyodhi
translated: Carry us across to the further shore of misfortune. Grant us well-being. Drive away all dangers and diseases.

original: mā tvā rudra cukrudhāmā namobhirmā duṣṭutī vṛṣabha māsahūtī
analyzed: mā tvā rudra cukrudhāma namobhiḥ mā duṣṭutī vṛṣabha māsahūtī
translated: Do not be angry with us, O Rudra, with our salutations. Do not, O bull, with our evil praises and invocations.

original: un no vīrānarpaya bheṣajebhirbhiṣaktamaṃ tvā bhiṣajāṃ śṛṇomi
analyzed: ud naḥ vīrān arpaya bheṣajebhiḥ bhiṣaktamam tvā bhiṣajām śṛṇomi
translated: Raise up our heroes with your healing herbs. I hear you are the best of healers.

original: havīmabhirhavate yo havirbhirava stomebhī rudraṃ diṣīya
analyzed: havīmabhiḥ havate yaḥ havirbhiḥ ava stomebhiḥ rudram diṣīya
translated: He who invokes with offerings invokes Rudra with offerings and with praises.

original: ṛdūdaraḥ suhavo mā no asyai babhruḥ suśipro rīradhan manāyai
analyzed: ṛdūdaraḥ su havaḥ mā naḥ asyai babhruḥ su śipraḥ rīradhat manāyai
translated: Be kind, easy to invoke, for this my desire, O you with the tawny hair and beautiful eyebrows.

original: un mā mamanda vṛṣabho marutvān tvakṣīyasā vayasā nādhamānam
analyzed: ud mā mamanda vṛṣabhaḥ marutvān tvakṣīyasā vayasā nādhamānam
translated: Do not let the bull, the companion of the Maruts, neglect me with his most powerful vigour.

original: ghṛṇīva chāyāmarapā aśīyā vivāseyaṃ rudrasya sumnam
analyzed: ghṛṇī iva chāyā amara pāḥ aśīyāḥ vivāseyam rudrasya sumnam
translated: Like the shadow of one who has gone to the gods, may I enjoy this. I seek Rudra's favour.

original: kva sya te rudra mṛḷayākurhasto yo asti bheṣajo jalāṣaḥ
analyzed: kva sya te rudra mṛḍaya akuḥ hastaḥ yaḥ asti bheṣajaḥ jalāṣaḥ
translated: Where is that healing hand of yours, O Rudra, which is the remedy, the balm?

original: apabhartā rapaso daivyasyābhī nu mā vṛṣabha cakṣamīthāḥ
analyzed: apabhartā rapasaḥ daivyasya abhi nu mā vṛṣabha cakṣamīthāḥ
translated: I am the reviler of the divine curse: look upon me, O bull, with favour.

original: pra babhrave vṛṣabhāya śvitīce maho mahīṃ suṣṭutimīrayāmi
analyzed: pra babhrave vṛṣabhāya śvitīce mahaḥ mahīm suṣṭutim īrayāmi
translated: I send forth a great and lofty praise to the tawny bull, to the white-hued one.

original: namasyā kalmalīkinaṃ namobhirgṛṇīmasi tveṣaṃ rudrasya nāma
analyzed: namasya kalmalīkinam namobhiḥ gṛṇīmasi tveṣam rudrasya nāma
translated: We praise with homage the one who is stained with sin, the terrible name of Rudra.

original: sthirebhiraṅgaiḥ pururūpa ugro babhruḥ śukrebhiḥ pipiśehiraṇyaiḥ
analyzed: sthirebhiḥ aṅgaiḥ puru rūpaḥ ugraḥ babhruḥ śukrebhiḥ pipiśe hiraṇyaiḥ
translated: With firm limbs, of many forms, fierce, the tawny one shines here with bright golden ones.

original: īśānādasya bhuvanasya bhūrerna vā u yoṣad rudrādasuryam
analyzed: īśānāt asya bhuvanasya bhūreḥ na vai u yoṣat rudrāt asuryam
translated: From the lord of this wide world, from Rudra, no one may escape his wrath.

original: arhan bibharṣi sāyakāni dhanvārhan niṣkaṃ yajataṃ viśvarūpam
analyzed: arhan bibharṣi sāyakāni dhanvā arhan niṣkam yajatam viśva rūpam
translated: Worthy one, you bear the arrows in the bow, worthy one, you offer the necklace of all forms.

original: arhannidaṃ dayase viśvamabhvaṃ na vā ojīyo rudra tvadasti
analyzed: arhan idam dayase viśvam abhvam na vai ojīyaḥ rudra tvat asti
translated: Worthy one, you favor this whole world, O Rudra, there is no greater strength than yours.

original: stuhi śrutaṃ gartasadaṃ yuvānaṃ mṛgaṃ na bhīmamupahatnumugram🔽mṛlā jaritre rudra stavāno 'nyaṃ te asman ni vapantu senāḥ
analyzed: stuhi śrutam garta sadam yuvānam mṛgam na bhīmam upahatnum ugram  mṛlā jaritre rudra stavānaḥ nyam te asmat ni vapantu senāḥ
translated: Praise the renowned one who sits in the pit, the young one, the terrible beast, the fierce one who strikes down.🔽Be gracious to the singer, O Rudra, let your armies turn away from us.

original: kumāraścit pitaraṃ vandamānaṃ prati nānāma rudropayantam
analyzed: kumāraḥ cit pitaram vandamānam prati nānāma rudra upayantam
translated: Even the young one, when the father pays homage, Rudra turns away from him who approaches.

original: bhūrerdātāraṃ satpatiṃ gṛṇīṣe stutastvaṃ bheṣajā rāsyasme
analyzed: bhūreḥ dātāram sat patim gṛṇīṣe stutaḥ tvam bheṣajā rāsi asme
translated: I praise the giver of abundant wealth, the lord of the good. Praised by me, grant us healing remedies.

original: yā vo bheṣajā marutaḥ śucīni yā śantamā vṛṣaṇo yā mayobhu
analyzed: yā vaḥ bheṣajā marutaḥ śucīni yā śantamā vṛṣaṇaḥ yā mayobhu
translated: Your purifying medicines, O Maruts, your most auspicious, O mighty ones, your life-giving,

original: yāni manuravṛṇītā pitā nastā śaṃ ca yoścarudrasya vaśmi
analyzed: yāni manuḥ avṛṇīta ā pitā nastā śam ca yoḥ ca rudrasya vaśmi
translated: Those which our father Manu chose for us, for that and for your blessing I long for Rudra.

original: pari ṇo hetī rudrasya vṛjyāḥ pari tveṣasya durmatirmahīgāt
analyzed: pari naḥ hetiḥ rudrasya vṛjyāḥ pari tveṣasya durmatiḥ mahī gāt
translated: Turn away from us the dart of Rudra, turn away the great wrath of the terrible one.

original: ava sthirā maghavadbhyastanuṣva mīḍhvastokāya tanayāya mṛḷa
analyzed: ava sthirā maghavadbhyaḥ tanuṣva mīḍhvaḥ tokāya tanayāya mṛḍa
translated: Weave for us the firm one, O bountiful one, be gracious to the child and to the offspring.

original: evā babhro vṛṣabha cekitāna yathā deva na hṛṇīṣe na haṃsi
analyzed: eva babhro vṛṣabha cekitāna yathā deva na hṛṇīṣe na haṃsi
translated: Thus, O tawny bull, O discerning one, as you, O god, do not offend, do not strike,

original: havanaśrun no rudreha bodhi bṛhad v / v / s /
analyzed: havana śrut naḥ rudra iha bodhi bṛhat u v s
translated: O you who hear our invocation, be gracious to us here, O bountiful one.

original: dhārāvarā maruto dhṛṣṇvojaso mṛgā na bhīmāstaviṣībhirarcinaḥ
analyzed: dhārā varāḥ marutaḥ dhṛṣṇu ojasaḥ mṛgāḥ na bhīmāḥ taviṣībhiḥ arcinaḥ
translated: The Maruts, with flowing streams, of firm strength, terrible like deer, shining with their powers,

original: agnayo na śuśucānā ṛjīṣiṇo bhṛmiṃ dhamantoapa gā avṛṇvata
analyzed: agnayaḥ na śuśucānāḥ ṛjīṣiṇaḥ bhṛmim dhamantaḥ apa gāḥ avṛṇvata
translated: Like blazing fires, the impetuous ones, blowing the storm, have loosed the cows.

original: dyāvo na stṛbhiścitayanta khādino vyabhriyā na dyutayantavṛṣṭayaḥ
analyzed: dyāvaḥ na stṛbhiḥ citayanta khādinaḥ vyabhriyāḥ na dyutayanta vṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: Like the sky, they make the clouds, the greedy ones, the rain-clouds shine with lightning flashes.

original: rudro yad vo maruto rukmavakṣaso vṛṣājani pṛśnyāḥ śukra ūdhani
analyzed: rudraḥ yat vaḥ marutaḥ rukma vakṣasaḥ vṛṣā ajani pṛśnyāḥ śukre ūdhani
translated: When Rudra, O Maruts, with golden breasts, was born as a bull from the white udder of the dappled one,

original: ukṣante aśvānatyānivājiṣu nadasya karṇaisturayanta āśubhiḥ
analyzed: ukṣante aśvān atyāni vājiṣu nadasya karṇaiḥ turayantaḥ āśubhiḥ
translated: They milk the horses, as if they were strong stallions, they urge them on with the ears of the roaring one, with the swift ones.

original: hiraṇyaśiprā maruto davidhvataḥ pṛkṣaṃ yātha pṛṣatībhiḥ samanyavaḥ
analyzed: hiraṇya śiprāḥ marutaḥ davidhvataḥ pṛkṣam yātha pṛṣatībhiḥ samanyavaḥ
translated: O Maruts, with golden swords, with your swift-moving teams, you go to the pasture with your spotted cows, all of one mind.

original: pṛkṣe tā viśvā bhuvanā vavakṣire mitrāya vā sadamā jīradānavaḥ🔽pṛṣadaśvāso anavabhrarādhasa ṛjipyāso na vayuneṣu dhūrṣadaḥ
analyzed: pṛkṣe tā viśvā bhuvanā vavakṣire mitrāya vā sadamāḥ jīra dānavaḥ  pṛṣat aśvāsaḥ anavabhra rādhasaḥ ṛjipyāsaḥ na vayuneṣu dhūrṣadaḥ
translated: They have grown in the pasture, all these beings, for Mitra, for ever, O you whose wealth is to be desired.🔽With spotted horses, with unfailing bounty, with swift chariots, shaking the yoke-pins in the yoking.

original: indhanvabhirdhenubhī rapśadūdhabhiradhvasmabhiḥ pathibhirbhrājadṛṣṭayaḥ
analyzed: indhanvabhiḥ dhenubhiḥ rapśat ūdhabhiḥ adhvasmabhiḥ pathibhiḥ bhrājat ṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: With kindling-sticks, with cows, with milk-sprinkled (offerings), with paths that lead to the sacrifice, with eyes that shine.

original: ā haṃsāso na svasarāṇi gantana madhormadāya marutaḥ samanyavaḥ
analyzed: ā haṃsāsaḥ na svasarāṇi gantana madhoḥ madāya marutaḥ samanyavaḥ
translated: Come, O swans, to your own homes, O Maruts, all of one mind, for the gladdening of the sweet drink.

original: ā no brahmāṇi marutaḥ samanyavo narāṃ na śaṃsaḥ savanāni gantana
analyzed: ā naḥ brahmāṇi marutaḥ samanyavaḥ narām na śaṃsaḥ savanāni gantana
translated: Come, O Maruts, all of one mind, to our prayers, to the praises of men, to the libations.

original: aśvāmiva pipyata dhenumūdhani kartā dhiyaṃ jaritre vājapeśasam
analyzed: aśvām iva pipyata dhenu mūdhani kartā dhiyam jaritre vāja peśasam
translated: Make the thought swell like a horse in the udder of the cow, bringing the thought that possesses strength to the worshipper.

original: taṃ no dāta maruto vājinaṃ ratha āpānaṃ brahma citayad divedive
analyzed: tam naḥ dāta marutaḥ vājinam rathe āpānam brahma citayat dive dive
translated: Give us that, O Maruts, the strong chariot, the drinking-place, the prayer that is thought of day by day.

original: iṣaṃ stotṛbhyo vṛjaneṣu kārave saniṃ medhāmariṣṭaṃ duṣṭaraṃ sahaḥ
analyzed: iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ vṛjaneṣu kārave sanim medhām ariṣṭam duṣṭaram sahaḥ
translated: Food for the singers in the assemblies, gain, thought, uninjured, invincible might.

original: yad yuñjate maruto rukmavakṣaso 'śvān ratheṣu bhaga ā sudānavaḥ
analyzed: yat yuñjate marutaḥ rukma vakṣasaḥ śvān ratheṣu bhagaḥ ā sudānavaḥ
translated: When the bountiful Maruts, with their chests adorned with gold, yoke their horses to their chariots, Bhaga,

original: dhenurna śiśve svasareṣu pinvate janāya rātahaviṣe mahīmiṣam
analyzed: dhenuḥ na śiśve svasareṣu pinvate janāya rāta haviṣe mahīmiṣam
translated: Like a cow swelling in her stalls for her calf, she swells great food for the people who offer oblations

original: yo no maruto vṛkatāti martyo ripurdadhe vasavo rakṣatā riṣaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ marutaḥ vṛkatāti martyaḥ ripuḥ dadhe vasavaḥ rakṣatā riṣaḥ
translated: The mortal enemy who has set himself against us like a wolf, O Maruts, O Vasus, protect him from injury

original: vartayata tapuṣā cakriyābhi tamava rudrā aśaso hantanā vadhaḥ
analyzed: vartayata tapuṣā cakriyā abhi tam ava rudrāḥ aśasaḥ hantana vadhaḥ
translated: Turn him with your heat and your deeds, O Rudras, destroy him with your wrath and your weapon

original: citraṃ tad vo maruto yāma cekite pṛśnyā yadūdharapyāpayo duhuḥ
analyzed: citram tat vaḥ marutaḥ yāma cekite pṛśnyāḥ yat ūdhara pyāpayaḥ duhuḥ
translated: That wonderful thing, O Maruts, which you have done, that the milk of the dappled cow was milked for the child

original: yad vā nide navamānasya rudriyāstritaṃ jarāyajuratāmadābhyāḥ
analyzed: yat vā nide navamānasya rudriya astritam jarā yajuratā madābhyāḥ
translated: Or when the Rudras of the newly-risen sun, the three-aged one, have bound themselves with their own bonds

original: tān vo maho maruta evayāvno viṣṇoreṣasya prabhṛthe havāmahe
analyzed: tān vaḥ mahaḥ marutaḥ eva yāvnaḥ viṣṇoḥ eṣasya prabhṛthe havāmahe
translated: We invoke those of you, O Maruts, who are to be invoked, at the offering of the great Vishnu

original: hiraṇyavarṇān kakuhān yatasruco brahmaṇyantaḥ śaṃsyaṃ rādha īmahe
analyzed: hiraṇya varṇān kakuhān yata srucaḥ brahmaṇyantaḥ śaṃsyam rādhaḥ īmahe
translated: The golden-hued, the singing, the ladle-wielding, the most Brahman-like, we seek the praiseworthy gift

original: te daśagvāḥ prathamā yajñamūhire te no hinvantūṣaso vyuṣṭiṣu🔽uṣā na rāmīraruṇairaporṇute maho jyotiṣāśucatā goarṇasā🔽te kṣoṇībhiraruṇebhirnāñjibhī rudrā ṛtasya sadaneṣuvāvṛdhuḥ
analyzed: te daśagvāḥ prathamāḥ yajñam ūhire te naḥ hinvantu uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭiṣu  uṣāḥ na rāmīḥ aruṇaiḥ aporṇute mahaḥ jyotiṣā a śucatā go arṇasā  te kṣoṇībhiḥ aruṇebhiḥ nāñjibhiḥ rudrāḥ ṛtasya sadaneṣu vāvṛdhuḥ
translated: Those who are of ten tribes first directed the sacrifice, may they impel us at the break of dawn🔽Dawn shines forth with her ruddy rays, with great light, with pure milk for the cow🔽The Rudras have grown great in the seats of order with their ruddy, shining regions

original: nimeghamānā atyena pājasā suścandraṃ varṇandadhire supeśasam
analyzed: nimeghamānāḥ atyena pājasā su ścandram varṇan dadhire supeśasam
translated: Shining with their own splendour, they have taken on a very beautiful form

original: tāniyāno mahi varūthamūtaya upa ghedenā namasā gṛṇīmasi
analyzed: tāniyānaḥ mahi varūtham ūtaye upa gha idenā namasā gṛṇīmasi
translated: we call to those who come to us with great protection, we praise them with homage

original: trito na yān pañca hotṝnabhiṣṭaya āvavartadavarāñcakriyāvase
analyzed: tritaḥ na yān pañca hotṝn abhiṣṭayaḥ āvavartat avarān cakriyāvase
translated: whom tṛta, for the sake of lower service, turned back as five priests from his invocation

original: yayā radhraṃ pārayathātyaṃho yayā nido muñcatha vanditāram
analyzed: yayā radhram pārayatha ati aṃhaḥ yayā nidaḥ muñcatha vanditāram
translated: by which ye deliver the afflicted from woe, by which ye set free the worshipper from troubles

original: arvācī sā maruto yā va ūtiro ṣu vāśreva sumatirjigātu
analyzed: arvācī sā marutaḥ yā vaḥ ūtiḥ ā u su vāśrā iva sumatiḥ jigātu
translated: may that favour of yours, O Maruts, come hither, may your gracious favour come like rain

original: upemasṛkṣi vājayurvacasyāṃ cano dadhīta nādyo giro me
analyzed: upa imasṛkṣi vājayuḥ vacasyām canaḥ dadhīta na adyaḥ giraḥ me
translated: we have come forth to the Vāja-offering, to the praise-song; may the first hear my words

original: apāṃ napādāśuhemā kuvit sa supeśasas karati joṣiṣad dhi
analyzed: apām napāt āśu hemā kuvid sa supeśasaḥ karati joṣiṣat hi
translated: will he not, the swift-moving son of the waters, the very beautiful one, be pleased?

original: imaṃ svasmai hṛda ā sutaṣṭaṃ mantraṃ vocema kuvidasya vedat
analyzed: imam svasmai hṛde ā su taṣṭam mantram vocema kuvidasya vedat
translated: to him, to his own heart, I will speak this well-fashioned hymn; will he not know it?

original: apāṃ napādasuryasya mahnā viśvānyaryo bhuvanā jajāna
analyzed: apām napāt asuḥ yasya mahnā viśvāni aryaḥ bhuvanā jajāna
translated: the son of the waters, by the greatness of the sun, has produced all the worlds that are to be known

original: samanyā yantyupa yantyanyāḥ samānamūrvaṃ nadyaḥ pṛṇanti
analyzed: sam anyāḥ yanti upa yanti anyāḥ samānam ūrvam nadyaḥ pṛṇanti
translated: some of them flow together, others flow apart; the rivers fill the same basin

original: tamū śuciṃ śucayo dīdivāṃsamapāṃ napātaṃ pari tasthurāpaḥ
analyzed: tamū śucim śucayaḥ dīdivāṃsam apām napātam pari tasthuḥ āpaḥ
translated: the waters have surrounded that pure one, the son of the waters, shining with purity

original: tamasmerā yuvatayo yuvānaṃ marmṛjyamānāḥ pari yantyāpaḥ
analyzed: tam asmerāḥ yuvatayaḥ yuvānam marmṛjyamānāḥ pari yanti āpaḥ
translated: the young maidens, the waters, anoint him, the young man, as they flow around

original: sa śukrebhiḥ śikvabhī revadasme dīdāyānidhmo ghṛtanirṇigapsu
analyzed: sa śukrebhiḥ śikvabhiḥ revat asme dīdāya a nidhmaḥ ghṛta nirṇij apsu
translated: may he, with his bright rays, with his flames, shine for us, the kindled one, whose wick is ghee, in the waters

original: asmai tisro avyathyāya nārīrdevāya devīrdidhiṣantyannam
analyzed: asmai tisraḥ avyathyāya nārīḥ devāya devīḥ didhiṣanti annam
translated: For this imperishable one, the three goddesses, the divine ladies, prepare food, as if made ready

original: kṛtā ivopa hi prasarsre apsu sa pīyūṣaṃ dhayati pūrvasūnām
analyzed: kṛtāḥ iva upa hi prasarsre apsu sa pīyūṣam dhayati pūrvasūnām
translated: For he spreads out in the waters as if fashioned. He sucks the milk of the first-born

original: aśvasyātra janimāsya ca svardruho riṣaḥ sampṛcaḥ pāhisūrīn
analyzed: aśvasya atra janima asya ca svardruhaḥ riṣaḥ sampṛcaḥ pāhisūrīn
translated: Here is the horse's birth, and here his heaven. Protect the princes from the curse of the haters

original: āmāsu pūrṣu paro apramṛṣyaṃ nārātayo vi naśan nānṛtāni
analyzed: āmāsu pūrṣu paras apramṛṣyam na arātayaḥ vi naśan na anṛtāni
translated: In the raw, the distant, the unerring, the Nārāṭas destroy the falsehoods

original: sva ā dame sudughā yasya dhenuḥ svadhāṃ pīpāya subhvannamatti🔽so apāṃ napādūrjayannapsvantarvasudeyāya vidhate vi bhāti
analyzed: sve ā dame su dughā yasya dhenuḥ svadhām pīpāya subhu annam atti  saḥ apām napāt ūrjayan apsu antarvasu deyāya vidhate vi bhāti
translated: Whose milch-cow yields good milk in her own stall, who drinks the sweet food of his own accord🔽He, the foot of the waters, conquering in the waters, shines forth, set in the womb of the waters, for the distribution of treasures

original: yo apsvā sucinā daivyena ṛtāvājasra urviyā vibhāti
analyzed: yaḥ apsvā sucinā daivyena ṛtāvā ajasraḥ urviyā vibhāti
translated: He who in the waters shines with pure divine truth, ever true, far-reaching,

original: vayā idanyā bhuvanānyasya pra jāyante vīrudhaśca prajābhiḥ
analyzed: vayāḥ idanyāḥ bhuvanāni asya pra jāyante vīrudhaḥ ca prajābhiḥ
translated: In him are born these other worlds, and the plants with offspring

original: apāṃ napādā hyasthādupasthaṃ jihmānāmūrdhvo vidyutaṃ vasānaḥ
analyzed: apām napādā hi asthāt upastham jihmānām ūrdhvaḥ vidyutam vasānaḥ
translated: For he, the foot of the waters, has stood in the womb, upright, the crooked one, clothed in lightning

original: tasya jyeṣṭhaṃ mahimānaṃ vahantīrhiraṇyavarṇāḥ pari yanti yahvīḥ
analyzed: tasya jyeṣṭham mahimānam vahantīḥ hiraṇya varṇāḥ pari yanti yahvīḥ
translated: Bearing his most lofty majesty, the youthful ones, golden-hued, go round him

original: hiraṇyarūpaḥ sa hiraṇyasandṛgapāṃ napāt sedu hiraṇyavarṇaḥ
analyzed: hiraṇya rūpaḥ sa hiraṇya sandṛś apām napāt sedu hiraṇya varṇaḥ
translated: The son of the waters, golden-hued, golden-colored, golden-looking, has sat down

original: hiraṇyayāt pari yonerniṣadyā hiraṇyadā dadatyannamasmai
analyzed: hiraṇyayāt pari yoneḥ niṣadyā hiraṇya dāḥ dadati annam asmai
translated: From the golden womb, from the sitting, the golden-giver gives food to him

original: tadasyānīkamuta cāru nāmāpīcyaṃ vardhate napturapām
analyzed: tat asya anīkam uta cāru nāma āpīcyam vardhate naptuḥ apām
translated: That is his army, or his beautiful name, which increases, the grandson of the waters

original: yamindhate yuvatayaḥ samitthā hiraṇyavarṇaṃ ghṛtamannamasya🔽asmai bahūnāmavamāya sakhye yajñairvidhema namasā havirbhiḥ
analyzed: yam indhate yuvatayaḥ sam itthā hiraṇya varṇam ghṛtam annam asya  asmai bahūnām avamāya sakhye yajñaiḥ vidhema namasā havirbhiḥ
translated: Which the young maidens kindle with the same fuel, whose food is ghee of golden color🔽To him, the youngest of many, for friendship, let us serve with sacrifices, with homage and offerings

original: saṃ sānu mārjmi didhiṣāmi bilmairdadhāmyannaiḥpari vanda ṛgbhiḥ
analyzed: sam sānu mārjmi didhiṣāmi bilmaiḥ dadhāmi annaiḥ pari vande ṛgbhiḥ
translated: I polish his summit, I delight him with praises, I surround him with food, I honor him with hymns

original: sa īṃ vṛṣājanayat tāsu garbhaṃ sa īṃ siśurdhayati taṃ rihanti
analyzed: saḥ īm vṛṣā ajanayat tāsu garbham saḥ īm siśurdhayati tam rihanti
translated: He, the bull, begot that embryo in them, he, the child, they lick as he is born

original: so apāṃ napādanabhimlātavarṇo 'nyasyeveha tanvā viveṣa
analyzed: saḥ apām napāt an abhimlāta varṇaḥ nyasya iva iha tanvā viveṣa
translated: He, the foot of the waters, of unblemished color, has entered here as if in another's body

original: asmin pade parame tasthivāṃsamadhvasmabhirviśvahā dīdivāṃsām
analyzed: asmin pade parame tasthivāṃsam adhvasmabhiḥ viśvahā dīdivāṃsām
translated: Him, who stands in this highest place, with oblations, shining in every way,

original: āpo naptre ghṛtamannaṃ vahantīḥ svayamatkaiḥ pari dīyanti yahvīḥ
analyzed: āpaḥ naptre ghṛtam annam vahantīḥ svayam atkaiḥ pari dīyanti yahvīḥ
translated: The waters, carrying ghee as food, for the grandson, the young ones, go around with their own waves

original: ayāṃsamagne sukṣitiṃ janāyāyāṃsamu maghavadbhyaḥ suvṛktim
analyzed: ayāṃsam agne su kṣitim janāya ayāṃsam u maghavadbhyaḥ suvṛktim
translated: O Agni, for the people, grant a good abode to the poor, a good hymn to the wealthy

original: viśvaṃ tad / / /
analyzed: viśvam tat
translated: All that...

original: tubhyaṃ hinvāno vasiṣṭa gā apo 'dhukṣan sīmavibhiradribhirnaraḥ
analyzed: tubhyam hinvānaḥ vasiṣṭa gāḥ apaḥ dhukṣan sīmavibhiḥ adribhiḥ naraḥ
translated: The men, Vasishtha, urging you on, have milked the waters with their pressing-stones

original: pibendra svāhā prahutaṃ vaṣatkṛtaṃ hotrādāsomaṃ prathamo ya īśiṣe
analyzed: piba indra svāhā prahutam vaṣatkṛtam hotrādāsomam prathamaḥ yaḥ īśiṣe
translated: Drink, O Indra, the offered oblation, the Vasat-uttered, the Soma which the servant of the Hotar first offers to you who are the lord.

original: yajñaiḥ sammiślāḥ pṛṣatībhirṛṣṭibhiryāmañchubhrāso añjiṣu priyā uta
analyzed: yajñaiḥ sammiślāḥ pṛṣatībhiḥ ṛṣṭibhiḥ yāman śubhrāsaḥ añjiṣu priyāḥ uta
translated: Blending with sacrifices, with spotted and sharp-pointed (arrows), the bright ones, dear in the rays,

original: āsadyā barhirbharatasya sūnavaḥ potrādā somaṃ pibatā divo naraḥ
analyzed: āsadya barhiḥ bharatasya sūnavaḥ potrāt ā somam pibata divaḥ naraḥ
translated: Having sat on the sacred grass, O sons of Bharata, drink the Soma from the spoon, O men of heaven.

original: ameva naḥ suhavā ā hi gantana ni barhiṣi sadatanā raṇiṣṭana🔽athā mandasva jujuṣāṇo andhasastvaṣṭardevebhirjanibhiḥ sumadgaṇaḥ
analyzed: amā iva naḥ su havāḥ ā hi gantana ni barhiṣi sadatana raṇiṣṭana  athā mandasva jujuṣāṇaḥ andhasaḥ tvaṣṭar devebhiḥ janibhiḥ sumat gaṇaḥ
translated: Come to us, O ye who are easily entreated, sit on the sacred grass, rejoice in the offering.🔽Then rejoice, O Tvastr, with the willing, with the juices, with the gods, with the kinsmen, with the good company.

original: ā vakṣi devāniha vipra yakṣi cośan hotarni ṣadā yoniṣu triṣu
analyzed: ā vakṣi devān iha vipra yakṣi ca uśan hotar ni sadā yoniṣu triṣu
translated: Bring the gods hither, O sage, worship them. O Hotar, sit in the three sacred seats.

original: prati vīhi prasthitaṃ somyaṃ madhu pibāgnīdhrāttava bhāgasya tṛpṇuhi
analyzed: prati vīhi prasthitam somyam madhu piba āgnīdhrāt tava bhāgasya tṛpṇuhi
translated: Turn to the offered, the Soma-mixed (drink). Drink from the Agnidh's (fire) and be satisfied with thy portion.

original: eṣa sya te tanvo nṛmṇavardhanaḥ saha ojaḥ pradivi bāhvorhitaḥ
analyzed: eṣa sya te tanvaḥ nṛmṇa vardhanaḥ sahaḥ ojaḥ pradivi bāhvoḥ hitaḥ
translated: This is thine, O mighty one, which increases thy manly power, thy strength, thy arm, which is set in the firmament.

original: tubhyaṃ suto maghavan tubhyamābhṛtastvamasya brāhmanādā tṛpat piba
analyzed: tubhyam sutaḥ maghavan tubhyam ābhṛtaḥ tvam asya brāhmanāt ā tṛpat piba
translated: The Soma is pressed for thee, O bountiful one, it is brought to thee. Be thou satisfied with it, O Brahmanaspati, and drink.

original: juṣethāṃ yajñaṃ bodhataṃ havasya me satto hotā nividaḥ pūrvyā anu
analyzed: juṣethām yajñam bodhatam havasya me sattaḥ hotā nividaḥ pūrvyāḥ anu
translated: Accept the sacrifice, be ye aware of my call, sit as Hotar, O Satta, according to the ancient ordinances.

original: achā rājānā nama etyāvṛtaṃ praśāstrādā pibataṃ somyaṃ madhu
analyzed: achā rājānā namaḥ etya āvṛtam praśāstrāt ā pibatam somyam madhu
translated: Come to the homage, O ye Kings, come to the covering. Rule, and drink the Soma-mixed (drink).

original: mandasva hotrādanu joṣamandhaso 'dhvaryavaḥ sa pūrṇāṃvaṣṭyāsicam
analyzed: mandasva hotrāt anu joṣam andhasaḥ dhvaryavaḥ sa pūrṇām avaṣṭyā sicam
translated: Rejoice in the Hotri's portion of the juice, O Adhvaryus, fill the cup to overflowing.

original: tasmā etaṃ bharata tadvaśo dadirhotrād somaṃ draviṇodaḥ piba ṛtubhiḥ
analyzed: tasmai etam bharata tad vaśaḥ dadiḥ hotrāt somam draviṇaḥ daḥ piba ṛtubhiḥ
translated: To him, O Bharata, give that which is his due. The giver of wealth, drink Soma by the seasons.

original: yamu pūrvamahuve tamidaṃ huve sedu havyo dadiryo nāma patyate
analyzed: yamu pūrvam ahuve tam idam huve sedu havyaḥ dadiḥ yaḥ nāma patyate
translated: Whom I have served before, to him I offer. He is worthy of the offering, he who is called the Lord.

original: adhvaryubhiḥ prasthitaṃ somyaṃ madhu potrāt somaṃ d / p / ṛ /
analyzed: adhvaryubhiḥ prasthitam somyam madhu potrāt somam d p ṛ
translated: The Soma-worthy mead set forth by the Adhvaryus, from the Potri drink Soma, O giver of wealth, by the seasons.

original: medyantu te vahnayo yebhirīyase 'riṣaṇyan vīḷayasvā vanaspate
analyzed: medyantu te vahnayaḥ yebhiḥ īyase riṣaṇyan vīḍayasva vanaspate
translated: Let your fires be kindled, wherewith thou movest, O irresistible one. Delight, O tree.

original: āyūyā dhṛṣṇo abhigūryā tvaṃ neṣṭrāt somaṃ / / /🔽apād dhotrāduta potrādamattota neṣṭrādajuṣata prayo hitam
analyzed: āyūya dhṛṣṇo abhigūrya tvam neṣṭrāt somam  apāt hotrāt uta potrāt amatta uta neṣṭrāt ajuṣata prayaḥ hitam
translated: Be thou strong, O daring one, be thou victorious. From the Neshtri drink Soma, O giver of wealth.🔽He has drunk from the Hotri, and from the Potri, and has rejoiced in the Neshtri's portion. He has accepted the offering.

original: turīyaṃ pātramamṛktamamartyaṃ draviṇodāḥ pibatu drāviṇodasaḥ
analyzed: turīyam pātram amṛktam amartyam draviṇaḥ dāḥ pibatu drāviṇodasaḥ
translated: The fourth immortal cup, the immortal one, may the givers of wealth drink, O givers of wealth.

original: arvāñcamadya yayyaṃ nṛvāhaṇaṃ rathaṃ yuñjāthāmiha vāṃ vimocanam
analyzed: arvāñcam adya yayyam nṛvāhaṇam ratham yuñjāthām iha vām vimocanam
translated: Today, O ye who bring men hither, yoke the car that comes hitherward. Here is your loosing.

original: pṛṅktaṃ havīṃṣi madhunā hi kaṃ gatamathā somaṃ pibataṃ vājinīvasū
analyzed: pṛṅktam havīṃṣi madhunā hi kam gatam athā somam pibatam vājinīvasū
translated: Anoint the oblations with honey, and then drink Soma, O ye who are rich in wealth.

original: joṣyagne samidhaṃ joṣyāhutiṃ joṣi brahma janyaṃ joṣisuṣṭutim
analyzed: joṣi agne samidham joṣi āhutim joṣi brahma janyam joṣi suṣṭutim
translated: Be pleased, O Agni, with the kindling-stick, be pleased with the offering. Be pleased with the prayer of the suppliant, be pleased with the praise.

original: viśvebhirviśvān ṛtunā vaso maha uśan devānuśataḥ pāyayā haviḥ
analyzed: viśvebhiḥ viśvān ṛtunā vaso mahaḥ uśan devān uśataḥ pāyaya haviḥ
translated: With the All-gods, with the All-seasons, O Vasu, eager, make the offering-oblation reach the gods in a stream.

original: udu ṣya devaḥ savitā savāya śaśvattamaṃ tadapā vahnirasthāt
analyzed: udu sya devaḥ savitā savāya śaśvattamam tad apāḥ vahniḥ asthāt
translated: The god Savitar has risen for worship: most lasting, that, has Agni taken his place.

original: nūnaṃ devebhyo vi hi dhāti ratnamathābhajad vītihotraṃ svastau
analyzed: nūnam devebhyaḥ vi hi dhāti ratnam atha abhajat vītihotram svastau
translated: Now he distributes treasure to the gods, and has apportioned the all-sacrificing in prosperity.

original: viśvasya hi śruṣṭaye deva ūrdhvaḥ pra bāhavā pṛthupāṇiḥ sisarti
analyzed: viśvasya hi śruṣṭaye devaḥ ūrdhvaḥ pra bāhū ā pṛthu pāṇiḥ sisarti
translated: For the hearing of all, the god, erect, with wide arms, with broad hands, sends forth.

original: āpaścidasya vrata ā nimṛgrā ayaṃ cid vāto ramate parijman🔽āśubhiścid yān vi mucāti nūnamarīramadatamānaṃ cidetoḥ
analyzed: āpaḥ cit asya vrate ā nimṛgrāḥ ayam cit vātaḥ ramate parijman  āśubhiḥ cit yān vi mucāti nūnam arīrama datamānam cit etoḥ
translated: Even the waters are subject to his law: this very wind delights in his wide-spread course.🔽Whom he sends forth with swift ones, even from far away, he delights most of all in the sacrifice.

original: ahyarṣūṇāṃ cin nyayānaviṣyāmanu vrataṃ saviturmokyāgāt
analyzed: ahyarṣūṇām cit vratam savituḥ mokyā āgāt
translated: Even of the swift ones he has gone to the end of the path: after the law of Savitar the freed one has come.

original: punaḥ samavyad vitataṃ vayantī madhyā kartornyadhācchakma dhīraḥ
analyzed: punar samavyat vitatam vayantī madhyā kartoḥ nyadhāt śakma dhīraḥ
translated: The wise one has put together again the scattered, has placed in the middle of the work the strength.

original: ut saṃhāyāsthād vy ṛtūṃ adardhararamatiḥsavitā deva āgāt
analyzed: ud saṃhāya asthāt vi ṛtūm devaḥ āgāt
translated: He has risen up, he has divided the seasons: the bountiful god Savitar has come.

original: nānaukāṃsi duryo viśvamāyurvi tiṣṭhate prabhavaḥ śoko agneḥ
analyzed: nānā okāṃsi duryaḥ viśvam āyuḥ vi tiṣṭhate prabhavaḥ śokaḥ agneḥ
translated: The various ships, all life, stand apart: the overflowing of the fire is the prosperity.

original: jyeṣṭhaṃ mātā sūnave bhāgamādhādanvasyaketamiṣitaṃ savitrā
analyzed: jyeṣṭham mātā sūnave bhāgam ādhāt anvasyaketam iṣitam savitrā
translated: The mother has assigned to the son the highest portion: his own wish, impelled by Savitar.

original: samāvavarti viṣṭhito jigīṣurviśveṣāṃ kāmaścaratāmamābhūt
analyzed: samāvavarti viṣṭhitaḥ jigīṣuḥ viśveṣām kāmaḥ caratām amā abhūt
translated: He turned back, standing victorious, and became the desire of all moving beings to be conquered

original: śaśvānapo vikṛtaṃ hitvyāgādanu vrataṃ saviturdaivyasya
analyzed: śaśvān apaḥ vikṛtam hitvā agāt anu vratam savituḥ daivyasya
translated: He went to the divine Savitar's law, leaving behind the varied form of the ever-moving waters

original: tvayā hitamapyamapsu bhāgaṃ dhanvānvā mṛgayaso vi tasthuḥ
analyzed: tvayā hitam apyam apsu bhāgam dhanva anvā mṛgayasaḥ vi tasthuḥ
translated: The share which thou hast allotted to the waters, or the wild beasts which have spread abroad

original: vanāni vibhyo nakirasya tāni vratā devasya saviturminanti
analyzed: vanāni vibhyaḥ nakirasya tāni vratā devasya savituḥ minanti
translated: The woods which belong to the birds, none of these violate the law of the god Savitar

original: yādrādhyaṃ varuṇo yonimapyamaniśitaṃ nimiṣi jarbhurāṇaḥ
analyzed: yādrādhyam varuṇaḥ yonim apyam aniśitam nimiṣi jarbhurāṇaḥ
translated: The swift Varuna, who has fixed the abode of the moving waters, who is sharpened by the unsheathed sword

original: viśvo mārtāṇḍo vrajamā paśurgāt sthaśo janmāni savitā vyākaḥ
analyzed: viśvaḥ mārtāṇḍaḥ vrajamā paśuḥ gāt sthaśas janmāni savitā vyākaḥ
translated: The all-supporting Martada has gone to the house as a beast; Savitar has assigned the births

original: na yasyendro varuṇo na mitro vratamaryamā na minanti rudraḥ
analyzed: na yasya indraḥ varuṇaḥ na mitraḥ vratam aryamā na minanti rudraḥ
translated: Whose law neither Indra nor Varuna nor Mitra nor Aryaman nor Rudra violate

original: nārātayastamidaṃ svasti huve devaṃ savitāraṃ namobhiḥ
analyzed: na arātayaḥ tam idam svasti huve devam savitāram namobhiḥ
translated: To him, the blameless, I invoke this blessing, the god Savitar, with salutations

original: bhagaṃ dhiyaṃ vājayantaḥ purandhiṃ narāśaṃso gnāspatirno avyāḥ🔽āye vāmasya saṃgathe rayīṇāṃ priyā devasya savituḥ syāma
analyzed: bhagam dhiyam vājayantaḥ purandhim narāśaṃsaḥ gnāspatiḥ naḥ avyāḥ  āye vāmasya saṃgathe rayīṇām priyāḥ devasya savituḥ syāma
translated: The men, longing for strength, the bountiful Narāśaṁsa, the lord of the people, have come to Bhaga, the wise one🔽To the gathering place of wealth, to the union of riches, may we be dear to the god Savitar

original: asmabhyaṃ tad divo adbhyaḥ pṛthivyāstvayā dattaṃ kāmyaṃ rādha ā gāt
analyzed: asmabhyam tat divaḥ adbhyaḥ pṛthivyāḥ tvayā dattam kāmyam rādhaḥ ā gāt
translated: From you, from heaven, from the waters, from the earth, may that desirable gift which you have given come to us

original: śaṃ yat stotṛbhya āpaye bhavātyuruśaṃsāya savitarjaritre🔽grāvāṇeva tadidathaṃ jarethe gṛdhreva vṛkṣaṃ nidhimantamacha
analyzed: śam yat stotṛbhyaḥ āpaye bhavāti uru śaṃsāya savitar jaritre  grāvāṇā iva tadidatham jarethe gṛdhrā iva vṛkṣam nidhimantam acha
translated: When thou art gracious to the worshippers, O thou who givest wealth, O Savitar, to the singer,🔽Ye two move like two pressing-stones to the work, like a vulture to the tree that hath a treasure.

original: brahmāṇeva vidatha ukthaśāsā dūteva havyā janyā purutrā
analyzed: brahmāṇā iva vidathe uktha śāsā dūtā iva havyā janyā purutrā
translated: Like two priests in the assembly, directing the lauds, like two envoys in many places, the offerings,

original: prātaryāvāṇā rathyeva vīrājeva yamā varamā sacethe
analyzed: prātaryāvāṇā rathyā iva vīrājā iva yamā varamā sacethe
translated: Like two heroes in a chariot, like two brothers, O ye who come in the morning, ye two are united.

original: mene iva tanvā śumbhamāne dampatīva kratuvidā janeṣu
analyzed: mene iva tanvā śumbhamāne dampatī iva kratu vidā janeṣu
translated: Like two thoughts adorning the body, like two spouses in the people, knowing the rite,

original: śṛṅgeva naḥ prathamā gantamarvāk chaphāviva jarbhurāṇātarobhiḥ
analyzed: śṛṅgā iva naḥ prathamā gantam arvāk śaphau iva jarbhurāṇā a tarobhiḥ
translated: Come to us like two horns, the first, from afar, like two knees, bending with the swift-moving horses.

original: cakravākeva prati vastorusrārvāñcā yātaṃ rathyeva śakrā🔽nāveva naḥ pārayataṃ yugeva nabhyeva na upadhīva pradhīva
analyzed: cakravākā iva prati vastā urusrā arvāñcā yātam rathyā iva śakrā  nāvā iva naḥ pārayatam yugā iva nabhyā iva naḥ upadhī iva pradhī iva
translated: Come hither, like two cakravākas to the lake, O ye who travel in a chariot, like two Śakras.🔽Carry us across like two ships, like two yokes, like two beams, like two supports, like two props.

original: śvāneva no ariṣaṇyā tanūnāṃ khṛgaleva visrasaḥ pātamasmān
analyzed: śvānā iva naḥ ariṣaṇyā tanūnām khṛgalā iva visrasaḥ pātam asmān
translated: Protect us, like two dogs, from the harm of our bodies, like two butchers from the entrails, protect us.

original: vātevājuryā nadyeva rītirakṣī iva cakṣuṣā yātamarvāk
analyzed: vātā iva ajuryā nadyā iva rītiḥ akṣī iva cakṣuṣā yātam arvāk
translated: Come hither, like two winds that urge on, like two rivers that flow, like two eyes with sight.

original: hastāviva tanve śambhaviṣṭhā pādeva no nayataṃ vasyo acha
analyzed: hastau iva tanve śambhaviṣṭhā pādā iva naḥ nayatam vasyaḥ acha
translated: Most auspicious, like two hands to the body, like two feet, lead us to what is better.

original: oṣṭhāviva madhvāsne vadantā stanāviva pipyataṃ jīvasenaḥ
analyzed: oṣṭhau iva madhvāsne vadantā stanau iva pipyatam jīvasenaḥ
translated: Like two lips, speaking with sweet honey, like two breasts, swell for us with nourishment to live.

original: nāseva nastanvo rakṣitārā karṇāviva suśrutā bhūtamasme
analyzed: nāsā iva naḥ tanvaḥ rakṣitārā karṇau iva su śrutā bhūtam asme
